instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where can I find fire salts?
output: A flame atronach's body might provide fire salt. They're dangerous creatures that can be summoned by wizards. Of course, it would be much easier to check with an alchemist. They occasionally have them for sale.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry to hear that.
output: Shutting this place down would dishonor my family's heritage, but what other choice will I have?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll get some for you.
output: You will? Thank you! Ten pinches of fire salts should give me all I need to bring this forge back to life.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Goodbye.
output: Return anytime. You're quite welcome here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Goodbye.
output: Remember, nothing but genuine fire salts will do... the forge knows the difference.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Goodbye.
output: If you need any more smithing work, come see me again.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That was from Brynjolf. Get the message?
output: I can't believe you did that. You people are monsters! You demand payment for protection and you can't even protect yourselves. Here, take your coin and tell Brynjolf to leave us alone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Heard any rumors lately?
output: There have been whispers. A boy, up in Windhelm, name of Aventus Aretino. Been trying to contact... the Dark Brotherhood.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you heard any rumors lately?
output: Lucan at the Riverwood Trader had his store broken into the other night. Oddly enough, barely anything's been stolen.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Heard any rumors lately?
output: Nobody trusts those mages, way up north in their college. Gods only know what they do up there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What would you ask of me?
output: Your fealty is precious to me. I will make good use of it. You bear my ring.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Didn't I just kill you?
output: And skillfully, too. I've been watching you for ages, it seems. You have the makings of a fine hunter. You may even be my champion. Perhaps.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you Hircine?
output: I am the spirit of the hunt, just one glimpse of the glorious stalker that your kind calls Hircine.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I did as you asked.
output: And found my favor. That skin will serve you well, child.  Look more closely at it. My glories shall protect you from all this world's grievances.  Good hunting.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He's done me no wrong. I won't kill him.
output: There is no retribution in the hunt. It is not vengeance I seek, but the blood course of a living hunt. There are others who would gladly accept my favor.  They will hunt him while you delay. Your choice.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It shall be done as you ask.
output: Fly, my hunter. There are others who vie for my favor. A bit of competition. Don't dally while the prey flees.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Will you remove the curse from this ring?
output: I may consider it. But you must first do a service for my glory.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Wait here.
output: All right. All right. All right. All right. All right.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Follow me.
output: Good! I've got a few scores to settle. Good! I've got a few scores to settle. Good! I've got a few scores to settle. Good! I've got a few scores to settle. Good! I've got a few scores to settle.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Won't happen again.
output: Good. Glad we straightened that out. Good. Glad we straightened that out. Good. Glad we straightened that out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the problem?
output: You shouldn't leave weapons laying around. Someone could get hurt. And if I see you do it again, that someone will be you. You shouldn't leave weapons laying around. Someone could get hurt. And if I see you do it again, that someone will be you. You shouldn't leave weapons laying around. Someone could get hurt. And if I see you do it again, that someone will be you. Have I made myself clear? Have I made myself clear? Have I made myself clear?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Whatever.
output: I've got my eye on you. I've got my eye on you. I've got my eye on you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Too bad. There's more where that came from.
output: Can't say I've heard of any laws against... whatever that is you're doing. But I'll lock you up if I have to. Can't say I've heard of any laws against... whatever that is you're doing. But I'll lock you up if I have to. Can't say I've heard of any laws against... whatever that is you're doing. But I'll lock you up if I have to.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've avenged you and your mother.
output: You did? Maybe that's why I'm so sleepy now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The master vampire Movarth is dead.
output: By the Eight, I didn't think you could do it! Now maybe we can put all this behind us. Take this as a token of our gratitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have Alva's journal.
output: By Ysgramor's axe! It's true. Morthal owes you a debt. Unfortunately Morthal is still in danger. The journal mentions Movarth, a powerful master vampire that I had assumed was destroyed. I'll gather together some able-bodied warriors to clean out Movarth's lair. They'll be waiting outside for you to lead them. Here is your reward for solving the murder, but I have another request.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Alva set the fire. She's the murderer.
output: So Alva did it to get Hroggar for herself? I should have suspected her.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Actually, she's a vampire. She planned to enslave the town.
output: By the gods! I assume you have proof.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The Greybeards might know.
output: You're probably right. I was hoping to avoid having to involve them in this, but it seems we have no choice.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: No, I've never heard of anything like that.
output: I was afraid you were going to say that. I guess there's nothing for it. We'll have to ask the Greybeards for help. I hoped to avoid involving them in this, but we have no other choice.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It is. Carry on.
output: Ah. Thank you! Excellent. Now... where were we?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I just want to know how to defeat Alduin.
output: Ah. Of course. Not everyone has an appreciation for the artistic wonders of the world. Let me see if I can find the right panel...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you need?
output: Have you ever heard of such a thing? A Shout that can knock a dragon out of the sky?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You wanted to see me?
output: Yes, youngling. Have a seat.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You think Ulfric knows where that dragon came from?
output: Well... maybe not. Dragons haven't been seen in Skyrim for an age or more. But wherever that dragon came from, and whatever it wants, Ulfric will get to the bottom of it. You can count on that. Besides, you have your own score to settle with the Empire now. And with that dragon.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You think General Tullius knows where that dragon came from?
output: No. Not yet. After all, a dragon... something out of old tales and legends... no one could have expected that. No. Not yet. After all, a dragon... something out of old tales and legends... no one could have expected that. But you can bet he'll be trying to figure it out. This could shift the whole balance of the war. But you can bet he'll be trying to figure it out. This could shift the whole balance of the war. If you want to help stop that dragon, your best bet is to go to Solitude and join up with the Legion. If you want to help stop that dragon, your best bet is to go to Solitude and join up with the Legion.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: General Tullius ordered my execution. Why would I want to help him?
output: I don't blame you for being angry about it. I would be, too, in your shoes. I don't blame you for being angry about it. I would be, too, in your shoes. But it was all a mistake. You weren't supposed to be on that cart with those Stormcloak traitors. But it was all a mistake. You weren't supposed to be on that cart with those Stormcloak traitors. And the Imperial Legion needs your help, especially now, with that dragon out there somewhere, and Ulfric back on the loose. And the Imperial Legion needs your help, especially now, with that dragon out there somewhere, and Ulfric back on the loose.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It will be done.
output: Talos guide you, lad.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It will be done.
output: Talos guide you, lass.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I work for the honor of the Companions.
output: Lad, I know what you've been up to.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Aela and I work to avenge Skjor's death.
output: Your hearts are full of grief, and my own weeps at the loss of Skjor.  But his death was avenged long ago. You have taken more lives than honor demanded. The cycle of retaliation may continue for some time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: CWSharedInfoStack
output: Good. You've got real fire in you. I like that... Talos guide you. Good. You've got real fire in you. I like that... Talos guide you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Lead on then.
output: I'll meet you outside!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't need a guide.
output: Oh, really? You're just like my brother. Fine, but if you change your mind, I'll be right here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I rescued <Alias=Victim>.
output: So I hear. You've brought honor to the Companions and yourself. So I hear. You've brought honor to the Companions and yourself.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are the Sacred Trials?
output: It's an old Nord Tradition, a test to prove your worth in the eyes of Kyne. Show that you're a hunter and no simple butcher. Kyne teaches us to respect the beasts and blesses the hunter who will face their champions. True Nord hunters are those who survive the Trials.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Not me. I don't believe in the Divines.
output: Good. This is Skyrim, and we should honor the old ways. These foreigners don't even respect their own gods, much less Kyne and her Sacred Trials.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's wrong with the Divines?
output: They're stolen idols! Imposter gods, sold by silver tongues. No thank you. Froki will not forget Kyne, or her Sacred Trials.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about Kyne.
output: Those sycophants in the Temple would call her Kynareth. Just a pale shadow of the truth, like all the Temple Divines. Kyne! Blessed Warrior-Wife. Shor's widow, sacred to any true Nord hunter. She's the mother of men and beasts, and her veil is the storm.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do I need to do?
output: I'll anoint you with the symbol of the wolf, the crab and the skeever. This will compel the guardian to appear when you reach his lair.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm not interested.
output: That's what an old man gets for thinking the younger generation might be interested in learning some honor.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes. Tell me what to do.
output: You must defeat guardian beasts, blessed by Kyne.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you have there?
output: Hey! You dropped this back there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm here about Goldenglow Estate.
output: I don't deal in land or property. Now, if you're looking for goods, you've come to the right person.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was right there. He almost killed me.
output: I'm so sorry. I hope the Eight give you more peace in the future.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Actually, I'm not sure. I need to think about it.
output: I see... Well, the Legion will still be here when you change your mind. Rikke believes in you. And I'm starting to see why. Consider this. What greater glory than to serve the Emperor and his citizens here in Skyrim, in these days of greatest need?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready to take the Oath.
output: Well, then. Repeat after me. "Upon my honor I do swear undying loyalty to the Emperor, Titus Mede II..."

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready to take the oath.
output: Changed your mind? Decided you want to soldier for the Empire after all?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DBDawnstarDoorPlayerResponse1
output: Welcome home.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Actually, I'm looking for this old guy hiding out in Riften.
output: Expecting free information, eh? Help me deal with business first, then we'll see how I can help you. Besides, you look like your pockets are a little light on coin, am I right?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hold on - I just wanted some information.
output: And I'm busy. You help me out, and I'll help you out. That's just how it is.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This will be easier without you getting in my way.
output: Well, I was only trying to help. Fine, I'll just save myself then. Thank you for letting me out of that cage.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I can handle this on my own.
output: Well, I... If you're sure... I'll just be on my way then. Please do be careful, and thank you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You should get yourself to safety.
output: Don't you need my help?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Let me leave with the books, and there won't be any more trouble. (Persuade)
output: Fine. Take them and be gone. Never return here, or else you'll face my full wrath.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: A guardian skeever? Are you serious?
output: Don't mock it, pup. Even the lowliest beasts can kill the weak and arrogant. We'll try more powerful enemies next, if you survive this.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do I need to do?
output: Return when you've defeated the guardian wolf, crab and skeever.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

You seem to be a little short on coin. Come back and see me when you've got the gold. You seem to be a little short on coin. Come back and see me when you've got the gold. You seem to be a little short on coin. Come back and see me when you've got the gold. You seem to be a little short on coin. Come back and see me when you've got the gold.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Consider yourself hired. (<global=hirelinggold>)
output: You have chosen wisely. Lead on, and I shall follow.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Consider yourself hired. (<global=hirelinggold>)
output: What dangers and wonders shall we discover in the frozen wastes? I can hardly wait to find out!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What will I face in the Pilgrim's Path?
output: I wish I could help you, but I've been a prisoner in this very chamber for the last quarter century. The only possible help I've come across are the remains of some poor fellow who was trying to follow in your footsteps. Perhaps his journal can help?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're right. I could use some help.
output: I shall do my best.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready for my first assignment.
output: Welcome to the Legion, auxiliary. Listen up.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Dead.
output: Then... it's over and my death wasn't in vain. I owe you a great deal, Nightingale.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have the Key.
output: The Key! You have the Skeleton Key! I never thought I'd see it again. And Mercer Frey?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I did this for Nocturnal.
output: That's quite a noble sentiment for someone in our... well, in your line of work. My only regret is that you had to undertake this task alone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I heard you know about Elder Scrolls.
output: Elder Scrolls. Indeed. But I cannot go to it, not poor Septimus, for I... I have arisen beyond its grasp. The Empire. They absconded with them. Or so they think. The ones they saw. The ones they thought they saw. I know of one. Forgotten. Sequestered.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've brought all the blood you require.
output: I can almost... hear them. I feel their life energy. Come, I will make the mixture.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: If you don't get away from me right now, I may kill you myself.
output: I was only trying to help you, you know! I hope the Caller turns you inside out!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Never mind. Forget I mentioned it.
output: Hmph.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You will die now.
output: That remains to be seen.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This is what you want? To slave for others? What about your own destiny?
output: Boethiah talks about leaving your mark, a sign of your passing.... Well, you can make a mark on the world without treachery and murder. Whenever a man's life is saved by armor made with these hands, these hands have changed that man's destiny and his family's. So you can tell that heartless Daedra bitch I'm done doing her dirty work. Mind my words or I'll mind them for you: I'm slave to no man, no god, and no Daedra.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You aren't afraid to die?
output: A man who feels no fear has no heart. I know fear. But it does not control me. If you desire to fight me, then let's get this over with.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Boethiah is displeased. She wants you dead.
output: The Prince of Plots usually gets what she wants. I'm surprised I'm not dead already. She must have had some reason to keep me alive so long.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you're Boethiah's champion, eh?
output: That was a long time ago.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me, what's it like being Boethiah's champion?
output: I told you. I'm done with all that. There's enough blood on these hands. I'm interested in creating things now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you doing well, serving as Jarl?
output: Ahhh. Quite fine my friend. Quite fine. So sad what happened to young Elisif. Tragic really. Such a young and pretty girl. But we should be done with murders in the Blue Palace. I've stepped up security around here. Was in over her head, I'm afraid.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm having some difficulties with the guards. Can you take care of that?
output: Hmm... Yes, I've heard about all that fuss. I myself know it's all a terrible, terrible misunderstanding. I'm quite sure you're innocent in all this. This one time only, I'll grant you special immunity for any past transgressions, real or perceived. But going forward, I'm sure you realize that your fate is in your own hands. And the law can not be bent for personal friendships.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Your father said to speak to you.
output: My father doesn't know anything about me.  But I know about him. And about the war. More than he might think. So the disgusting pig sent you to bother me? One day, I'll tear his face apart so he can leave me alone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've heard there's trouble with your children.
output: Yes, my youngest son. He's a dark child. I don't know what to do with him. He was always a quiet lad, but lately... something has changed. He's become brooding. Violent. He won't say a word to me, but I don't know how I upset him. If you could speak to him. Draw out the truth. I would be immensely grateful.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You couldn't afford my time.
output: Fine, leave me to die.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can I do?
output: My camp is nearby in the ruins of Nilheim. Get me there safely and you'll be rewarded.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you ok?
output: Bandits attacked and ransacked my cart. Can you help me?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hold on... you shot me!
output: No, I saved your life. My arrow was tipped with a unique paralytic poison. It slowed your heart and kept you from bleeding out. Had I intended to kill you, we wouldn't be having this conversation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who were you talking to?
output: Emperor Pelagius III. Now surely even you know about Pelagius' decree? On his deathbed - oh, and this was inspired - he forbade... death! That's right! Death! Outlawed!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hold on, I need a minute.
output: This isn't a damn summer picnic! Hurry up. We need to hit them before they know we're here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the situation?
output: Looks like the damned rebels got here first. No matter, we have the element of surprise. Prepare to move out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the mission?
output: We're going to make sure he doesn't get his hands on it. The rest of my men are already assembling outside Korvanjund. I'll meet you there as soon as I finish up here. Ulfric's right-hand man, Galmar Stonefist, has located what he believes is the final resting place of the Jagged Crown.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready, ma'am.
output: Follow me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Did you just talk?
output: Skyrim is now host to giant, flying lizards and two-legged cat-men... and you're surprised by me? Yes. I just talked. And am continuing to do so.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've got things to do.
output: I know, I know... Wars to fight, dragons to confront, guild business to conduct.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what could a dog need help with?
output: My master and I had a bit of a falling out. We got into an argument and it got rather... heated. He's kicked me out until I find someone who can settle our disagreement. That's where you come in.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: There are Thalmor agents in the Ratway. Looking for you.
output: And no doubt you're one of them. Leave me alone!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The Thalmor have found you. You need to get out of here.
output: Oh, how reassuring! Most likely you're with the Thalmor and this is just a trick to get me to open the door!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Delphine said to "remember the 30th of Frostfall."
output: Ah. Indeed, indeed. I do remember. Delphine really is alive, then? You'd better come in then and tell me how you found me and what you want.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Open the door.
output: I told you to go away. I'm not opening this door for anybody!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What happened on the 30th of Frostfall?
output: It was a cold day. The end of Frostfall is nearly winter in the Jerall Mountains. We heard the news at Cloud Ruler by courier, riding hard from the Imperial City. 30th of Frostfall, 171. Thirty years ago. The Great War started that day. The Thalmor ambassador delivered his ultimatum to the Emperor Titus Mede: the heads of every Blades agent within the Aldmeri Dominion. I knew, that day, that it was truly the beginning of the end.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He's dead. You're next.
output: Hey! Somebody get down here! Help!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yeah.
output: Boss was looking for you - said he'd be up at the summit. Better not keep him waiting.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've found Nettlebane for you.
output: Oh. I... well, I honestly didn't expect you to come back. Of course, I'm glad you did! Now... I don't really want to touch that thing, though. Do you think you could handle the next steps?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've got the sap.
output: Wonderful. I'll use it to repair the tree. Thank you so much for all your help.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: No deal. Take the axe and take back Barbas!
output: Hrmph. You're no fun at all. Guess I'll have to make my own fun elsewhere. And with the pup back, I'll be restored to my full power. There's a whole world just waiting for me!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd really like to keep this axe...
output: And I'm sure Barbas doesn't want me to have that axe. He'd want it this way. The choice is yours, friend. We're all counting on you to make the right decision. Put him out of our misery! And I could absorb the spirit of poor, dead Barbas. He'd still be reunited with me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You were looking for me?
output: Yes, I think you'll be just what I need.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DA03VileGreetingBranchTopic
output: By all means, let's hear it. It's the least I could do, since you already helped me grant one final wish for my last worshippers... They were suffering so from vampirism, and begged me for a cure. Then you came and ended their misery! I couldn't have planned it better myself. So, what's your heart's desire? What kind of deal can we strike?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds easy enough. Let's go find him.
output: Thank you. Now, since he banished me, Vile's been rather weak. He can't manifest very far from one of his shrines. I know there's a cult that worships him at Haemar's Shame. We should be able to talk to him there. If this works out, I'll make sure you're rewarded. Just don't trust any offer he makes you... okay?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you're a little lost puppy?
output: Very funny. My master is Clavicus Vile, Daedric prince of wishes. As you can imagine, he's quite the important person.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The power to crush all before me!
output: Really? Power? You're a dragonborn; you already have more power than most people who aren't immense, fire-breathing monsters.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Nothing I couldn't handle.
output: That's what I like to hear. I'll get the full report from Legate Rikke. Now then...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: We lost a lot of good men. I hope it was worth it.
output: That's not for you to decide. Soldier. I wouldn't have sent you in the first place if it wasn't going to be worth it. Now then...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's the Jagged Crown. Legate Rikke sent me to deliver it to you.
output: Excellent work, soldier. I have to admit, I had my doubts it even existed. Did you run into any trouble?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The Stormcloaks were there ahead of us.
output: Yes. Well, I didn't respond as quickly to the Legate's suggestion as perhaps I should have. But at least we ended up with the damn crown. Now then...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What will you do now?
output: There is a certain beast in these lands. Large, majestic.  It's said that Hircine will commune with whoever slays it. I tracked it into these woods, but then had my... accident with the child. I've been looking for a way to appease Hircine.  I want to beg his forgiveness. Give him back the ring. But while I'm stuck in here, the beast wanders free.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What brings you to this remote place?
output: The ice entombs the heart. The bane of Kagrenac and Dagoth Ur.  To harness it is to know. The fundaments. The Dwemer lockbox hides it from me. The Elder Scroll gives insight deeper than the deep ones, though. To bring about the opening.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, where is the Scroll?
output: Here.  Well, here as in this plane. Mundus. Tamriel. Nearby, relatively speaking. On the cosmological scale, it's all nearby.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you so eager to open the box?
output: The box contains the heart. The essence of a god. I have devoted my life to the Elder Scrolls, but their knowledge is a passing awareness when compared to the encompassing mind of divinity. The Dwemer were the last to touch it. It was thought to have been destroyed by the Nerevarine, but my lord told me otherwise.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where is this "Blackreach"?
output: Under deep. Below the dark. The hidden keep. Tower Mzark.  Alftand. The point of puncture, of first entry, of the tapping.  Delve to its limits, and Blackreach lies just beyond. But not all can enter there. Only Septimus knows the hidden key to loose the lock to jump beneath the deathly rock.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've got the sap.
output: But... I can't run the Temple without the support of people who are inspired by the Gildergreen. How can this little tree bring new worshippers?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Maurice said that renewal is more important than maintenance.
output: I... you're right of course. It can be hard to hear the winds of Kynareth when all you hear are the rabble in the temple. I'm sure that, in time, this little sapling will grow into a new Gildergreen that will tower over Whiterun. Thank you.  Death feeds new life.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why did Vile kick you out?
output: Well... I guess you could say I got on his nerves. I tend to be the voice of reason and he finds that... irksome. He couldn't just kill me, you see. We're technically part of each other. But he was able to banish me from his domain. Of course, because of our separation, Vile is now much weaker. I guess he figured it was a small price to pay for not having to listen to me anymore.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DA03VileOffer0
output: There's an axe. An incredibly powerful axe. An axe powerful enough for me to have quite a bit of fun, indeed. As I recall, it's resting in Rimerock Burrow. Barbas can lead you right to it. The little mutt might even earn his place back at my side. If you bring it to me, I'll grant you my boon. No strings attached. No messy surprises. At least, not for you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm just here to reunite you with Barbas.
output: Ugh. That insufferable pup? Forget it. Request denied. No deal. I'm glad to be rid of him. Even if it does mean I'm stuck in this pitiful shrine, in the back end of... nowhere. Well... perhaps there is a way he could earn his place back at my side. Maybe. But no promises.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I see he's having a good influence on you.
output: Yeah, rub it in. Just imagine what I could get done with my full power and none of these pesky "morals." Still, I've got this axe, and even if I can't use it, I'm sure someone would make a deal for it. Maybe I'll have a word with Molag Bal...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: An end to the civil war that plagues my land.
output: Oh, if I had my full power, granting that would be trivial. I'd simply snap my fingers, and everyone in Skyrim would die. War resolved.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any sweep jobs?
output: One of the quickest ways to make some coin in Skyrim is to clear out some of the wealthier homes of their valuables. If you're interested, I could point out a good place that could use a little housecleaning. What do you say?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any sweep jobs?
output: I think we have a nice wealthy home for you to break into. Think you can clear the place of valuables and keep it quiet?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any sweep jobs?
output: These people just inherited some heirlooms from a relative. Good timing for us, bad timing for them, eh?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any sweep jobs?
output: Just got a tip on this house... should be stuffed with loot. Care to head over there and find out?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any sweep jobs?
output: Got a message from one of my people that this place just came into some coin. Should be a good target. Want to take it?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any sweep jobs?
output: Someone with connections to our Guild wants us to hit this place and send a message by clearing it of valuables. You want to handle it?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any sweep jobs?
output: Good timing. The people in this home recently got one of your fellow Guild mates sent to jail. How about you make them pay for it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any sweep jobs?
output: You can give this house a once over. I hear they're fairly well-off and probably have lots of good stuff ripe for the picking. Sound good?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any sweep jobs?
output: The owner of this place just got an inheritance from a relative lost in the war. Sound like something you can sink your teeth into?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're welcome to join me.
output: I thank you for your kindness.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can I help you?
output: I am a traveler. A pilgrim. I follow the voice of Kynareth wherever it can be heard.  I've dreamed of seeing Eldergleam for years. Might I travel alongside you? I promise not to get in the way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd rather not have company right now.
output: I understand. Some journeys must be taken alone. I'll be here if you change your mind.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you have in mind?
output: Follow me. I think I can convince the tree to help us.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have a better idea?
output: Well... yes. There is something.  It won't repair the tree back at the temple, but we could bring them a new one.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I need sap to fix the Gildergreen.
output: That's abominable. Barbaric. I'll have no part of this. Why didn't you tell me what you intended? You would violate this marvel of Kynareth's glory to fix that half-breed stump in Whiterun?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's wrong?
output: I had no idea you were a man of violence. What exactly are your intentions in this blessed place?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Then stand aside. I have work to do.
output: With pleasure. Nature has a way of finding vengeance, though. You walk a bleak path, friend. One that will lead to suffering.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll just take the sap. Danica was very insistent on having it.
output: Very well. I can't stop you. But I can't bear to watch it, either.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What sort of message?
output: Ah, well, I recently approached Sibbi Black-Briar about buying Frost, one of the finest breeding horses in Skyrim. He agreed to sell. I paid Sibbi half the cost of Frost up front, but before he could deliver, Maven had him locked up. Sibbi believes this exempts him from our deal. I want you to talk to Sibbi for me. Then, I want you to bring me Frost and the Lineage Papers that prove the horse's worth. It does not.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm not interested right now, thanks.
output: That's a real shame. You would've fit the bill nicely.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds easy enough.
output: Good man. You won't regret it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you aware there's a plot to steal Frost?
output: Don't tell me - Sibbi and Louis Letrush? Well, Sibbi is in jail and Letrush is certainly welcome to try. My hired help is more than a match for him.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why is it so run down?
output: Sad, isn't it? We can't afford to keep the place running since these attacks started. Pirates, you see. Raiding all along the coast, from Hammerfell to Vvardenfell. Only the Shatter-Shields appear safe.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I know where the Blood Horkers are.
output: Just in time. This is Adelaisa, one of my superiors from the Company. She's been dispatched to... eh... see to it that we get back on schedule. You should probably speak to her.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you heard of a pirate crew called the Blood Horkers?
output: Heard of them? I've been captaining a crew for 'em well on nine years now. What's it to you?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The pirate haven has been destroyed.
output: I can't express how much easier you've made my job. Ah, yes, your pay. The Company thanks you for your services. Should we ever be able to help you, stop by. Maybe Adelaisa will finally ease up, but I expect she won't.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've got the logbook.
output: How did you get it? No, never mind, I probably shouldn't know. I see... it looks like Suvaris has been traveling to Dawnstar to meet with a pirate crew there. Get to Dawnstar and see what you can find out about these rogues. I'd wager they won't be too far from the tavern. Try to find out where their fortress is. The captain, Stig Salt-Plank, has to know something.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What would it take to identify the buyer? (Bribe)
output: Well, now that you mention it, there is something I've been trying to get my hands on.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Get to the bottom of what?
output: Whatever it is those Psijics are up to. They cannot be trusted. For all we know, he's here to scout out the College. I'm sure they want to undermine our efforts.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What efforts would they be undermining?
output: This! This... Orb. The Eye of Magnus, whatever you want to call it. It's clearly powerful, and no doubt they want it for themselves! I expect to be informed if they make any future attempts to contact you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds easy enough.
output: Ah, you're a smart woman. That's exactly what I wanted to hear.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So what's the plan?
output: Head to the Riften jail and talk to Sibbi. Get him to tell you where Frost and his Lineage Papers are and bring them to me outside Riften. You'll be well paid for your time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the situation?
output: You ready, auxiliary?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm sorry boy, but I'm not who you think I am.
output: Of course you are! I prayed, and you came, and now you'll accept my contract!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Contract?
output: My mother, she... she died. I... I'm all alone now. So they sent me to that terrible orphanage in Riften. Honorhall. The headmistress is an evil, cruel woman. They call her Grelod the Kind. But she's not kind. She's terrible. To all of us. So I ran away, and came home. And performed the Black Sacrament. Now you're here! And you can kill Grelod the Kind!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: (Remain silent)
output: You don't have to say anything. There's no need. You're here, so I know you'll accept my contract.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes, of course... The Black Sacrament...
output: It took so long. So very long. But now that you're here, you can accept my contract.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you all right?
output: It worked! I knew you'd come, I just knew it!  I did the Black Sacrament, over and over. With the body, and the... the things. And then you came! An assassin from the Dark Brotherhood!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That sounds pretty bad...
output: You're damned right it does. I'll never breed another prize-winning goat like Gleda! And don't you think of coming back to Rorikstead until you get her back from that Giant.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So all of this was just a prank?
output: Just a prank? Just a prank? The Daedric Lord of Debauchery does not deal in mere "pranks." This may have begun as a minor amusement, but it wasn't long before I realized you'd make a more interesting bearer of my not-quite-holy staff.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What happened with Gleda again? I'm a little fuzzy on that.
output: You really don't remember stealing a goat and selling her to a Giant? Are you thick? Go get her! At least she's bound to follow you back - you smell just like the fermented feed she likes.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why did you choose me?
output: Let's be honest, here. I don't always think my decisions through.  But you... you're going places. Maybe a little influence from your old uncle Sanguine could help adjust your course a bit...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Thanks, I guess.
output: My pleasure. But I think it's time for you to go. No fun keeping you locked up in here with the staff.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: But the staff is broken.
output: Details, details. The Sanguine Rose breaks all the time and is fixed with but a thought.  In fact, here it is now. Think of it - a never-ending stream of minions. And all of the prestige of being Sanguine's chosen.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's your goat. Now can you help me retrace my steps?
output: Gleda! And not a scratch on her! Happy day! I still can't figure out why you stole her. You left a note explaining it, but half of it was gibberish and the rest had mead spilled on it. Only bit I could make out was "repaying Ysolda in Whiterun," and even that's mostly scribbles. Guess you could try there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you know what I did with it?
output: You went right out to give it to your fiancee! Don't you even remember where you left her? And after you told me that sweet story of how you met in Witchmist Grove! I can see why she left you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm sorry?
output: Sorry's not good enough! Not while my Gleda is still out there, alone and afraid. You kidnapped her and sold her to that Giant.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Was a man named Sam with me?
output: Dibella teaches love and compassion, but that doesn't mean we're just going to tell you what you want to know and let you walk away from this. Pick up your mess, then apologize, and if we think you're sincere we'll consider lending you aid.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yeah, I've been getting that a lot.
output: Aw, what's wrong? Did the engagement fall through? Look, how about we call it even, as long as you bring back the wedding ring? That's really a shame - I was so looking forward to the wedding. You said you'd have all the most interesting guests.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have no idea what you're talking about.
output: Is that so? Does the name Gleda ring a bell? The star beauty of my farm? Kidnapped by a drunk lout and sold to a Giant? You'd better remember her right fast, before I call the guards and have you hauled away.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Okay, how much do I owe you?
output: It's not about the money, really. I wouldn't have given you the wedding ring on credit if you weren't so obviously in love. But if there isn't going to be a wedding, the least you can do is give the ring back. That was one of my best pieces.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's the ring.
output: Excellent! Sorry it didn't work out with you and your lady. I know how excited you were for the wedding. You kept saying it would be a huge ceremony at Morvunskar. You said you even had some magic staff there that would handle all the guests.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What was that story about my fiancee?
output: How could you forget? It was the sweetest story I'd ever heard. You met at the full moon, under the biggest tree in Witchmist Grove, surrounded by fireflies. It was straight out of a storybook.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I really do apologize. I think I've picked up everything.
output: I suppose that'll do. Dibella teaches us forgiveness, after all. Even for a drunk like you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you?
output: My name is Fultheim. I'm a soldier. Well, mercenary, really. You know, a... a sellsword. I've lived in Skyrim all my life.  That's all! I'm a nobody, really. So can't you just let me go?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you?
output: None of your damned business who I am! If you're going to kill me, just do it already! As Mara is my witness, if I didn't have this hood on right now I would spit right in your face...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you?
output: Ahhh... Vasha, at your service. Obtainer of goods, taker of lives, and defiler of daughters. Have you not heard of me? Perhaps I will have my people carve my name in your corpse, as a reminder.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Would someone pay to have you killed?
output: Excuse me? What kind of question is that?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Would someone pay to have you killed?
output: What? Oh gods, I don't want to die...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Would someone pay to have you killed?
output: Me? Ha! Are you serious?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why not fight back?
output: Our own security forces are limited, and all the mercenaries are tied up in this ridiculous war. We don't even know their base of operations, and attacking single ships won't really solve the problem.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where would I go to join up?
output: Well I can't just tell that to any skeever that washes up.  From the look of you, I'm guessing you're more looking to cause some trouble for the Horkers.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where can I learn more about magic?
output: Magic? Got no good use for that here. Mages keep to their College in Winterhold. Go bother them. Wish the Jarl's wizard would up and leave with ya.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: There, I cast the spell.
output: Well done, indeed.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Never mind. I'm not interested.
output: No? Very well, it's your choice.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the situation?
output: The enemy is mustering for a final attack. The enemy is mustering for a final attack. The enemy is mustering for a final attack. The enemy is mustering for a final attack. The enemy is mustering for a final attack. The enemy is mustering for a final attack. The enemy is mustering for a final attack.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: General Tullius hasn't agreed to attend yet.
output: I can't agree to any peace council until I know Tullius will be there. The other Jarls could take that as a sign of weakness.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you'll come to the peace council?
output: Yes. I'll give Tullius one more chance to quit Skyrim with his tail between his legs.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have a message from the Greybeards.
output: It's about time they turned their gaze from the heavens, back to our bleeding homeland. What do they want?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: General Tullius has already agreed to attend.
output: Good. Maybe he's realized he's beaten. The way things are going, we'll be knocking at the gates of Solitude itself before too long.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: General Tullius has already agreed to attend.
output: Good. We still hold half of Skyrim despite everything the Empire could throw at us. I doubt the Empire has the stomach for much more bloodletting.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: General Tullius has already agreed to attend.
output: Good. They've had their victories, but Tullius is no fool. The Empire can't afford to keep this up much longer.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tullius will look weak if he refuses, not you.
output: Hmm. We could use the time to bring in new recruits. Our losses have been heavy recently...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tullius will look weak if he refuses, not you.
output: You're right. Let Tullius be the one to insult the Greybeards by refusing their summons. Show up these Imperials for the foreigners they really are.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tullius will look weak if he refuses, not you.
output: He is weak. And no doubt knows it. He's no fool, he'll come, if only to give his troops a chance to refit. But you're right. Victory is within our grasp. We can afford to give the Empire one more chance to withdraw.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you say you needed?
output: I'm running low on Petty Soul Gems.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you say you needed?
output: I'm running low on Lesser Soul Gems.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you say you needed?
output: I'm running low on Common Soul Gems.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you say you needed?
output: I'm running low on Greater Soul Gems.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DBAstridO3GiveQuestTopic1
output: I do indeed. You must go to the city of Markarth, and speak with the apothecary's assistant. You'll probably find her in The Hag's Cure, when the shop is open. The girl's been running her mouth, wants an ex-lover killed. She's apparently performed the Black Sacrament. Her name is Muiri. I need you to talk to her, set up the contract, and carry it out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DBNazirContractSet1ReadyBranchTopic
output: Well then, let's get started. I've got three available right now. Your targets are the beggar Narfi, an ex-miller named Ennodius Papius, and Beitild, a mine boss. When you've completed all those, we'll see if I might have some more.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry, I'm not ready for that just yet.
output: I see. Well, please let me know when you are.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was told to come see you.
output: Another new student... I'm surprised at how many of you there are lately. I'll give you a brief tour, and then we'll get you to your first class. Are you ready to begin? Well, first you'll need these. While you're not required to wear them, you may find them more to your liking than your current clothes.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was told to come see you.
output: Yes, just a brief overview of our facilities. Are you ready?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd love to have a look around.
output: Wonderful. Please follow me, and don't wander off.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Did you see that?
output: Well would you look at that! This appears to lead somewhere. Let's see where it goes.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Did you see that?
output: I'm not sure. I certainly wasn't expecting this. This appears to lead somewhere. Let's see where it goes.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DBNazirContractSet1ReadyBranchTopic
output: Good. And I hope you were careful in that lumber mill. Those splinters and rusty nails can be quite nasty. Your payment, for a job well done.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DBAstridSanctuaryGreetTopic
output: Well, what happens now is you start your new life in the Dark Brotherhood. You're part of the Family, after all. This, as you can see, is our Sanctuary. You won't find a safer place in all of Skyrim. So get comfortable.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds good. Who are they?
output: Keerava, Bersi Honey-Hand and Haelga. Do this right, and I can promise you a permanent place in our organization.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How did you want me to handle it?
output: A word of warning though... I don't want any of them killed. Bad for business. Honestly, the debt is secondary here. What's more important is that you get the message across that we aren't to be ignored.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So this is the Ragged Flagon?
output: Well, well... color me impressed, lad. I wasn't certain I'd ever see you again!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Getting here was easy.
output: So... now that I've whetted your appetite with our little scheme at the market, how about handling a few deadbeats for me? Reliable and headstrong? You're turning out to be quite the prize!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: TG01Goodbyes
output: I'll be here when you're done.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: TG01Goodbyes
output: Come back when you grow a backbone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any tips about Keerava?
output: Keerava's stubborn, but she's got a soft spot for family. Talk to Talen-Jei at the Bee and Barb and see if you can get something out of him. They're... well acquainted if you catch my meaning.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DBNazirContractSet6ReadyBranchTopic
output: Hmph. Yes. Yes, I believe you are. Very well, then. You need to find and kill Safia, the captain of the pirate ship Red Wave. The ship travels the northern coast, and sometimes isn't even in Skyrim at all. So you'll have to be patient. Good luck.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any help with Bersi?
output: He's as pig-headed a man as you'll ever find. The key is that ugly dwarven urn in his shop. Smash that thing to bits and he'll change his attitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's Haelga's story?
output: Haelga is a devout follower of Dibella and dotes over the statue to the Divine that she keeps at the Bunkhouse. Use it as leverage and she'll cave.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What of it?
output: Can you do it? Can you devour a dragon's soul?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DA03VileOffer0
output: In Rimerock Burrow, there's an artifact called the Rueful Axe. Bring it to me, and I'll take Barbas back. Simple as that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Safety should be more important than anything.
output: Well, your classmates certainly seem to disagree with you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I think we should learn something practical.
output: Is that so?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm not really sure what to think.
output: Not going to weigh in either way? I admire your restraint, but there are times when you must make decisions, even without all the facts. Rely on instinct.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You want my opinion?
output: You've been quiet so far. What do you think we should do?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where did I need to go again?
output: You'll need to speak with Mirabelle Ervine. Her quarters are in the Hall of Countenance, but she could be anywhere on the grounds.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How am I supposed to do all of this?
output: Do you want me to hold your hand as well? You have the ring. All you have to do is pick Brand-Shei's pocket and plant it there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are we doing this to Brand-Shei?
output: We've been contracted to make sure Brand-Shei remembers not to meddle in affairs that aren't his own. Now, since we're not the Dark Brotherhood, we're not going to kill him, we're just going to make sure he sits in the prisons for a few days.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How could you possibly know that?
output: It's all about sizing up your mark, lass. The way they walk, what they're wearing. It's a dead giveaway.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Break the law? Are you kidding?
output: Sorry... I usually have a nose for this kind of thing. Never mind then, lass. If you change your mind, come find me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's been going on?
output: Bah. My organization's been having a run of bad luck, but I suppose that's just how it goes. But never mind that, even though you fouled up the job I still think you've got that spark I'm looking for. There's plenty of gold out there for the taking... if you're up to the challenge.

input: What can you tell me about the "Butcher"?
output: I've been following him for months now. Well, not actually following. Trying to find him. The guards won't help. The people won't help. I'm the only one who thinks he can be caught.

input: Why did Karliah purchase Goldenglow Estate?
output: I asked her the same thing and she wouldn't come out and tell me. But now that I know who she is, I'd say she's trying to hit the Thieves Guild where it hurts.

input: Is there anything I can do?

input: If you want me to keep quiet, it's going to cost you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He's casting spells out in the marsh in the middle of the night.
output: Ah, so it is not just dreams then. I have seen this. I will see that it is dealt with. Thank you for bringing clarity.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He's casting spells out in the marsh in the middle of the night.
output: Is that so? Well, I'll make sure that's taken care of immediately. It's good that you brought this to my attention.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

input: Is there something bothering you, Gorm?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why should I keep this a secret?
output: It is none of your concern, I assure you. Just... Forget that you ever saw me here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the problem?
output: She's so lost in her visions, and it's only getting worse. I've looked after her safety for so long...  If she can't tell what's real and what's not, how will she continue to lead Hjaalmarch?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing?
output: Why are you here? Did you follow me? What I am doing is none of your business! I demand that you leave at once and never speak of this again.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I thought you should know Falion's up to something.
output: Ah, Falion. Always looking where he shouldn't for things he doesn't need. What has he done now?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You look young for a blacksmith.
output: I was apprenticed to Balimund before he died. He taught me everything I know about forging armor and weapons. Balimund pulled me out of Grelod's orphanage when I was just a child. I don't know what he saw in me, but I was glad to get out of there. I've spent years watching his techniques and learning his tricks. Sadly, I don't think I'll ever be as talented as he was.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Your shop has a most unusual name.
output: Catchy, isn't it? In my youth I was a fisherman... I had a beautiful ship named "The Brawny Prawn." But the years have a way of creeping up on you. I ended up selling that ship to open this place. Seemed only fitting to name it after her. Well, changed it a bit I suppose. If I had been smarter, I would have kept my boat. Coming to this city was a big mistake.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Goodbye.
output: Thanks for your business.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Goodbye.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Goodbye.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: The hags are hateful of anything which grows from the earth. They made the weapon strong against the natural world. It's the only thing I've even heard of that could cut Eldergleam. Stick it in, give it a twist, and the stuff will just flow out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have a message from Brynjolf.
output: You... you have my statue! What are you going to do with it?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: We've run out of patience.
output: And so have I. What's the point of paying anyway? Your outfit can't even fend for itself. I could do better tossing the gold into the sewer. You can't scare me with your tough talk. I'm not paying you people a single coin.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have a message from Brynjolf.
output: Then I thank you for showing me mercy. Here, take this coin to him. If it keeps us together, it's worth its weight.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: We can protect ourselves. Trust me.
output: Don't fool yourself. It's only a matter of time before you people are run out of Riften.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you surrendering?
output: I surrender! I surrender! I surrender! I surrender! I surrender! I surrender!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here are the things you asked for.
output: Excellent. Now, you must come with me. You've become a part of this. You must be present for the ritual.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you want me to do?
output: This giant... It's not the only thing in Fallowstone Cave. Getting to it isn't going to be easy. You're going to clear a path to the giant, so I can conserve my strength. I'll make sure you're paid for it. So you meet me at Fallowstone Cave, and we'll get this over with. I can have my tribe back, and you can... You can leave us alone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Fighting the giant isn't my job.
output: I didn't say I wouldn't fight the giant. I just said you're going to help me get to it. Meet me outside Fallowstone Cave. You clear the way to the giant for me, and I'll make sure you get paid for it. Thanks to you, I've just been issued a challenge in front of my whole tribe, by a Daedric Prince, no less. I can't ignore that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DB01FrancoisGrelodBranchTopic
output: Miss Grelod is... well she's a terrible old crone. No person could be that cruel. I think she's part hagraven. She only lets us out in the yard once. In the morning. And she just stands there watching us. Like I said. Hagraven.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was unable to defeat them all, and they're coming for you. (Lie)
output: What? How? I thought they weren't allowed within the city!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The Alik'r won't trouble you anymore.
output: At last. I can rest safely. You have done me a great service, warrior. I cannot thank you enough. Take this reward. I managed to sneak some of my wealth out of Hammerfell when I left. It's the least I can do. For now, I will maintain my ruse here. You are always welcome in the Bannered Mare.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Saadia told me - you're assassins.
output: Assassins? No, nothing so crass. "Saadia", as you know her, is wanted by the noble houses of Taneth for treason. We were hired to see her returned to Hammerfell for her crimes. You can help us with that, and make sure no one else gets hurt.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what do you want me to do?
output: She trusts you, at least to some extent. She sent you after us, and has no reason to think that you'd do anything other than that. Convince her that we'll be coming for her, and she needs to leave. Lead her to the stables outside Whiterun. I'll gladly share a portion of the bounty in return for your efforts in seeing proper justice done. We'll be waiting to take her into custody.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was hired to kill you, and that's what I intend to do.
output: I'd hoped we could work something out, that you would see reason. Very well, then. If that's the way you want to play it, we will. That we could avoid having to kill you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: All right, I'll do it.
output: Good. We'll be waiting for you at the stables. It will be good to finally be able to return home.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I know where the Alik'r are, and I have a way in.
output: Good. Wipe them out. So long as one of them is left alive, they will come for me!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are there any rules I should be aware of?
output: Bottom line - respect your Family. Do that, and everything else will fall into place. Used to be the Dark Brotherhood was bound by Five Tenets, but we stopped following those years ago. All those rules, all that discipline, and look where the Dark Brotherhood ended up. We're the last of our kind, and we live the way we see fit.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who is the Night Mother?
output: The Unholy Matron, the Shrouded Lady, the Mistress of the Void. She goes by many names. Ages past, Sithis gave a woman five children. She killed them to win his favor, thus becoming the Night Mother. If you believe that sort of thing. Today, she's... well, she's a skeleton. An ancient corpse. But, more importantly, a corpse that's being brought to this Sanctuary by her Keeper.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
output: They used to come from the Night Mother. Potential clients would perform the Black Sacrament, and she would hear their prayers. The Night Mother would communicate this to the Listener, who would then dispatch a Speaker to arrange the contract with the client. But that was a long time ago. There hasn't been a Listener in years, not since Cyrodiil was overrun in the war with the Thalmor. But people don't know that. So they still perform the ritual... and we eventually hear about it. When someone wants us, we find out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DBAstridThirdGreetBranchTopic
output: Of course. And you've repaid your debt, in full.  Here's the key to the shack. But why stop here? I say we take our relationship to the next level.  In the southwest reaches of Skyrim, in the Pine Forest, you'll find the entrance to our Sanctuary. It's just beneath the road, hidden from view. When questioned by the Black Door, answer with the correct passphrase: "Silence, my brother." Then you're in. And your new life begins. I'll see you at home. I would like to officially extend to you an invitation to join my Family. The Dark Brotherhood.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So the Night Mother is being brought here?
output: Yes. A few months ago I received word from the Night Mother's Keeper that he had arrived in Skyrim from Cyrodiil.  The Night Mother's crypt, in Bravil, was destroyed. A result of the chaos caused by the war with the Thalmor. That forced a relocation. I don't know where the Keeper has been these past few months, but I recently received another letter. He's bringing the Night Mother here. Soon.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: We don't just take in any milk drinker who stumbles in. Talk to Kodlak if you think you have what it takes to be a Companion.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready. Let's go.
output: All right, please stay close to me while we're inside. It should be safe, but it's always better to be cautious.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I trust you. How can I help?
output: Wonderful! My lady Mara will be quite pleased! Nightcaller Temple is only a short walk from Dawnstar. Come, we must hurry.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was just seeing if you came to your senses.
output: Amusing. Now if you'll excuse me, I need to continue my research. I have no time for idle chatter with any simpleton who strikes up a conversation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I can't trust you. You're hiding something.
output: Your concerns are understandable; trust is a very difficult commodity to come by these days. I can only give you my word as a priest of Mara that my intentions are honorable.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What could you do, anyway? Dreams aren't real.
output: These dreams are manifestations created by the Daedric Lord Vaermina. She has an awful hunger for our memories. In return, she leaves behind nightmares not unlike a cough marks a serious illness. I must end her terrible influence over these people before the damage becomes permanent.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: All right. I'm ready.
output: I still have my key to the library. Whenever you're ready, let's move on.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: My apologies, Erandur. I spoke out of turn.
output: Apologies accepted. I understand how this entire story can be mistaken for fiction since the circumstances are so abstract. However, I can assure you that I will do everything in my power to keep you safe if you're willing to help me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How can the Skull be affecting Dawnstar?
output: Lore holds that the Skull of Corruption holds a constant hunger for the memories of others. The Skull has been out of touch for so long, I fear it's gained the ability to reach out on its own and try to feed. What it does with these memories is just conjecture and an argument for scholars and historians to this very day.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's your plan?
output: Perhaps you'd be willing to assist me in that regard? I need to return to the source of the problem, to Nightcaller Temple.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Found it.
output: Mara be praised! There is a way past the barrier to the inner sanctum. It involves a recipe for a liquid known as Vaermina's Torpor. Let me take a look...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's wrong with everyone around here?
output: The entire town is being plagued by horrible nightmares. They're in serious danger but I'm afraid there's little I can do about it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Looks difficult to breach.
output: Impossible actually. Hmm, I wonder... There may be a way to bypass the barrier, but I must check their library and confirm it can be done.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Never mind.
output: Hmph. Hmph. Hmph. Hmph. Hmph.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry.
output: I'm disappointed in your failure. But the Empire still needs you. I'll have to over look it for now. I'm disappointed in your failure. But the Empire still needs you. I'll have to over look it for now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry.
output: Turns out you're a screw up like the rest. But I still need you. So I'll overlook it for now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Reporting for duty.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Reporting for duty.
output: There's plenty that needs doing. There's plenty that needs doing.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
