instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll do it.
output: I wish we could offer more help, but our last attack went sour and we're all that is left. Good luck.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's going on here?
output: Finally, reinforcements have arrived. I was expecting more though, you'd better be good.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't have time for this.
output: Fine then.  The blood of my family is on your hands as well as Brurid's.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I thought the Empire needed to be taken down a notch.
output: You made your decision. Now live with it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry, sir. I was trying to come to a fair agreement.
output: Fair? This is war, soldier. War's about winning, not being fair to the enemy.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I accept your offer. I'd like to join the Stormcloaks.
output: Welcome, brother! I'm glad that your eyes have finally been opened to the Empire's true nature.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You and Tullius are both mistaken. I'm loyal to the Empire.
output: I'm sorry to hear that. I thought your eyes had finally been opened to the Empire's true nature.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I did what I thought was right.
output: I'm sure that will be comforting to your comrades that gave their lives for the territory you just handed to Ulfric.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I did what I thought was right.
output: You should think harder on your oath to the Emperor next time you're deciding what's right.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I thought I did the job like you asked...?
output: Oh, no. Nothing like that. You're calling on her for business.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes, and here's what was in the safe.
output: Let me take a look at what you found.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sure, but will I come out of there alive?
output: Ha ha. If it was like that she wouldn't be asking for you, she'd be calling on the Dark Brotherhood. It's just business.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Good, it's about time I met her.
output: Don't sound so eager, it's not a social visit. It's business.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Mercenaries? Not Riften guards?
output: Aye. Aringoth sent the city guard packing and fortified the entire island. In fact, Vex barely made it out of there alive. You should talk to her about it before you go.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Maven Black-Briar is the influential client?
output: We had an arrangement with Maven. We kept an eye on Goldenglow Estate to make sure the honey kept flowing. If the workers had a dispute, we'd rough them up. If competitors tried to buy honey from Aringoth, we'd steal the shipments. In return, Maven allowed us to extort Aringoth and bring in a huge payout.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does Maven want from me?
output: That's between you and Maven and I prefer to keep it that way. Just keep your ears open and your mouth shut and you'll do fine.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does Maven want from me?
output: That's between you and Maven and I prefer to keep it that way. Don't worry about it. Maven's business dealings usually involve quite a bit of gold for her people.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Agent of Strife.
output: This Agent of Strife can send forth a tendril of pure darkness into the heart of another, causing great injury to them. At the same time, this tether will bolster the agent's own life force, making him stronger.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Agent of Subterfuge.
output: The Agent of Subterfuge utilizes shadow to cloud the judgement of those around him. By weaving the darkness to their will, this agent can manipulate others into fighting for the Nightingale for a limited time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Agent of Stealth.
output: The Agent of Stealth is the master of remaining unseen. They are able to manipulate the darkness and use it to their advantage. On moonlit nights or in darkened rooms, this agent literally becomes invisible.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What use would you be?
output: I was a sorceress of no small skill before I came into Azura's faith. Afterwards, her magic sustained me. I could easily provide my spells to your cause. Protect you from harm. Defeat your enemies.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Thank you, Aranea.
output: Twilight watch over you, guardian.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have Azura's Star.
output: Are you ready to give me the Star?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So Azura isn't giving you more visions?
output: No. She said my part was over. That my fate had moved beyond the Twilight, and I was on my own. I will tend Azura's shrine when you do not need me. I still have my duties, but for the first time I feel... alone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Follow me.
output: Good. I'm ready for anything. Good. I'm ready for anything.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Wait here.
output: You sure? All right. I'll keep guard here. You sure? All right. I'll keep guard here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have Alessandra's dagger here.
output: She finally decided to return it to her father. Bless her heart. I will make sure this finds its way to his tomb as soon as possible. Thank you for bringing it, my child.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: But you ended up doing it anyway.
output: I had to for honor's sake, but I had waited too long. My father died before he could see my training to completion. When I finally became a priest, they gave me the new high priest's dagger, but I already owned my father's. So you see, I have to return it. It breaks tradition, and I need to tell him that I finally did what he wanted.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's special about the dagger?
output: A Priest of Arkay is entrusted with a ceremonial dagger once they've completed their training. It usually given by the head priest who sanctified the ritual. In my case, the head priest happened to be my father. The thing is, I never wanted to follow in his footsteps... I some ways I still don't.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Malborn has a message for you.
output: Malborn? Ah... very good. I think we understand each other.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: My name is <Alias=Player>. Pleased to meet you.
output: Ah yes. I remember your name from the guest list.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry, I can't help right now.
output: Sure, fine. Thanks for nothing. You already got what you needed from me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds like you're just being paranoid.
output: No, you can't ever be too paranoid where the Thalmor is concerned. Look what happened to the Blades. The Blades! If the damn Blades are no match for the Thalmor, what chance do I have? Please, just go check it out. You'll be saving my life.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You helped me. I'll do what I can to help you.
output: You will? Really? Well, okay, here's the situation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Don't worry. I'll take care of this assassin for you.
output: You'd be saving my life. Again. I know I probably seemed ungrateful... I've just been so scared. Expecting a knife at my throat any minute.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing here?
output: Trying to stay alive. I think time's running out though. I'm pretty sure the Thalmor know where I am. Maybe you can help me. You know, by way of making amends for getting me into this mess.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're Elenwen? I've heard so much about you!
output: Have you? All good, I trust. But you have me at a disadvantage. I'm afraid I know nothing about you...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any tips to get me in there?
output: Well, there's an old sewer tunnel that dumps into the lake on the northwest side of the island. That's how I slipped in there. Should still be unguarded.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Know anything about Goldenglow Estate?
output: Watch yourself out there. The mercenaries Aringoth hired are trained killers. Just ask our poor little Vex.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Know anything about Goldenglow Estate?
output: The honey they collect on that hunk of rock goes into making Black-Briar Mead; just about the best tasting mead in all of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Know anything about Goldenglow Estate?
output: I wouldn't bother smacking at those hives with a weapon. Set 'em on fire and they'll go up like kindling.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Know anything about Goldenglow Estate?
output: I'd like to know why you're wasting time asking about it when you should already be on your way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It's Delphine you should be angry with, not me.
output: Don't worry, I'm mad at her, too. And at myself for ever agreeing to get involved in her insane scheme.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Never mind.
output: Indeed. That would be best.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Quite a party. It's my first time, you know. Where can I get a drink?
output: Don't worry, my parties are always well-stocked with the finest food and drink available in this country. But first, you were introducing yourself.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: At least you're still alive. That's something.
output: I count my blessings every day.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like a drink.
output: Here you go, ma'am. The finest Colovian brandy. Is there anything else I can get for you?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like a drink.
output: We seem to have run out of Colovian brandy. I'll check in the wine cellar for more when I get a moment.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like a drink.
output: Here you go, miss. Colovian brandy.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like a drink.
output: I'm sorry, but I think you've had enough for the moment.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Malborn, it's good to see you.
output: Trying to stay ahead of the Thalmor assassins. I'm not a hero like you. I don't stand a chance.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about this Thalmor assassin that's hunting you.
output: That's... great news. I'd... I'd better go. Right now. Before they find me again. This is my chance. Thank you! Here... I stole a lot from the Thalmor over the years. You may as well have some of it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about this Thalmor assassin that's hunting you.
output: I was trying to get to Morrowind. The Dunmer don't care much for the Thalmor and I figured I'd be safe there. As safe as anywhere, that is. But there's a Khajiit hanging around the main gate. I didn't like the way he was looking at me. I'm sure he's Thalmor. Just waiting for me to leave so he can follow me and kill me in a lonely place.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about this Thalmor assassin that's hunting you.
output: I was trying to get to Morrowind. The Dunmer don't care much for the Thalmor and I figured I'd be safe there. As safe as anywhere,that is. But there's a Khajiit hanging around the main gate. I didn't like the way he was looking at me. I'm sure he's Thalmor. Just waiting for me to leave so he can follow me and kill me in a lonely place.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Malborn, what are you doing here?
output: Oh, it's you. I didn't expect to see you again.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The fort is yours.
output: Thank you for your help.  Did you see my family inside?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Brurid?
output: He's a rogue mage who defected at the beginning of the war.  I turned him in but apparently he escaped and now this.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you?
output: Names no longer matter. You may refer to me as The Caller. Now, do you have a reason for making such a mess?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: May I please have the books?
output: Oh, now we're all please and thank you, are we? I'm afraid we're well beyond pleasantries. I'll allow you the opportunity to turn around, walk out that door, and never come back. I suggest you move quickly.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm here for the books from the College.
output: So you're just one of Aren's lackeys? That's disappointing. You show real promise. You come here, kill my assistants, disrupt my work... You've annoyed me, so I don't think I'll be giving you anything.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Perhaps we can come to an arrangement.
output: I'm afraid you don't have anything worth trading. Now, you can go back to your College and leave me be, or I can kill you. Your choice.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't want your help.
output: Ah. I see. Well, then I'll just stay behind you a little bit, and follow along quietly.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Perhaps we can come to an arrangement.
output: An arrangement? After you've destroyed so much? Fine. Leave me the elf. You may go with your books.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Now where are the books?
output: Yes, of course. I said I'd tell you, didn't I? The Caller will have them. She was most interested in one of the volumes. Although not interested enough to keep me from being locked up.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I know where to find the Staff of Magnus.
output: Ancano has somehow locked himself in the hall. He's up to something, and I intend to put a stop to it. Help us get through this, will you? We're throwing everything we have at it. Excellent. I'd suggest that we go retrieve it immediately, but right now we have more pressing matters.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I think I'm okay.
output: Ancano is doing something with that thing... the Eye. We can't stop him! I need you to find the Arch-Mage, and I need you to do it quickly. Get moving! I haven't seen Savos since the explosion. He must've been blown clear, and he may be injured.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's going on?
output: Ancano. He's in there, doing... something. We don't know what. We're trying to get in now. I will have his head for this, I assure you. Help take this down, will you? We're throwing everything we can at it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll do nothing of the sort.
output: Then you are weak and inconsequential.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: (Invisible Walk Away)
output: You are nothing.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have slain <Alias=DeadFriend> to gain your favor.
output: My favor? My good pleasure is not some trophy for mortal sport! I should slay you for such insolence!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I didn't mean to offend.
output: Were you certain in your purpose, you would have no need to apologize. You have much to learn... But you have proven your will is strong and your heart is devoid of pity. So, perhaps you are not entirely useless... We shall soon find out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who is Boethiah?
output: The Lord of Plots, Deceiver of Nations, Devourer of Trinimac. The Queen of Shadows, Goddess of Destruction, He-Who-Destroys and She-Who-Erases... Many are our lord's lofty names, but they befit only us mortals. Intone her mighty names from now until the end of time - it is for naught. Names mean nothing to our Lord. She only cares for those who care for themselves, whose hearts are full of purpose, whose lives are full of deeds.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is this some kind of cult?
output: We are forged by Boethiah's example. We carve our will upon the world through our tongues and our blades. You? You are nothing. An empty vapor, dispersed by the slightest breeze.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm not afraid of you.
output: Good. Perhaps I've misjudged.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: My heart is full of purpose, and my life is full of deeds.
output: If you desire a glimpse of our Dark Mistress, then this is what you must do. First, prove your tongue can wield a lie. Find someone. Gain his trust. Lead him to the shrine above. Then, girded with certitude, plant the ceremonial blade deeply, so that the waters of his heart wash over you. If your will is strong enough, it will stir Boethiah in her Dark Mansion, and she will appear before us. Next, instruct your thrall to touch the Pillar of Sacrifice. Its magic will ensnare him, rendering him helpless.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll do it.
output: That remains to be seen. But if it is so, and if Boethiah appears, then we will welcome you as one of us.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It's a deal. You can have Orthorn.
output: Fine. Take your books and leave at once. If you ever come back, I won't be so gracious.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Might not have a choice next time.
output: I can promise you if it comes to that, and my back's to the wall, I won't hesitate.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who is Nocturnal?
output: She's the mistress of night and darkness and the patron of every thief in Tamriel.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have my skill, not powers or magic.
output: Like a novice picking an impossible lock or a blind man suddenly turning to face you as you reach for his pocket? Again, you have to think differently. Haven't you ever noticed how our luck behaves? It's through these subtle means that Nocturnal influences us.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I never met a thief that worshipped anything.
output: Nocturnal isn't one for worship and reverence. There are no priests and no sermons, no services and no alms. She influences our luck and in return demands payment.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds like a Guild contract.
output: You're closer to understanding than you realize. The only difference is she doesn't demand payment in the traditional sense and sometimes the cost can be quite high. Whether you know it or not, Nocturnal dictates how well we perform as rogues.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds like she just likes us to suffer.
output: Nocturnal's whim is the greatest mystery to everyone. There have been volumes written on the subject. Does she exact payment when we die? When we suffer does she revel in our misery? No one knows. The return certainly seems worth the risk though.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about Gallus.
output: It was Gallus who inducted me into the Nightingales and honed my skills to a razor sharp point. I owe everything to him. We were... very close. He was a scholar, a master thief and a natural leader. Everyone respected him and followed him without question.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You were lovers?
output: Gallus once said he felt comfortable around me; able to let his guard down. I can't help but think that I'm responsible for what happened to him.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why didn't you kill Mercer?
output: For twenty-five years I ran, never sleeping in the same place twice and carefully covering my tracks. Mercer lied to the Guild, branded me a murderer and slandered my name across his network of contacts. Mercer doesn't need to die... he needs to feel the cold sting of fate as his life crumbles in front of him and he's hunted by the Guild.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Let me leave with the books, and there won't be any more trouble. (Persuade)
output: Are you attempting to threaten me? After I've been so hospitable? Well, then you won't be leaving here at all.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm still wondering if I can trust you.
output: Zu'u ni tahrodiis. It was you that lured me here and took me prisoner... vobalaan grahmindol. I have done nothing to earn your distrust.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You did try to trick me into letting you go.
output: Hin aar, orin nu. And yet here I am, still your prisoner.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: We seem to be at an impasse, then.
output: Indeed. Orin brit ro. I cannot leave here until you defeat Alduin, which you cannot do without my help.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you expect me to take your word for that?
output: Ahraan. You wound me, Dovahkiin. I may not tell the whole truth, but I am no liar. Go and see for yourself. Zu'u ni bo nol het. I will be here... unless Alduin returns before you do.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: We need to talk.
output: You have reconsidered my offer, hmm? Onikaan kron?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hold on. Not yet.
output: Hey, when you make up your mind, just let me know. I'll be here. Hey, when you make up your mind, just let me know. I'll be here. Hey, when you make up your mind, just let me know. I'll be here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You didn't escape.
output: Saraan uth - I await your command, as promised. Are you ready to see the world as only a dovah can?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes, I'm sure.
output: Your funeral. Someone else is gonna have to help you get him back in there again. Your funeral. Someone else is gonna have to help you get him back in there again. Your funeral. Someone else is gonna have to help you get him back in there again.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready. Take me to Skuldafn.
output: Zok brit uth! I warn you, once you've flown the skies of Keizaal, your envy of the dov will only increase.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me what you know, then.
output: Only this. You have the Thu'um of a dovah, but without the wings of one, you will never set foot in Skuldafn. Of course... I could fly you there. But not while imprisoned like this.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Not until Alduin is defeated.
output: Ah. Well. Hmm... krosis. There is one... detail about Skuldafn I neglected to mention.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Open the trap.
output: You sure about that? You want to let that dragon loose after all the trouble to catch him in there? You sure about that? You want to let that dragon loose after all the trouble to catch him in there? You sure about that? You want to let that dragon loose after all the trouble to catch him in there?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hold on. I'm not quite ready.
output: Kreh zini! The freedom of the sky beckons! Yet I stay here, nau gol, as promised.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: (Invisible Continue / Walk Away)
output: Listen. All of you!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll do whatever you ask.
output: I have little need for mindless thralls. My servants serve their own purposes. But, if their will is insufficient, nor suitably aligned with mine, I simply destroy them.  Which brings me to my present concern.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who is he?
output: I am loath to utter his name... one cannot erase a thing if it has a name to be remembered.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How can you compete with Black-Briar Meadery?
output: Maven Black-Briar's gone out of her way to try and have me shut down, but fortunately I have a good relationship with Whiterun's Jarl. Every year, I sell more Honningbrew and Maven loses customers. Know why? My mead tastes better.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You have no faith in the Guild?
output: All I care about is cause and effect. Did the job get done and was it done correctly. There's no gray area. Faith? I don't have faith in anyone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So get rid of him and he's no longer a threat.
output: Exactly. With Sabjorn in prison, his meadery will be forced to close. Then I swoop in and take over the place. No more competition.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry you're disappointed.
output: This is exactly what I'm talking about. Once again Brynjolf sends me someone with no backbone, no determination.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How do I "permanently" clear the vermin?
output: I bought some poison. I was going to have my lazy, good-for-nothing assistant Mallus handle it, but he seems to have vanished. If you plant this in the vermin's nest, it should stop them from ever coming back.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sabjorn seems like more than just friendly competition.
output: Not a day goes by that I don't regret letting Sabjorn get as far as he did. In only a few short years, he's taken that bile he calls mead to market and a chunk of my profits with it! I can't imagine where he found the gold to take it to market so quickly.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Brynjolf said you wanted to see me.
output: So, you're the one. Hmm. You don't look so impressive.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: My apologies, Lady Maven.
output: The only reason we're having this conversation is due to Brynjolf's assurance you won't botch another assignment. He claims you possess some sort of uncanny aptitude for your line of work. Quite frankly I find that hard to believe.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You won't have that problem with me.
output: I hope not. This is an important job. I have a competitor called Honningbrew Meadery that I want to put out of business. I also want to know how they managed to get the place up and running so quickly.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm the best at what I do.
output: Is that confidence I hear... or is it arrogance? Strange how often they're confused. You have to understand, it's been a long time since Brynjolf's sent me anyone I can rely on.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It doesn't really sound like I have a choice in the matter.
output: But a single candle can banish the darkness of the entire Void. If not you, then someone else.  My beacon is sure to attract a worthy soul. But if you are wise, you will heed my bidding.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll keep the sword. But find someone else to spread your religion.
output: It matters not. The plant cares nothing for the rays that bring it the warmth of the sun. As you carry Dawnbreaker, so will my light touch the world.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll do it.
output: Of course you will. I have commanded it!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll wield this mighty blade in your name.
output: May the light of certitude guide your efforts.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: (Invisible Continue / Invisible Walk Away)
output: Go now, the artifact must be reclaimed and Malkoran destroyed.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Invisible Walk Away
output: The World-Eater waits within the mist! Bring word to Shor's hall of our hard fate!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Follow me. I'll lead you through this mist.
output: I'll try to hold to your hopeful purpose. Quickly, before this encompassing fog once more snares me in the World-Eater's net.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you?
output: Near Giants' Gap, in the gloom before dawn, we marched, unsuspecting into the Imperials' trap. Then we stood and fought, our shield-wall defending until by dawn's light the Legion's ranks wavered. But I never knew if nights-end brought victory - a swift-flying arrow to Sovngarde carried me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's this mist?
output: I do not know - but none have passed through. Alduin, his hunger insatiable, hunts the lost souls snared within this shadowed valley. Can you lead the way to where Shor's hall waits, beckoning us on to welcome long sought?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes, it's at the far end of the valley from here.
output: I saw it fair when first I trod this long-sought path. The pain and fear vanished, dreamlike, and a vision beckoned - Shor's hall, shimmering across the clouded vale. But quenched was hope by the shrouding mist - my mind is darkened.  Hurry! Before Alduin your life devours bring word to Shor's hall of our hard fate! I've lost the way and wander blindly.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is it that you need?
output: I want to be an adventurer like you, but my father says I can't. I want to be an adventurer like you, but my father says I can't. He says that he needs me to stay here and work the farm, and even if he did let me be an adventurer, we couldn't afford to buy armor. He says that he needs me to stay here and work the farm, and even if he did let me be an adventurer, we couldn't afford to buy armor. His name's Mralki, and he's the innkeeper here. I hope you can change his mind. His name's Mralki, and he's the innkeeper here. I hope you can change his mind.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll see what I can do.
output: Thank you. I can't stand the thought of being trapped in this village for the rest of my days. Thank you. I can't stand the thought of being trapped in this village for the rest of my days.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll buy it. (200 gold)
output: Hmmm. I don't think you've got enough to cover my expenses with Silver-Bloods, much less convince me give my words away.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Shor's hall? What's that?
output: Don't you know? What drew you here? Surely your dreams showed you the way? The Hall of Valor, where heroes wait to follow Shor to the final battle.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where is the Midden?
output: Underneath the College. It's not the nicest place, so if you go down there, please do be careful.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you ever heard of the Augur of Dunlain?
output: The what of what? No. No idea. If it's important, maybe Tolfdir knows. He seems to know a lot.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can you please help me find this Augur? (Persuade)
output: Very well. It's not something often discussed, as it might be... misunderstood by the locals. The Augur is down in the Midden, below the College. I don't recommend going down there unless it's absolutely necessary.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: By the right of birth. I am Dragonborn.
output: Ah! It's been too long since last I faced a doom-driven hero of the dragon blood.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: By right of plunder. I am a Nightingale of Nocturnal.
output: Do not mistake the night-shrouded thief's stealthily-taken spoils, stolen and unearned, for a warrior's plunder, won in honorable battle. Your doom already binds you to your dark mistress, but your errand I will not hinder, if my wrath you can withstand.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: By right of blood. I Listen for the Night Mother.
output: You trespass here, shadow-walker. Shor does not know you. Perhaps before the end you will earn the right to pass this way. Welcome I do not offer, but your errand I will not hinder, if my wrath you can withstand.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: By right of glory. I lead the Companions of Jorrvaskr.
output: I welcome the chance to challenge the blade of Ysgramor's heir, honored shield-brother to Kodlak Whitemane, whom I've watched for in vain.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: By right of Cleverness. I am Master of the College of Winterhold.
output: The Nords may have forgotten their forefathers' respect for the Clever Craft, but your comrades throng this hall. Here in Shor's house we honor it still. Well met, mage of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm sorry, what?
output: Your pockets... they're a little low on coin. I can tell.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was told to find you.
output: Indeed. And so you have come looking, though you do not know why. Like others before you, you blindly follow a path to your own destruction. The Thalmor came seeking answers as well, unaware they will be his undoing. Your path now follows his, though you will arrive too late.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: And what is it I'm seeking?
output: You seek that which all who wield magic seek. Knowledge. You shall find this: Knowledge will corrupt. It will destroy. It will consume. You seek meaning, shelter in Knowledge. You will not find it. The Thalmor sought the same thing, and it shall lead to his end as it has so many others.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Identify the buyer and we'll forget what we know. (Persuade)
output: All right. Had I known the deal would bring me this much trouble, I never would have accepted the gold.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I think you're lying to me.
output: Look, that's all I know. I never promised you I'd have all the answers. Now, since our transaction is done, I'll be on my way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What about the information on Goldenglow Estate?
output: I was approached by a woman who wanted me to act as the broker for something big. She flashed a bag of gold in my face and said all I had to do was pay Aringoth for the estate. I brought him the coin and walked away with her copy of the deed.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Did she say why she was doing this?
output: Not at all. I tend not to ask too many questions when I'm on the job. I'm sure you understand. However, I did notice she was quite angry and it was being directed at Mercer Frey.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That's it? No name or anything?
output: In this business we rarely deal in names; our identity comes from how much coin we carry.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you ever heard of the Augur of Dunlain?
output: Oh, no. No, that won't do at all. Not my problem. Not even a little. Take it to Tolfdir, he's supposed to be looking after you lot.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you ever heard of the Augur of Dunlain?
output: That's nothing you need to concern yourself with.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you ever heard of the Augur of Dunlain?
output: Huh? That sounds ominous. Are you getting yourself into even more trouble? Did you ask Mirabelle? She runs things around here, after all.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where did this tunnel come from?
output: It's a little gift from the dwarves. Who knew they would end up helping our cause? We have to move. We'll talk more once we see the sky.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll get proof... and <Alias=Steward>'s cooperation.
output: Good. I can always count on you, can't I? Good. I can always count on you, can't I? Good. I can always count on you, can't I?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll get proof... and <Alias=Steward>'s cooperation.
output: I can always count on you, can't I? I can always count on you, can't I?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DBNazirPlayerMoneyComeClean
output: Ha! I knew it, you rascal! By Sithis, the old man was worth the trouble.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: DBNazirPlayerMoneyStillLie
output: Pfft. You'd think an emperor would fetch at least twice that. Damn that motherless cheapskate, Motierre. In any event, here's my advice. Go to Riften's Ratway, find Delvin Mallory. I believe Astrid had you visit him once before, no? Mallory is an expert "obtainer of goods." We can use the money to repair and refit this Sanctuary. Make a true home for us, eh?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What happened?
output: I'll be fine. I just need a minute to catch my breath. Find Savos...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you have in mind?
output: What if I told you about a large shipment of gold and weapons?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found some evidence...
output: So. You're an Imperial spy... Interesting... I have no strong love for the Stormcloaks but I can't say I'm all that fond of the Empire, either. This war of yours makes it difficult for a resourceful woman to advance her interests. Perhaps we can find a way for both of us to prosper from this unfortunate discovery?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found some evidence...
output: So. You're one of Ulfric's spies... I can't deny the man is right about a few things... But I've seen first hand what Ulfric is capable of, given the chance. Suffice it to say, he is no friend to Markarth, and no friend of mine. My first and only loyalties are to my nephew, and to this city.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Recognize this? (Show <Alias.PronounObj=Steward> <Alias=Evidence>)
output: I suppose you're here to extort something from me? Is that it?  I suppose you're here to extort something from me? Is that it?  Well, what is it you want? Well, what is it you want?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Something went wrong. Winterhold may be in danger. Can you help?
output: It 'may be' in danger? Take a look. I don't think there's much question. Let's get down there. We have to do something.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: There's no time. We have to make sure Winterhold is safe.
output: We'll go with you, but when this is all over I want an explanation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: There's no time. We have to make sure Winterhold is safe.
output: I'll go with you, but when this is all over I want an explanation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Seems all our eggs were in one basket.
output: Look, in case you hadn't noticed, these aren't the glory days of the Guild. We've lost more clients in the last decade than I'd care to count, but Maven's stuck with us through throughout the entire ordeal. I'll be damned if I'm going to lose her to... well, to whatever they are.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What would convince you that we're on your side?
output: If you were to bring me the deed to Goldenglow Estate, so I was the full owner, that would be a step in the right direction.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How is all this affecting the Guild?
output: Goldenglow Estate provided a huge payout for us before Aringoth locked us out. Maven looked the other way as long as the honey kept flowing and we kept him in line.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does the Guild get if I do that?
output: Since I know losing the farm's payments will harm the Guild, I intend to make a substantial contribution for compensation. I take care of my friends.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: And Honningbrew?
output: Word on the street was that Honningbrew tasted better, cost less and Sabjorn didn't shove it down everyone's throat. If Sabjorn ever managed to push Maven off her pedestal, we'd all be in trouble. Let's not kid ourselves. Black-Briar Mead is swill. The only thing keeping it successful is Maven.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So how do I get him to talk?
output: You're going to have to buy him off; it's the only way to get his attention. If that fails, follow him and see what he's up to. If I know Gulum-Ei, he's in way over his head and you'll be able to use it as leverage.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found the same marking at Honningbrew Meadery.
output: It would seem our adversary is attempting to take us apart indirectly by angering Maven Black-Briar. Very clever.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Mercer wants me to discover Goldenglow's buyer.
output: Yes, we spoke at length while you were in Whiterun dealing with our meadery situation. I hope for all your sakes you find out who's behind this supposed "plot."

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you mean "supposed"?
output: Having Goldenglow kept in line by the Thieves Guild has kept the honey flowing with minimal cost. Now, mysteriously, some sort of anonymous adversary shows up and takes the Estate out of my hands.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You don't believe us?
output: When you've been doing business like I have for decades, you quickly discover that the only person you can trust is yourself.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Heard any rumors lately?
output: Folk been hearing some strange stuff coming from the Aretino place. Chanting. Talk is, little Aventus is trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Heard any rumors lately?
output: A little boy, Aventus Aretino, got sent to the orphanage. Now there's talk he's trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood. No good can come of that...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Heard any rumors lately?
output: I was walking by the old Aretino Residence, heard the little boy, Aventus? He was chanting. It was the Black Sacrament, I tell ya.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Heard any rumors lately?
output: Hear about the little Imperial boy, Aventus Aretino? The stupid whelp is trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Your weird experiments are over, wizard.
output: Your corpse will feed my spiders for weeks. Now die, you fool!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Heard any rumors lately?
output: Have you heard about Aventus Aretino? He's a little boy, lives in Windhelm. They say he's been trying to get in touch with the Dark Brotherhood... Have you heard about Aventus Aretino? He's a little boy, lives in Windhelm. They say he's been trying to get in touch with the Dark Brotherhood...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Heard any rumors lately?
output: Been talk of a little boy in Windhelm, name of Aventus Aretino. Get this - he's been trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood. Foolish lad...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Heard any rumors lately?
output: I heard tell of a lad in Windhelm. Aventus Aretino. They say he's been doing the Black Sacrament, trying to contact the Dark Brotherhood. Damn fool.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: There's no time. We have to make sure Winterhold is safe.
output: I'll go with you, but when things are back to normal I want an explanation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Something went wrong. Winterhold may be in danger. Can you help?
output: That's certainly an understatement. I've never seen anything like this! Well, I suppose we can't just stand here. We'd better do something.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How am I supposed to do all of this?
output: Do you want me to hold your hand as well? You're going to have to sneak over to Madesi's stall and use your lockpick on the strongbox. Then when you have the ring, you pickpocket Brand-Shei and leave it behind.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you?
output: I am Tsun, shield-thane to Shor. The Whalebone Bridge he bade me guard and winnow all those souls whose heroic end sent them here, to Shor's lofty hall where welcome, well-earned, awaits those I judge fit to join that fellowship of honor.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This is obviously a shakedown, but I'll pay. (<BribeCost> gold)
output: Nope. Not even close.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This is obviously a shakedown. (Persuade)
output: Call it what you want. You don't pay, then you're not getting in.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're obviously a thief. I kill thieves. (Intimidate)
output: All right, calm down, no need to for that. I'll let you in right away, just need to get the gate unlocked.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found this amulet. It might be important.
output: You found what? Hmm. Well now. Yes, this might actually be something interesting. You'd better show that to Tolfdir right away.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're obviously a thief. I kill thieves. (Intimidate)
output: I think you'd be a little smarter than that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm sorry.
output: Don't be sorry for me. I just - if I would have known it would come to this. Mother...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Kill her?
output: I've thought this through, and it's the only way. She's too far gone, too corrupted by the Hags. At least in death she can be free again. Enough. Let's go.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I am sorry.
output: Keep Mother's staff. Think of it as payment. I want to leave everything from this cursed place behind. Goodbye. And thank you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the plan?
output: I'll present you as the sacrifice. Just play along. While mother begins the ritual, I'll strike. Then, together we can... we can kill her.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: About your mother...
output: You've decided to help?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who is Haldyn?
output: Our secret ingredient, if you will.  A battle-mage of fearsome cunning. Runs the Blood Horkers, and makes sure the battles end right-side up.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I know where the Blood Horkers are.
output: Finally, someone around here that can get things done.  Since we're short on soldiers you'll be coming with us, too. No arguments. Anything else you want to say?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the plan?
output: Well, here we are. We think.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Lots of gold to be had plundering ships.
output: Aye, the war keeps the Empire and the locals too busy to worry about us. Haldyn calls it "our golden age."

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where would I go to join up?
output: Haldyn will take my hide for this, but Skyrim's been feeling a bit confining lately. We draw council at Japhet's Folly. The fools in Windhelm won't go near it, which is fine by us. If you'll pardon me now, my crew needs gathering. Should be in Hammerfell before the other Horkers know who let slip their secret.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Their leader is a battle-mage named Haldyn.
output: Haldyn? I've heard of the man, but never guess he'd join up with some pirates. This could be even more dangerous than I thought. Head to the ships. We'll plan the assault on the way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you heard of a pirate crew called the Blood Horkers?
output: Know about them? Lass, you're looking at them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have proof that Thorald lives.
output: I knew he wasn't gone, I just knew it! Please, get that to Avulstein right away.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can you tell me more about your missing son?
output: Thorald's disappearance has been hard on all of us, but Avulstein has taken it badly. He's afraid of being taken as well, so he hasn't left the house. All he talks about is Thorald. Please, help Avulstein if you can. Something has to be done, or we're all going to lose our minds.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm here for Thorald Gray-Mane
output: Are you joking? Even if we had a prisoner by that name, the only way he'd be released is by order of the Imperial Legion. Now I suggest you turn around and go back the way you came.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I need a prisoner released from Northwatch Keep.
output: The Thalmor? Do you have any idea what you're asking? I'm sorry, that's just not possible. It would cause far too many problems.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I need a prisoner released from Northwatch Keep.
output: The Thalmor? Do you have any idea what you're asking? I can only imagine the headaches this is going to cause... Here, take this. Assuming they even honor it, you should be able to get your prisoner out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's an order from General Tullius himself.
output: What? Well... This seems to be in order. Very well, follow me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Both of you wait here for a moment.
output: We're right behind you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Both of you wait here for a moment.
output: Lead on, we're ready.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Both of you wait here for a moment.
output: We're with you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Both of you wait here for a moment.
output: Will do. Don't stray too far away or else we'll come after you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How long has Yamarz been cursed?
output: Almost ever since he became leader of the tribe. He killed Shagrol in combat, which none of us thought possible. But the winner is made Chief. That is how it is done.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you in this cage?
output: They threw me in here until they were ready to use me in one of their experiments. This wasn't supposed to happen. I thought they wanted my help, not to use me as a test subject!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is there a key for this cage?
output: No, it's the levers in the center there. Just make sure you don't pull the wrong one. Please, hurry. I don't like being in here!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm here to rescue you and recover the books you stole.
output: See? I knew Aren wouldn't leave me in here! Hurry and get me out of this cage before they come for me!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Both of you wait here for a moment.
output: No problem, but if you get too far away, we're going to catch up.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Both of you wait here for a moment.
output: All right, but don't wander ahead too far or else we'll be forced to come find you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: "Honor" is a coward's tool.
output: An astute observation. Skyrim is a beautiful and harsh mistress, but her people cling to such a petty notion of honor.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How do I get to Whiterun from here?
output: Just head north - you can't miss it. It's the capital of Whiterun Hold. Jarl Balgruuf still hasn't declared for one side or the other, so at least you won't run into any Imperials along the way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How do I get to Whiterun from here?
output: Cross the river and then head north. You'll see Whiterun on its hill as you pass the falls.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any supplies I could take?
output: Of course. Here's a key to the house. Stay as long as you like. If there's anything else you need, just let me know. But what's this all about? What are you two doing here?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have any supplies I could take?
output: Ralof? How do you know him?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: We escaped from the Imperials together.
output: You did? We heard that Ulfric was captured... ... no, sorry, but in times like these I can't just take the word of a stranger who wanders into town claiming to be my brother's friend.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can't you come with me to Winterhold?
output: I'm afraid not. There are preparations to make and Gallus's remains to lay to rest. I promise to join you there as soon as I can.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How did you meet him?
output: Ah yes, quite an amusing anecdote actually. I caught him trying to break into my laboratory. I was about to show him the error of his ways when he made a curiously astute comment about my research notes. I was astounded and in turn it lead to a conversation. Who'd have imagined it would lead to such a strong friendship?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why did Gallus scribe his journal in Falmer?
output: Besides the fact that there are only a handful of people in Tamriel that even recognize the language? I'm fairly certain he was planning some sort of a heist that involved a deep understanding of the Falmer language. Sadly, we never had the opportunity to speak about the details.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He was an academic yet he chose a different path. Why?
output: Well, for the thrill of course. He was quite clear that he felt more in his element climbing through a window rather than hunched over a dusty tome.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where did he acquire the knowledge to use it?
output: Ironically, I pointed him in the same direction I pointed you. To Markarth and Calcelmo. I'm only hoping whatever means he used to learn the language will still be available to you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about Gallus?
output: He was a dear friend of mine and a surprisingly astute pupil of academia... I was devastated when he was killed. I suppose that risk always coexisted with his line of work, I just never thought his luck would run out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Winterhold is safe for now.
output: Wish I could say the same for us. Tolfdir and I can try and keep this contained. You need to get your hands on the Staff of Magnus. Now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll be right back.
output: I certainly hope so. I don't know how long we can keep this up. At least tell me where you're going, so we can send someone after you if you don't come back.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why me?
output: I've got to stay here, to see if we can get to Ancano and stop this. I need someone I can trust to do it. Besides, you're the one having all of these visions, aren't you?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Very well, we do it your way for now.
output: I'll make for Riften and scout the situation; see if I can discover what Mercer's up to. When you're ready, meet me at the Ragged Flagon. In the meantime, I wanted you to have this. It belonged to Gallus, but given the circumstances I think he'd approve.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Thieves and temples. It just doesn't add up.
output: I felt the same way when Gallus first revealed these things to me. I think given time, you'll understand what I mean.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why does it require that type of protection?
output: Everything that represents Nocturnal's influence is contained within the walls of the Sepulcher. Now it seems Mercer's broken his oath with Nocturnal and defiled the very thing he swore to protect.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Gallus's journal mentioned the "Twilight Sepulcher."
output: You've come this far, so I see no harm in concealing it any longer. The Twilight Sepulcher is the temple to Nocturnal. It's what the Nightingales are sworn to protect with their lives.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have nirnroot for you.
output: Ah yes, excellent samples. Thank you. This coin should compensate you for all the bother.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of delivery?
output: I need someone to take this small keg of Black-Briar Mead to Wilhelm at the Vilemyr Inn in Ivarstead. Drop it off and he'll trade you something for the delivery. Keep it as payment for the legwork. Oh, and if you bump into Indaryn from the meadery, keep your mouth shut. He'd rat us out in a second.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Your real name is Svidi, isn't it?
output: No, I'm sorry. You must have me mistaken for someone else. I've never even heard that name before.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me your side of the story about Sibbi.
output: Sibbi and I were to be married. We were supposed to be happy together forever. Then I found that wretched poetry from Svana. When I confronted Sibbi about it, he threatened to kill me. When I heard what Sibbi did, I fled. Now you've found me, and you're going to tell him where I am. I was scared so I told my brother Wulfur. He went to talk to Sibbi for me and... and... Sibbi killed him. My brother wasn't even armed!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're selling cheap mead?
output: No, no friend. You've got it all wrong. I'm not selling cheap mead. I'm selling good mead for cheap... Black-Briar Mead. I sell cases of it for half of what the inns and taverns pay through the Meadery. All I need is someone to deliver it for me. If anyone saw me leave Riften, they'd get suspicious.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've given away all the missives.
output: Oh, splendid! Just splendid! Mara smiles upon us this day. Allow me to give you her gift... a true blessing to aid you in times of need. Despair not, her warmth will protect you always!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've located Grimsever.
output: If you'd permit me, I'd be honored to accompany you in your travels for a time. When you told me of your intent to join the Thieves Guild, I honestly didn't think we'd have much to speak about ever again. Yet here you are with my weapon that you could have easily sold or kept for yourself. Forgive me for my hasty opinion of you, I see that I was wrong and that there's much I can learn from you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you got arrested for his murder?
output: I was about to let that wench marry into the richest family in Riften, and this is how she repays me. Exactly! And now I have to stare at these bars for eight months. Can you believe it? I'd do anything to have that whore's head on a platter. All I need to know is where she is.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you in jail?
output: Look, we all have our flaws; mine is that women can't get enough of me. So I had this little affair going on while I was betrothed to a beautiful girl named Svidi. Well, she finds out and she tells her brother, Wulfur. Then her brother attacks me with a knife... I mean, I had to defend myself!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Did you know Romlyn is skimming from the meadery?
output: Aye, I suspected as much but I've never been able to catch that little sneak with proof.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: She's made her way east into Morrowind.
output: So, the whore thinks the Black-Briar reach ends at the border of Skyrim, eh? She'll soon discover her mistake.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He gave me this keg to deliver.
output: That fetcher! I gave him the same keg just this morning and told him to store it in the cellars. Oh, he'll rot in prison for this one I promise you. As soon as Maven finds out, it's all over for him. Here, take this as a bit of a reward for nabbing our little thief.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You seem quite proud of your work.
output: The secret is my forge. It consumes fire salts, a strange mineral that burns as hot as Red Mountain lava. Smithing's been in my blood for generations. I owe my success to my forefathers and their recipe for flame.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Impressive.
output: Well, it was. Sadly, this forge is dying and I've used the last of my fire salts. If I can't feed it soon, it may grow cold.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have some information about Svidi.
output: Good, good. Just point me in the right direction and I'll do the rest.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have a delivery from Romlyn.
output: All right, pipe down. You want the whole blessed place to hear you? The arrangement called for a trade. I hope you'll find this suitable.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll distribute them.
output: Oh my, how wonderful! Lady Mara will be so pleased! Here you are. Now make sure you give out every single one, we can't afford to let even one lost soul stray from Her warmth.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have deathbell for you.
output: Good, my experiments are at a critical stage and these are just what I need to finish. Here's some coin for all the trouble.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: She's in Ivarstead using the name Lynly.
output: Ivarstead? So close to Riften? She's an even bigger fool than I thought.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does the temple need any additional assistance?
output: Riften is drowning in a sea of sin and wickedness and it's my personal mission to let everyone know that the warmth of Mara can see them through. All I need is a messenger to bring Her words to these poor souls by distributing these missives.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How did you meet Keerava?
output: I met her when I wandered into Riften a few years ago. Been smitten with her ever since. In fact, I'm thinking of asking her to marry me. In Black Marsh, tradition dictates we present a potential mate a unique wedding ring to represent our future bond. I already have the gold band, but all I need are three flawless amethysts to complete the setting.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have nightshade for you.
output: Perfect. This is just what I needed. Here's some gold for your time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here, sister. Blessings of Mara upon you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Even after everything I did for you and Faleen?
output: Well, I'm not blind to the fact that you've been instrumental in improving my affairs of the heart. If you wish, you may enter my tower to view the museum section, but I'm afraid the laboratories are still off limits. That's the best I can offer.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Perhaps I could view your work?
output: Preposterous! That research represents years of personal toil in some of the most dangerous Dwemer ruins in Skyrim! You must be mad to think I'd allow anyone to see it before it's completed.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you need me to do?
output: Elisif has forbidden the Burning of King Olaf, a Festival put on by the Bards College. We need to change her mind. To convince her I want to read King Olaf's Verse. A part of the Poetic Edda, the living history of Skyrim. Unfortunately the verse was lost long ago.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does that mean?
output: It means I can't read it to the court. Without the verse I won't be able to convince Elisif of the importance of The Burning of King Olaf Festival. If she isn't convinced of the festival's importance then she won't reverse her decision to stop the effigy burning. It means that the Burning of King Olaf, which the Bards College has held for time immemorial, won't be happening.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found King Olaf's Verse.
output: I have to admit I didn't think it would actually be there.  Now let's take a look at this... Oh. Oh-no. This won't do at all.  The copy is incomplete, it's aged to the point that parts are unreadable. And the parts that are readable... well... bardic verse has come a long way since ancient times.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does that mean I'm a Bard now?
output: Soon, soon. These things must be done properly, you will be inducted as part of the Festival itself. I need you to go speak to Jorn. He was preparing the Effigy of King Olaf.  Tell him to finish the preparations, the Festival is back on.

input: Olaf was Numinex. A dragon in human form! (Persuade)

output: Always a pleasure to meet a prospective bard. When possible, we ask applicants to perform tasks the college needs completed. In this case, I do have a task befitting an aspiring bard... You should be aware that many apply but we accept very few people.

input: He sacked it and used magic to blame Solitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why did Elisif forbid the festival?
output: As you may be aware Elisif's husband High King Torygg was recently killed. Elisif mourns her husband deeply and she feels that a festival that burns a King in effigy is... distasteful. I've tried to convince her the festival is many centuries old and celebrates Solitude but I need proof. I believe King Olaf's verse will provide that proof.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How do I get to the brewing vats?
output: Both of the buildings are connected by tunnels made by the pests infesting the meadery. There's an entrance to it in the basement storeroom of the warehouse that used to be boarded over. I've already removed the boards so the meadery would get infested. That's where you should start.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is something wrong?
output: Are you kidding me? Look at this place. I'm supposed to be holding a tasting of the new Honningbrew Reserve for the Captain of the Guard. If he sees the meadery in this state, I'll be ruined.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You mentioned someone named Mallus?
output: Mallus is the best deal I've ever made. Lent him a bit of gold some time ago I knew he'd never be able to pay back. Nothing like free labor to make operating costs cheaper.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you doing all this?
output: I made the mistake of borrowing coin from Sabjorn. He's allowing me to pay it back, but he's working my fingers to the bone! He treats me like a slave... I have to do every nasty, dirty job in the meadery.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why bother poisoning the nest for Sabjorn?
output: Once Sabjorn is out of the way, Maven has plans for this place. One way or another, we don't want the pests coming back. Consider it just more of the dirty work. I did my part getting them in there, now you need to clear them out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Must have taken a fortune to get started.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of trouble should I expect?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of trouble should I expect?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of trouble should I expect?
output: The Falmer. There have been reports that they've been attacking people at night.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of trouble should I expect?
output: It's a problem with the Forsworn. Unpredictable, unknowable, and dangerous. Be careful.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of trouble should I expect?
output: It's a clan of giants. The war is driving them out of their lands, and they've started attacking settlements.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of trouble should I expect?
output: You'll be clearing a nest of those Hagraven things. I've never faced one myself, but I hear... disturbing things about them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of trouble should I expect?
output: Oddly enough, Spriggans. Usually they let alone, but for some reason, this particular grove isn't.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of trouble should I expect?
output: Bloodsuckers. Vampires. Take every precaution. One bite, and you could end up as one of them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of trouble should I expect?
output: Rogue wizards. I've never trusted magic types. The College is bad enough. Destroy them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: There's some trouble in Falkreath. There's always some sort of trouble down there, but now it's come to a head.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: There's some trouble in Haafingar. The Legion's too busy with the war, and they're hiring us to take care of their problems.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: There's some trouble in The Pale. We need you to go in and clear out an enemy stronghold.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: There's always some sort of trouble in The Reach, but a local warlord has raised the stakes. We have to handle the situation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: The Rift is seeing a lot of trouble from some riff-raff. We need to head in and break them up.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: We've got trouble right here in Whiterun Hold. Nothing we can't handle.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: There's trouble up in Winterhold. I'm a little surprised anyone's complaining about it, but money is money.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: I don't know if you're capable, and I don't have time to find out. If Kodlak will vouch for you, I might have some work you could do.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: Kodlak is the one who figures out who can be a Companion. So talk to him. It's out of my hands.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: So you think you have what it takes? Huh. Lucky for you, I'm not the one who makes that decision. Talk to Kodlak. Who knows, maybe he's in a generous mood.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.

Aren't you already running a job for Aela? Come talk to me when you finish that up. Aren't you already running a job for Aela? Come talk to me when you finish that up.
