Three times, and the crystal should be ready for the next step. Isn't this exciting?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: And what mystery is that?
output: Their disappearance, of course! Instant, unexplainable. The stories have fascinated me... Ever since I was young, I wanted to know what really happened. After years and years of work, I'm closing in on a way to investigate what happened through experimentation. Only now... Well, it's simply a disaster.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any suggestions as to how I find them?
output: I heard one of them was just arrested trying to sneak into the city. If he's locked up in the jail, perhaps you can get it out of him. Please, I know I'm asking you to do something difficult, maybe even dangerous. I just don't know who else I can trust.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any suggestions as to how I find them?
output: You've seen them? Then waste no time, head there at once! The longer they're around, the more danger I'm in! Please, kill Kematu and end this nightmare for me!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Enthir really doesn't have whatever it is you asked him for.
output: What? I... I don't understand. Where is it?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you need me to do for you?
output: Ah, that's excellent news. This will be most helpful in furthering my research. I'm afraid I can't offer you much right now, but please take this. And perhaps, if this is all successful... Well, let's not get ahead of ourselves. It's too early to be getting excited. Still, this is most encouraging. Thank you again. If I require anything else, I shall be sure and let you know.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you need me to do for you?
output: I simply need more pieces of Dwemer equipment to study. It's nothing dangerous... At least, not necessarily. And please, let's just... Let's keep this between us.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is it that you want?
output: I have a... friend, let's say, who's interested in a staff. A particular one. It's nothing dangerous, so don't worry. I'm not even sure why he wants it, but then that's not really my concern. He's willing to pay for it. The problem is that it'll be a little difficult to acquire, seeing as how it's in the hands of someone who isn't exactly friendly. So, you bring that staff back here, and I'll consider it payment for the item Arniel was after.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is there any College business I can assist with?
output: You mean the official sort of business? Hmm, well... no. No, not really.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Did you need any more help with your project?
output: As a matter of fact, there is something you can do for me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Did you need any more help with your project?
output: What? Oh, no. No, no. I need more time to research the dwarven machinery. Thank you for offering, though.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where's the courier?
output: I don't know. Are you not listening at all? It was a simple task, so I didn't keep close tabs on it like I do with the dangerous stuff.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What went wrong?
output: Without boring you with the, ahh, details, I am attempting to re-create the circumstances of the event. The dwarves were very clever, tapping into and drawing power from the Heart of Lorkhan itself. Lacking the heart of a dead god myself, I was attempting to substitute a rather specific soul gem. The ahh, the one you helped me acquire.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Haven't they been gone a long time?
output: Precisely! What could be worth studying about a long-lost civilization?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's the staff you wanted.
output: Well, well. All right, you delivered on your end, so I'll deliver on mine. Here's the gem Arniel was after. Can't imagine what he expects to do with that... it's warped beyond any ability to capture a soul.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What happens now?
output: Now? I announce to all of Markarth that I have returned. Don't worry about your name. They'll know who to blame and fear after today. It'll take years, but I'll organize the Forsworn again. We'll reclaim our land, and then, when power is ours, we'll have peace. A kingdom. Until then, let me offer you a warning. Beware the Forsworn. No place in the Reach is safe from us now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll take my pay.
output: Here you go. Your continued assistance to the cause is appreciated.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll donate my earnings to the cause.
output: I wish more had the dedication and strength of character that you demonstrate. I'll be sure this gets put to good use.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you surrender?
output: I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word. I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word. I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word. I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word. I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word. I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word. I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word. I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word. I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word. I surrender! Give me a few hours to gather my household, and I'll depart. You have my word.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've cleared the mine of spiders.
output: Gone? Every one of them? Why, that's incredible.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the spiders infesting the mine.
output: Moved right in and made themselves at home. Did it overnight. I'm not even sure exactly where they came from. No one's been hurt yet, and they seem to be staying in the mine, but who knows how long that will last? If we can't get back into the mine, our town is sunk.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the spiders infesting the mine.
output: I'd give my eye teeth if it meant getting those damn spiders out of the mine! One day we were cracking rocks in the deepest parts of the mine and the next day they were all over the place.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes. She wants you to leave her alone.
output: What? That little tease! Leading me on and turning cold at the last minute. I don't think so.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll handle those draugr for you.
output: You're joking, right? Those bone-walkers will tear you limb from limb. But if you want to get yourself killed, go ahead.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I go where I please.
output: Fine, but there's a whole crypt of draugr underneath the mine. We're not going in there until the Jarl's men come to clear them out, so I wouldn't go down there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's all this about the Forsworn?
output: Seems Kolskeggr Mine got hit by Forsworn. Those madmen get more bold every season. Pavo and Gat are the only survivors. I'll be sending word to the Jarl about this, but I don't know when help will come.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's all this about the Forsworn?
output: Was. Forsworn came in the night. Killed everyone. Gat and I are the only ones who escaped. Hopefully Skaggi will send word to the Jarl and something will be done.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Not right now.
output: As you wish.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That's too bad.
output: Aye.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That's too bad.
output: You're telling me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll make sure she gets it.
output: Thank you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't have time for that.
output: Then leave. Then leave.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What if I took care of the Forsworn?
output: I'm sure Pavo would be grateful, and we'd all rest a little easier. But that's nonsense. You can't handle a group of Forsworn by yourself. If their axes don't get you, their magic will.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What if I took care of the Forsworn?
output: I'd be grateful. Kolskeggr is my home. But, I wouldn't go there if I were you. There's a whole group of them with axes and magic on their side. You'd never stand a chance.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll find those gauntlets.
output: We will see. We will see.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You better start caring. (Intimidate)
output: Haven't up until now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are these "natives" you mentioned?
output: They just call themselves the people of the Reach. Lot of common blood with the Bretons, by the looks of them. Used to have their own kingdom, till the Nords came, now they're at the bottom of the hay pile.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll stay out, then.
output: Good to hear.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you own this mine?
output: Skaggi is in charge, not me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you own this mine?
output: That it is. Good to be home. Let me know if you dig up any ore. We'll pay a fair wage.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hand the key over. Now. (Intimidate)
output: Are you serious? I say more threatening words to my husband.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is my destiny?
output: That is for you to discover. We can show you the Way, but not your destination.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You mean I'm not the only Dragonborn?
output: You are not the first. There have been many of the Dragon Blood since Akatosh first bestowed that gift upon mortalkind. Whether you are the only Dragonborn of this age... that is not ours to know. You are the only one that has been revealed thus far. That is all I can say.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready to learn.
output: You have shown that you are Dragonborn. You have the inborn gift. But do you have the discipline and temperament to follow the path laid out for you? That remains to be seen.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm answering your summons, Master.
output: We are honored to welcome a Dragonborn to High Hrothgar. We will do our best to teach you how to use your gift in fulfillment of your destiny.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I want to find out what it means to be Dragonborn.
output: We are here to guide you in that pursuit, just as the Greybeards have sought to guide those of the Dragon Blood that came before you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you? What is this place?
output: We are the Greybeards, followers of the Way of the Voice. You stand in High Hrothgar, on the slopes of Kynareth's sacred mountain. Here we commune with the voice of the sky, and strive to achieve balance between our inner and outer selves.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: If Maven already threw you in jail, why steal her horse?
output: I'm not stealing anything. Besides, some jail time isn't going to make me roll over and play dead.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Letrush already agreed to pay me.
output: Well then, if you don't want the extra gold, you can certainly let Letrush keep it as a gesture of goodwill.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have a filled black soul gem.
output: Which is utterly useless at the moment. You need to fill it with a soul.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Let's go. Let me worry about the guards.
output: Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so. Well... if you say so.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What happened to your bow?
output: If you have the guts to head into the Ratway and get my bow back, I'll pay you what I can. A few days ago, some thieves from Riften broke in here and stole it! Can you imagine? Took the only thing of value we had.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found your bow.
output: That's it! You found it!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found Liefnarr's body.
output: No, it can't be... oh my... and all this time, I was thinking he'd been unfaithful to me. I feel so stupid.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What happened to Liefnarr?
output: He said he was going east towards the border of Morrowind to trade some of our grain to some folks at Broken Helm Hollow. I waited and waited, and he never came back. Probably shacked up with some elven whore. Good riddance to him I say. If I only knew where he was, I'd sure give him a piece of my mind.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Not just yet.
output: Well, hurry it up!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Let's go.
output: All aboard!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: No coin right now.
output: Well then you'd better have something I really want to buy.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I do. The question is, what have you got?
output: Let's just take a look then.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can we do business?
output: I hope you've got some coin.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I understand you're an elf who knows how to get things.
output: All right, let's not overdo it. Meet me at my quarters.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are your thoughts on Cicero and the Night Mother?
output: Two hundred years ago, I would have lain down my life for the Unholy Matron. But that is an age long since passed. Astrid is my matron now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are your thoughts on Cicero and the Night Mother?
output: Without the Night Mother, there is no Dark Brotherhood. The Matron deserves our unwavering support and respect. Though I admit, I find her Keeper a bit too exuberant for my liking.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are your thoughts on Cicero and the Night Mother?
output: The witless fool and his pet corpse? Take a guess.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are your thoughts on Cicero and the Night Mother?
output: Their arrival is the best thing that's happened to this Sanctuary in years. Astrid is an effective leader, but we've been rudderless for too long. Scrounging for contracts, abandoning the Tenets. The Dark Brotherhood has been reduced to a group of common cutthroats. Frankly, it's embarrassing.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are your thoughts on Cicero and the Night Mother?
output: Truthfully? I'm not entirely sure. It's not that I don't have the utmost respect for Sithis, and the Night Mother, and the ancient ways. I do. But I've never been much for religion. I kill because it's what I've been trained to do. It's all I know. So long as Astrid is happy, I'm happy.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are your thoughts on Cicero and the Night Mother?
output: I don't like mimes, minstrels, thespians, acrobats, jugglers, troubadours or tumblers. Flutists give me a headache. I particularly hate jesters. As a rule, I'm also not crazy about the corpses of old women. For the Night Mother, I'll make an exception. But Astrid is the only mistress I serve.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: Look. If you're trying to get to know me - don't. I don't like you, and I never will. It's nothing personal. But...  My wife trusts you, and I trust her judgment. So you can't be all bad.   Here's all you need to know: I'm a werewolf. I like killing things. I love Astrid. I hate annoying people. And the color blue gives me a headache.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: I might ask the same of you. For you are more than mortal. You are moon-born. You are wolf. So you're a Companion, then? I can't imagine you got your gift anywhere else. I hope you have better luck with them than I did. Oh yes, I was once brother to the Companions. Let's just say they found my methods "unsettling." The Dark Brotherhood, obviously, feels differently.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: What a curious question. Well, I enjoy moonlit nights, taking long walks on the beach, knitting and unicorns. In fact, I once took a seaside stroll, on a moonlit night, and discovered a unicorn... which I proceeded to stab in the throat with a crochet needle. I'm a woman of refined, yet simple tastes.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: I'm just a little girl! The Dark Brotherhood killed my mama and papa, and then they took me captive! Please, please help me! Rather convincing, don't you think? In truth, I'm no more a little girl than you are. I was once, of course. Three hundred years ago. Vampirism tends to keep one remarkably... fresh.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: Hmph. I like to say I was born with a wand in my hand. Well, not literally - you can see how painful that would have been for mother. But I was a prodigy! Casting simple spells by one, completing complex incantations by three. Resurrecting corpses by seven! Ha! I went on to teach at the College - left after two years. Too simple. Too safe. None of them truly understood the glory of the Destruction school...  When I was thirteen I accidentally burned down the family home. A bit of lightning gone awry. Ah, but soon after I mastered my gifts. Completely.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: Once, I was a Shadowscale. An assassin in service to the King of Black Marsh. Trained by the Dark Brotherhood since the day of my hatching. Ah, but that was a lifetime ago. Today, I am the last of my kind. My order is extinct. Now, I happily serve Astrid, and this Sanctuary. I am a trained killer, and once again have been given purpose. Life is good.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: This Sanctuary has been my entire life since I was a young woman. That's when I first discovered my, shall we call it "aptitude," for elimination. I had an uncle, you see. He made certain... unwanted advances. So I killed him. And liked it. Then I killed again. And liked it even more. And so on. I was recruited by the Dark Brotherhood, and have been here ever since. I met my husband Arnbjorn, rose to leadership. And now here we are.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: Ah, well, I'm Redguard, as I'm sure you've noticed. Though not like most of my kind you'll find in Skyrim, that's for damned sure. I am a child of Hammerfell, born of the sands of the mighty Alik'r. In that great desert, blood is a shade of crimson I can scarce describe. My past is long and storied, and not altogether proud. But the Dark Brotherhood saved me from myself. And I have never looked back.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: Me? Oh, Cicero is just the Keeper! I... keep! I look after our matron, you see. The Night Mother. I keep her clean, and protected, and happy... But I am not the Listener. Oh no. There is no Listener. Not yet! But some day, some day, some day I pray, that one will come to hear her say...  The words.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about yourself?
output: Me? Oh, Cicero is just the Keeper! I... keep! I look after our matron, you see. The Night Mother. I keep her clean, and protected, and happy... But I am not the Listener. Oh no. You are the Listener! You heard the words! And everything will soon be put right.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Yeah. Follow my wife's orders, and don't do anything stupid.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: You must speak to that Muiri woman, correct? I have heard rumors in Windhelm. She was recently implicated in a thievery, along with her lover. The lover will likely be your target. If memory serves me correctly, he leads a group of bandits. So this may be rather interesting for you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: The contracts I dole out are fairly simple - go to a location, and kill the target. But this is different. The jobs Astrid gives you will be more important, and usually more complex. Just keep your wits about you. And for Sithis' sake, don't get killed.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: And one more thing. Have fun. You'll be committing a dark deed, but there's no reason you shouldn't enjoy yourself. You're only young once. Trust me, I know. You're headed to The Hag's Cure, right? It's a good shop. You should examine their wares. Never pass up the chance to buy a good potion... or poison.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Yes. Just because you're now a professional assassin, don't think you have to skulk around in the dark like a skeever and stab people. Do what I do. Walk up to your target, introduce yourself, melt their skin off, and then run like the wind. Works every time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: You're being sent to meet with the contact directly, is that correct? What a most unusual occurrence. Astrid usually performs this duty herself. I can only assume she wants to test the full breadth of your abilities. So. Be polite, and professional, and represent us well.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: She said that? If I find anyone working against my wife, or this Sanctuary, I'll beat them to death with their own severed head. Of course, they'd probably already be dead... But you know what I mean!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: You're joking. While I can understand if some family members wish to honor the Old Ways once more, surely no one would oppose Astrid's rule.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Does she? Listen, brother... Astrid is my mistress, and I worship the ground she walks on. But this Cicero business has her a bit... paranoid.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Does she? Listen, sister... Astrid is my mistress, and I worship the ground she walks on. But this Cicero business has her a bit... paranoid.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Oh! Well, I hope she doesn't suspect me. I mean, I've spoken with Cicero a bit, and he's quite charming. But I'd never go against Astrid. Never.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Ha! And would that surprise anyone? This Sanctuary's a mess. Wouldn't surprise me if somebody's talking to the fool on the sly. Making deals. And no, before you ask, it's not me. I know which side my bread is buttered on.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: To what end? Usurping Astrid's authority as leader of the Sanctuary? Hmmm... Yes, I can see her concern. Thank you for bringing this to my attention.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Oho! The Listener wants my counsel! I thought you were above the opinions of mere mortals, now that you commune with dead old women.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Just remember Astrid's commitment to her Sanctuary, to her Family. A Family that now counts you as one of its own. Honor Astrid above all others.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: You may be the Listener, or you may just be a lunatic who's started hearing voices. Either way, Astrid is still your mistress. Not the Night Mother.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: The man you need to speak with, his name is Motierre? That's a very old and powerful Breton family, firmly established in Cyrodiil. Most curious...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: So you're the Listener, hmm? Well that hardly seems fair. You just got here. The Night Mother should have spoken to me. Any idiot could see that. But, I will serve gladly, as that's my lot in life. Now let's see. Ah yes, Volunruud. It's an old crypt, infested with Draugr. So plan accordingly.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: If the Night Mother truly spoke to you, if you really are the Listener... your destiny was written in the Void. Astrid is right to fear your power.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: You've got to kill a soft little woman on her wedding day. What's next? Murdering a crippled orphan in his sleep?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Your contract sounds simple, which means it certainly will not be. Getting into that reception will be easy, but have you thought about getting out?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Slaughtering the Emperor's cousin? At her wedding? Those guards will be out for blood. Wouldn't surprise me if the crowd jumped in too.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: It's no fair. I love weddings. Astrid should have given this contract to me. Instead, she's got me visiting cities, assessing security. How boring. But listen, I think I can help you. The wedding reception is outside the Temple of the Divines, right? In Solitude? Well, there's an old statue there. I've seen it. Hanging right over where she'll be standing. Old means weak. Weak means it could fall. Hmmm? If so, the bride will probably address the crowd from the balcony. It overlooks the courtyard.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Ah, killing her will be easy. She'll be so happy, she'll never see it coming. I should know, I killed a bride once. It was our honeymoon. Tepid, I said! The bathwater should be tepid! Lukewarm is not tepid! Close, maybe, but there's is a difference! Stupid cow.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: I hope you don't mind, but I took the liberty of surveying the site of the reception. There's a small parapet, just opposite the balcony, that would prove an excellent spot for a long-range kill. I left something there for you. If you're inclined to take that approach.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: What's the matter, Listener? Night Mother not feeling very chatty these days? You need help from your flesh and blood lessers? You've got to track a man, kill him, and then frame him for a crime. This contract's perfect... for me. Clearly, my lovely wife made a mistake.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Astrid had me investigate the Penitus Oculatus. Their members are highly trained, effective warriors. Be on your guard, brother.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Astrid had me investigate the Penitus Oculatus. Their members are highly trained, effective warriors. Be on your guard, sister.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Killing Gaius Maro in a city will be challenging because of all the guards, but fights, even murder, are fairly common. Killing him secretly will certainly make things easier on you, but if there are witnesses, so be it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Normally I talk to a victim before I end his life, but I wouldn't recommend it this time. Maro will be alert to danger. Talking may spook him.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Remember, your target is Gaius Maro, the son. Not Commander Maro, the father! We need him alive. But the son... Ha! Scorch his face off!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Yes, do not underestimate Cicero. A man like that, small and foolish, is easy to mock. To underestimate. Don't make the same mistake I did.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Going after Cicero now would be a fool's errand. That little jester is currently being digested in Arnbjorn's stomach, mark my words.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Cicero destroyed any sympathy I may have had for him when he wounded Veezara. Kill the fool and be done with it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: All right, so maybe I was wrong. Maybe Cicero coming here wasn't the best thing that could have happened. But even I didn't anticipate this. Well, you know the old saying. When life gives you lemons... ...go murder a clown.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: I feel only pity for Cicero. He must die, of course, but can any of us truly blame him for his actions? We mocked him, disrespected the Old Ways. Our actions were shameful. Surely, the Night Mother weeps this day.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: The last thing you need is my help. Listener or not, you've proven yourself time and again. To Astrid, to the Family... and to me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Hmm... Well, assuming this Gourmet is just a cook, it will probably be an easy kill. Just be discreet - alerting others will be the real threat.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Hmph. I wouldn't worry too much about this Virane giving you the information you need. Give him a good scare, and he'll squawk like a Hagraven. That said... If your attack on Virane is witnessed, those Markarth guards are going to be none too happy...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Yes - don't kill the Gourmet! Oh, I know you have to, but it makes me sad all the same. I love the Gourmet's recipes. The world will soon be a blander, less flavorful place.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: You've been directed to dispose of the Gourmet's body, is that correct? I often find water to be a suitable hiding place. A lake, a pool... the sea.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Yes. You're killing the Emperor himself. The Dark Brotherhood will get one shot at this, and you've been given the honors. So don't screw up.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: You get to kill the Emperor. The bloody Emperor. You'd better enjoy this one. You owe us all that much. So make it bloody, painful, and spectacular.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I can't do that right now.
output: Then leave.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It will be done.
output: We will see.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're the Jarl? I'm looking for work.
output: Are you a sellsword? I don't like your kind. No honor. No loyalty. Unreliable. But I can't turn away a potential ally in these times. Let's see if you're better than a common mercenary. My scouts have tracked down one of the Forsworn leaders, hiding out in their blood-soaked camps. Deal with them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're the chief?
output: Yes. I earned the right by slaying my father in single combat. One day, I will have a son who will challenge me when I become too old to lead, and the stronghold will have a new chief. Until then, I alone have the right to have wives and children. It ensures our strength.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are all the Orc strongholds guarded?
output: The strongholds keep to themselves. Skyrim hasn't always been kind to the Orcs. The strongholds keep to themselves. Skyrim hasn't always been kind to the Orcs. For an outsider like you to be accepted, an Orc would have to make you Blood-Kin, and send word to the chiefs. For an outsider like you to be accepted, an Orc would have to make you Blood-Kin, and send word to the chiefs.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're on. (Brawl - 100 gold)
output: That's the spirit! Let's go.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're on. (Brawl - 100 gold)
output: Hey, I may have had a few, but I can still count. You don't have a hundred septims on you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The leader of <Alias=Dungeon> is dead.
output: I'm impressed. Forsworn usually make short work of mercenaries, but you took care of them. Here is your reward.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've got better things to do.
output: Pfft. Snowback.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for an old guy, hiding out somewhere in Riften.
output: Don't know his name, but there is a guy like that hiding out down here. Paid plenty for nobody to know about it. You're not the first person to come in here asking about him, either, so be careful.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for an old guy, hiding out somewhere in Riften.
output: Yeah, I think I know who you mean. He's paid good money for nobody to know he's down here, but I guess I can tell you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for an old guy, hiding out somewhere in Riften.
output: Down in the Ratway Warrens. Nice place, if you don't mind the stench, rats, and assorted lowlifes as neighbors.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for an old guy, hiding out somewhere in Riften.
output: That's interesting. Why do I care? You want a drink, or maybe just a few broken bones?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for an old guy, hiding out somewhere in Riften.
output: Never heard of anybody like that. But if you want to hide out in Riften, the Ratway's where you'd be. Never heard of anybody like that. But if you want to hide out in Riften, the Ratway's where you'd be. There's a sort of tavern down there, the Ragged Flagon. Where all the lowlifes in Riften get drunk and knife each other. There's a sort of tavern down there, the Ragged Flagon. Where all the lowlifes in Riften get drunk and knife each other. You might try there, if you can get through the Ratway alive. You might try there, if you can get through the Ratway alive.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I will undertake this penance. Where is the village?
output: We believe the place in our vision to be Karthwasten. Now move quickly. The girl must be brought to the temple as soon as possible.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is the penalty?
output: Normally, a quick death.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is the penalty?
output: Normally, a period of servitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why is the temple closed?
output: The sisters are communing with Dibella. They can't be disturbed. You'll have to come back another time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What use is that?
output: The ceremony you so rudely interrupted was the Exalted Protocol of the Dibellan Sybil. I don't expect you to know what that means.  Suffice to say that our Sybil was recently lost to us. Through the Protocol, we have seen the home of the next Sybil, to the north, in a small village pressed against the stone. If you can travel there, and retrieve our young Sybil, your transgression will be forgiven.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This statue looks valuable.
output: Indeed it is.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes?
output: You just can't leave well enough alone, can you?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm not your errand boy. The statue is mine!
output: So be it. We gave you a choice.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was curious about the temple.
output: Unfortunately for you, we don't allow men into the inner sanctum.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was curious about the temple.
output: Unfortunately for you, we don't allow the uninitiated into the inner sanctum.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Okay, then let's get going.
output: Yes, let's!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who else is looking for Esbern?
output: Various shady types I've never seen before. I'd watch my back if I was you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't need your help. I can do this myself.
output: Well, I guess you'll have to.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll be fine. You just take care of yourself.
output: If you really think you can manage... I mean, I'd hate to leave now and find out later you met some horrible fate at the hands of the Caller. But if you insist, I suppose I'll be on my way. Thank you, and good luck.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why don't the others talk?
output: Their Voices are too powerful for anyone not trained in the Way to withstand. Even a whisper could kill you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Don't take any chances with this one. Use the Jarrin Root to poison the Emperor's food. You're disguising yourself as a chef - it only makes sense.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Well... While it's true I prefer sorcery's more destructive nuances, we mustn't forget the many spells with simpler, more practical applications.  Sure, you poison the Emperor, but what then? Why not summon an Atronach to cause some chaos? Or turn invisible and slip away. Use your imagination!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: What an honor, the assassination of an Emperor. And all because you are the Listener, favored by the Night Mother, anointed by Sithis. I am so very happy for you. If not a bit... envious.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: Astrid has arranged for your escape, no? Then you have nothing to worry about. Get in, kill the Emperor, and get out. Then, we celebrate.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Any advice on my current contract?
output: It took all the favors, bribes, and blackmails I could muster, but I've secured your exit out of the keep. Just follow my instructions, and the Dark Brotherhood will be back on top. All thanks to you... Listener.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: When can I meet your leader, Paarthurnax?
output: As I said, you will know you are ready when your Voice can open the path to him.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are Shouts in the dragon language?
output: Dragons have always been able to Shout. Language is intrinsic to their very being. There is no difference in the dragon tongue between debating and fighting. Shouting comes as naturally to a dragon as breathing, or speaking. In mythic times, when mortalkind was in great need, the goddess Kynareth granted us the ability to speak as dragons do. For most people, long years of training are required to learn even the simplest Shout. But for you, the dragon speech is in your blood, and you learn it almost without effort.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: There are only four of you?
output: Five. Our leader, Paarthurnax, lives alone on the peak of the Throat of the World. When your Voice can open the path, you will know you are ready to speak to him.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You've planned this from the beginning.
output: If we want to stay on top in Skyrim, the Guild needs that paragon back. Without it, we're just a bunch of petty thieves.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You mean wealth?
output: Not exactly. The crown is what the Guild calls a paragon; an object that enhances our thieving abilities. At least, that's what I'm told it does... there hasn't been a paragon in this Guild for hundreds of years.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me what this gem's worth.
output: Do I look like a merchant to you? You're going to have to take that up with Vex in the Thieves Guild. Get in good with them and you'll find her.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Got any dirt on this? (Show unusual gem)
output: Only way you could have found one of those is by stealin' it. Guess you'll fit in around here better than I thought. So what do you want to know?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: We haven't really been introduced.
output: No, I suppose we haven't. Brelyna Maryon, of House Telvanni. First of my family to leave Morrowind in a long time. Now I'm here to study Conjuration. That's what's important.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This is important. It's about the dragons.
output: Dragons, is it? Does that make you the fabled "Dragonborn" we've heard mention of?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't understand.
output: It's quite simple really. There are some who shall not be dignified by being named, who have implied that it is not. That is to say, it's been suggested that resources used for my study of Restoration could be put to better use. Any other use, in fact. It's not just healing cuts and bruises, you know. The undead are a very real, very dangerous threat and Restoration magics can keep them at bay. Not to mention the benefit of wards! How can they continually overlook wards! It's baffling!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm sorry, what?
output: I've just been asked enough questions. I'm here to learn, not to explain myself over and over. Forgive me, I didn't mean to assume.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Not really.
output: I... I see. Well, I'm glad we've established this early, rather than me hearing about it years or decades later when the whispers behind my back are loud enough.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Summoning undead isn't frowned upon?
output: By Sheor, no. Those archaic policies died out with the Mages Guild, and were never enforced here. Necromancy, as any other type of magic, is a tool to be used. Of course, non-mages may not see it that way, so we don't go around flaunting it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Of course it's valid.
output: Good, good. Not that I require validation, of course. There are just some - and I shan't name names - who would disagree. It can make life difficult when one's colleagues fail to recognize the research one engages in.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can you tell me more about Wards?
output: The key to wards is that they take time to charge. Not long, but you can't start casting with a fireball coming at you. Also, if your ward isn't negated by an incoming spell, it will recharge itself after a moment or two. Just be careful. Casting wards requires constant concentration, and you can easily find yourself drained of your magicka reserves.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This is quite an impressive library.
output: A mage is only as good as what he knows. I try and make sure as much knowledge is available as possible. We've been keeping this collection since the Second Era. Books have come and gone during that time, but it's mostly intact.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You take your work very seriously.
output: Of course I do. If I didn't, most of these books would've been burned to ashes or dissolved to nothing before the Third Era. Mages need to be reminded to be careful around research materials.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I am Dragonborn. Now let me pass!
output: So you have the Voice, then? I would be quite impressed to see that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Winterhold used to be full of dark elves?
output: Didn't you know? Before the Oblivion Crisis, many elves called Winterhold their home. More visited the College from Morrowind every year. After, growing distrust of magic made life difficult for many. Some left rather than endure the growing hatred from the local Nords. Others returned home after the Red Year, when Vvardenfell erupted and caused much destruction. Winterhold itself died in the years between then and now. What's left out there is a husk. Only the College really remains.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It does, and I can prove it.
output: Can you? You have the power of the Voice? Now I'm interested. By all means, show me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you're treated badly because of your work?
output: Well... No. Not really. Not directly, I mean. But I know things are said behind my back. Conversations cease when I enter rooms. I'm quite aware of what's going on here, and I will not stand for it!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It's your funeral.
output: The gods will be the judge of that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry. You'll have to find some other way to stroke your ego.
output: I won't take no for answer!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found Esbern.
output: So what are you doing here? Lorkhan's eyes, you can't let the Thalmor get to him first! Get back to Riften!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found Esbern.
output: Did you tell him you were Dragonborn? I didn't think so. Lorkhan's eyes, do I have to do everything myself? Get back to Riften before the Thalmor find him!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are the Thalmor so interested in finding you?
output: Well. They've been hunting down Blades since the Great War, on general principle. But if you mean me, now, in particular... maybe they've started to get an inkling of what the return of the dragons means. I don't suppose they want the world to end any more than we do. Or at least, they'd prefer to end it on their terms.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found Esbern.
output: Really? He's safe? Where is he?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's so important about me being Dragonborn?
output: Haven't you been paying attention to anything I've said? Only you can finally defeat Alduin and avert the end of the world! If we can just find out what this Dragonrend Shout is, you may have a chance. Or not. There's no guarantee with prophecy. Merely hope.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's so important about me being Dragonborn?
output: It's the prophecy, don't you see? Only a Dragonborn can stop Alduin and avert the end of the world! But... I don't yet know how you can stop him. The prophecy doesn't say. But Alduin's Wall does. I hope.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's so important about me being Dragonborn?
output: Not yet, not yet. When we get to Riverwood... with Delphine... I'll tell you both then, when I've collected my thoughts. I never expected... well, suddenly here you are and now I'm too muddled to explain myself. I still need some time to get used to the idea that there might be hope for us after all.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you? How do you know Delphine?
output: Hasn't she told you? We were both Blades, back when that still meant something. Now we're just fellow fugitives from the Thalmor. I didn't know she was still alive, but I'm not surprised. She was a survivor.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He's on his way.
output: What? You left him on his own? With the Thalmor after him? Go make sure he's safe and bring him here!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He's on his way.
output: Mara's mercy, then he's safe! Come on, we have a lot to discuss.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is there some kind of trouble in Morthal?
output: That which is unknown can create unease, even fear. It is to be expected. Some fear our new resident wizard. As they grow to know him, they will accept him. Time will prove me right.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing there?
output: Please, cut me down!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you down here?
output: I'm too weak right now. Between the spiders and the coven, I'd be dead before escaping the cave.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Coven? What do you mean?
output: These are no dainty college mages. Bashnag has the skill of a magister and the mind of a warlord. This is a dangerous bunch. They're good company if you want to study necromancy in peace, though.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes sir. Sorry, sir.
output: Well? Get out of here and mind your rounds.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Emissary Elenwen was asking for you inside. (Persuade)
output: Why didn't you say so? Take over my post. Make sure nobody enters the Solar.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Maybe some other time.
output: Oh. All right... I guess I'll just keep practicing on my own. Sorry to bother you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sure, I can teach you.
output: Really? Great! Okay. So, first, you raise your ward and I'll throw a little spell at it. That way I can see the "right" way to do things.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: I did. Your time, it seems, has come.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: Yes, and we have something special for you this time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you mean?
output: Last week a scholar came to us. He said he knew where we could find another fragment of Wuuthrad. He seemed a fool to me, but if he's right, the honor of the Companions demands that we seek it out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does he want?
output: Don't know. He just said he needed to talk to you before you do anything else. I don't like making him angry, but there is some work for you if you want it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does he want?
output: He didn't say, but you'd better move fast. There's probably something I could find for you to do, but best to check with him.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does he want?
output: I don't know, but he sounded impatient.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're going to be my Shield-Brother?
output: So I'm told. Try and keep up. So I'm told. Try and keep up.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: <Alias=Dungeon> is free of bandits.
output: That's a load off my mind. Here's your pay.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Fine. Forget I asked.
output: Already have.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Some coin, to soothe your guilt? (<BribeCost> gold)
output: Well, for that much, I don't think Malacath would turn his scowl on me. All right, outlander. My axe is yours.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Some coin, to soothe your guilt? (<BribeCost> gold)
output: My honor isn't so cheap, outlander.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Forget it.
output: Suit yourself.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: They'll understand. Trust me. (Persuade)
output: You're right. Malacath teaches us to meet our fate. Perhaps this is mine.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: They'll understand. Trust me. (Persuade)
output: What do you know about my people, outlander?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll do it.
output: Good. I'll have a sack of coin waiting for you when you get back.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You just told me you missed adventure. (Persuade)
output: You're right. Look at me, talking in circles like some old wise woman. Very well, outlander. You have my axe when you need it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You just told me you missed adventure. (Persuade)
output: Yes, but I am honor-bound to stay here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What if I talk to <Alias.ShortName=Target>?
output: If you want to try, go right ahead. I don't think anything will get through that thick skull of his, though.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You want to leave the stronghold?
output: Yes, but I must stay here and wait for the day when I'll be married and sent to another stronghold. It is our way, and I am proud to follow my people's traditions, but I can't help but feel chained.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You want to leave the stronghold?
output: I couldn't. It would shame my chief and my mother and foremothers.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You don't know who you'll marry?
output: No. A chief's daughter marries who her chief wishes. It ensures the stronghold receives a fair trade in goods for my absence. I used to look forward to the day when I was of age, to see new places and people, but now it feels like a cage.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You miss traveling?
output: I do. There is a freedom the roads give you that the stronghold does not. But I have a place here, and I wouldn't want to dishonor my clan by leaving again like some young pup.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You miss traveling?
output: I couldn't. It would dishonor the place the chief has made for me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do for the stronghold?
output: I am Larak's daughter. Soon, I'll be of age and will be sent to marry an Orc chief in some distant stronghold. Until then, I train. My new home will need strength, and my new sisters must know I am not weak when I arrive.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You served in the Legion?
output: I did. I was known as Ghorbash gro-Dushnikh in those days, in honor of my homeland. Many Orcs leave the stronghold to join the Legion. They welcome our skill in battle and smithing, and we welcome a chance to see the world.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Fine, then.
output: Thank you for asking.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Fine. Forget I asked.
output: As you wish.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Someone giving you trouble?
output: Too many drinking games, too many bets, and I'm too old to ever raise the coin on my own.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do for the stronghold?
output: Me? I'm Burguk's brother. I came back after serving many years in the Legion. By then, Burguk had already become chief, and he welcomed me home as family, not a rival as is tradition.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're weak. (Intimidate)
output: I am not weak. Very well, outlander, I will go with you whenever you are ready.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're weak. (Intimidate)
output: You dare challenge a child of Malacath?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry to hear that.
output: I can take care of myself. A Whiterun woman learns how to handle a few idiot men early in life.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: Bear fat in the hearth fire, if you believe Hroggar. I do, but some folk here think he set the fire himself.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is Wuuthrad?
output: Ysgramor was the hero who started the Companions. Wuuthrad was his weapon. He came from the ancient homeland and killed all the elves.  But not all of them, because some of them are still here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: We've been awaiting your return. We've been awaiting your return. We've been awaiting your return. We've been awaiting your return.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: Bad people who don't like werewolves.  So they don't like us either.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why did Skjor call this my Trial?
output: I watch you to make sure you are honorable.  If you are honorable and strong, then I can call you brother.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: So I'm told. Let's see if you impress. So I'm told. Let's see if you impress.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why is your cemetery so large?
output: Many battles have been fought here over the centuries. Graves were dug and monuments built, and the town grew around these. In time, Falkreath came to be known as the heroes' graveyard. Many noble Jarls and renowned warriors asked to be buried here. Falkreath's reputation has faded somewhat, but the graves remain, reminding us of the one inevitable truth of life.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How long have you been a Steward?
output: It was Dengeir who made me a steward, long ago when he was young. When Dengeir's health began to fail, young Sidgeir was appointed Jarl in his stead. It was simpler just to keep me as steward. Sidgeir has no interest in running his hold, and so leaves such matters to me. As for my part, I do my best to see that folk are treated fairly.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does your inexperience make your job difficult?
output: Difficult? I am a Jarl. I eat the most succulent meat, drink the finest ale and hunt with the best hounds in the hold. Meanwhile, my very capable steward sees to the needs of the smallfolk and ensures that my hold runs smoothly. Being a Jarl could hardly be simpler. You should try it sometime.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How did you become a Jarl while so young?
output: My uncle Dengeir was Jarl until a short time ago. His old age and failing health caught up with him, and he stepped down. He now serves us honorably as Thane, and to the great benefit of the hold, I now serve as Jarl.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I need to talk to you.
output: What can I get for you? You made it in. Good. As soon as you distract the guards, I'll open this door and we can get you on your way. Let's hope we both live through this day.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How long have you been here?
output: Year seven, I think? Surprised I haven't cut my own throat out by now, but something keeps me going.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: First it was 6 months, then a year, then 2 years. Now I'm in for life.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

Your best bet would be to erase his debt with Maven Black-Briar. If you talk to her, she might be able to give you the details.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: That'd be Vald. A real piece of work, that one. Mercer's holding something over his head, keeping him loyal. Talk to Vex. She used to know him very well... if you catch my meaning.

output: Good question. I've only set foot inside a few times myself and that was in Mercer's company. If you can get past his trained watchdog, I think your best bet might be the ramp to the second floor balcony in his backyard.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll make it worth your while. (Bribe)
output: I can't believe it! How did ya' talk her into this? Never mind, I don't care. I'm just glad I don't gotta' work for Maven anymore. Here, ya' did me a favor, I guess I owe you one.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you in for?
output: I'm a Forsworn. One of our raids went bad, and I got captured. Would've been fine dying for the Reach with my kinsmen, but the Silver-Bloods want their ore mined, so they threw me in here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you in for?

output: Guards brought me in about 12 years ago. Was running a good group of bandits up until then. But these Forsworn. They're nothing like the men I cobbled together. They're real killers.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I wanted to know more about the Temple of Mara.
output: Wonderful. Where to begin? Mara is the Goddess of Love. The temple spreads her gifts by tending to the sick, the poor, and the lost. We also perform wedding ceremonies for all the loving couples in Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I could have a wedding at the temple?
output: Yes. If you were ready, of course. Are you familiar with how marriage works in Skyrim?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're looking to cure yourself?
output: Yes, but it's no easy matter.  But you don't need to share the worries of an old warrior. This day is to rejoice in your bravery!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What about you?
output: Well, I grow old. My mind turns towards the horizon. To Sovngarde. I worry that Shor won't call an animal to glory as he would a true Nord warrior. Living as beasts draws our souls closer to the Daedric Lord Hircine. Some may prefer an eternity in his Hunting Grounds, but I crave the fellowship of Sovngarde.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Follow me.
output: I'm right with you. I'm right with you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Follow me.
output: I've got your back.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you need?
output: Have you ever heard of a Shout that can knock a dragon out of the sky?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you need?
output: Let's go see if Esbern's right about Alduin's Wall.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you need?
output: After you, Dragonborn.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The Greybeards may have a point. Power is dangerous.
output: Only if you don't know how to use it. All the great heroes have had to learn to use their power. Those that shrank from their destiny... well, you've never heard of them, have you? And there are the villains - those that misused their power. There's always a choice, and there's always a risk. But if you live in fear of what might go wrong, you'll end up doing nothing. Like the Greybeards up on their mountain.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Don't worry. I'm not afraid of my own power.
output: Good. The Greybeards can teach you a lot, but don't let them turn you away from your destiny. You're Dragonborn, and you're the only one who can stop Alduin. Don't forget it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Wait here.
output: All right. Don't be long.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Wait here.
output: If you say so.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like to know more about Winterhold's history.
output: I'm afraid the Winterhold you see before you is somewhat... underwhelming. I can assure you, though, that it was quite something in its prime. An early capital of Skyrim, you know. Sadly, the Oblivion Crisis took its toll on Winterhold, in more ways than one. Then, the Great Collapse swallowed most of our beloved city.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like to know more about Winterhold's history.
output: What's there to tell? It's mostly gone now, thanks to those damned mages in the College. Someday there'll be proof they caused the Great Collapse. Most of a city just dropping off into the sea... That doesn't just happen.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me more about this artifact.
output: Mortals call it Dawnbreaker, for it was forged in a holy light that breaks upon my foes, burning away corruption and false life. You will enter my shrine, destroy Malkoran, and retrieve this mighty blade.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I had some questions about this city.
output: Do I look like a guide? Only thing I do is sell meat. Now, are you going to buy or not?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have a delivery from Kerah.
output: Oh, that's right. I keep forgetting to pick that up. Poor Kerah, such a patient woman. Now, you're supposed to get something for your trouble, aren't you? How about some gold? People seem to like that, I notice.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This store has seen better days, hasn't it?
output: Oh, by the Divines is it that obvious? I swear, if my Gunnar was alive to see me now. This store would finally be on its feet if I hadn't lost my last shipment to Forsworn attacks. A specially-made Dibella statuette. You aren't for hire, are you? A sellsword? I'll pay you if you can recover that statuette from the Forsworn.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found this statue in a Forsworn camp.
output: Ah, there it is! This little gold delight is going to keep us afloat for a while. Thank you. Here's something for your hard work.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This city looks so ancient. Have you been here long?
output: My family came here centuries ago. We've made a good living smithing the silver that flows through the city. But you probably wanted to know about the fancy carvings and stonework, didn't you? Travelers always do. Here, I have a delivery I need to make to Calcelmo. Why don't you take it to him? He knows the history of Markarth better than anyone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why do you need guards?
output: To protect my research, for one. There are more cutthroat scholars out there who would steal my findings if they got the chance. And the excavations into Nchuand-Zel are dangerous. Dwemer machines and traps still function even after thousands of years.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes. It's painfully obvious you don't know what you're doing.
output: You don't have to tell me that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That's quite a staff you have there.
output: I used to think so, too.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the problem?
output: Oh... hello there. Didn't notice you come up. I was focusing my magicka. Or at least, I thought I was. I don't really know what I'm doing.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: May I see the staff?
output: In fact. Keep it. I must have used up the magic in the staff or something. It's just a dumb stick of wood now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm listening.
output: Those kids are dead anyway. Killing me won't bring them back. I, on the other hand, have done quite a bit with my time on Mundus. Release me, and I'll share a bit of my wealth with you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're going back where you belong, dremora.
output: Where I belong is back aboard my ship, on the Abecean. You've no hope of defeating me, pup. Don't bother. Why not broker a bargain, instead?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: We're beneath Winterhold College. The Midden.
output: Ah, I was beginning to think the day would never come. So you broke the binding spell, did you? Matters little. Their souls are trapped in Oblivion all the same, and here I stay.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Vehlek Sain, I release you.
output: There's a smart lad. Take the map. The loot's hidden there. It'll show itself when you get near.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Vehlek Sain, I release you.
output: There's a smart lass. Check the map. The loot's hidden there. It'll show itself when you get near.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where did you come from?
output: Where am I? You! Out with it, then.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What wealth is this?
output: Years back, I had to ferret away some booty nearby. We'd sunk an Imperial Galleon off the coast. Good plunder, but we needed to travel light. We stashed what we couldn't carry, and I hid it with a trick I know. I can point you in the right direction, and we'll each go our separate ways.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Not a chance.
output: Have it your own way, meat.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How could I even release you?
output: Names have power, lad. You should know by now. Just say "Velehk Sain, I release you.", and "Poof!", I'm on my way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How could I even release you?
output: Names have power, lass. You should know by now. Just say "Velehk Sain, I release you.", and "Poof!", I'm on my way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Velehk Sain, I banish you to Oblivion!
output: Clever try, scab, but it won't be that easy!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I do. Now and forever.
output: Under the authority of Mara, the Divine of Love, I declare this couple to be wed. I present the two of you with these matching rings, blessed by Mara's divine grace. May they protect each of you in your new life together.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I made a mistake. I want to go ahead with the ceremony.
output: "Forgiveness is the heart of Mara's blessings." Very well. We shall re-arrange your wedding. Tomorrow. Same time as before.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Stop the wedding! I can't go through with this.
output: You're just going to walk away from your betrothal? Get out of the temple.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I made a mistake. I want to go ahead with the ceremony.
output: Well I think your betrothed might feel otherwise. The two of you will need to work this out before the temple will marry you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This had better be worth all the trouble.
output: Few outsiders earn the right to enter our strongholds. Speak with more respect, or we might forget your gifts. Feel free to trade with our smiths for Orc weapons and armor. Train with my warriors, or purchase poisons from the wise woman.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm honored.
output: Feel free to trade with our smiths for Orc weapons and armor. Train with my warriors, or purchase poisons from the wise woman. Welcome to our stronghold, Blood-Kin.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why do we need to be cautious?
output: The original Companions. Their finest warriors rest with Ysgramor. You'll have to prove yourselves to them. It's not that you're intruding. I'd wager they've actually expected us. They just want to be sure that you're worthy. Be ready for an honorable battle.

output: Hroggar's house? He lost his wife and daughter in the blaze. My people believe it to be cursed now. Who am I to gainsay them?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you so concerned about this?
output: I'll be the one asking the questions. All you need to know is that the Psijic Order is a rogue organization, believing themselves to be above the law. They have clashed with the Aldmeri Dominion before, and I have no intention of allowing that to happen here.

input: What do you expect from me, then?
output: We believe the your efforts should be directed towards dealing with the aftermath, but we cannot predict what that will be.
