output: Ah, look at the pretty, shiny coins. Now, how best to spend them?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where is this Underforge?
output: I forget that you've never seen it. Beneath the Skyforge, where Eorlund works.  The door is hidden, but I will show you the way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What just happened?
output: You were born into the pack, brother.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What just happened?
output: You were born into the pack, sister.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready.
output: Very well.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is there a cure?
output: Cure? Hah. You're sounding like the old man. I... shouldn't say that. I love Kodlak. I respect and follow him. But he's wrong on this. It's no curse. We're made into the greatest hunters in the land. If he's worried about some mead-swilling afterlife in Sovngarde, he's free to pursue it. I'll take the glories of the hunt right here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready for whatever test is next.
output: This is no test, new blood. This is a gift. Come inside.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does it mean to be a werewolf?
output: Nothing, until you choose to use it. Then, well... you got a taste. Stronger, faster. It doesn't last long, though. The blood of your foes can sustain you. If you're willing to feed.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is this place?
output: Here's all you need to know. Jorrvaskr is the oldest building in Whiterun. The Skyforge was here long before it was. And the Underforge taps an ancient magic that is older than men or elves. We bring you here to make you stronger, new blood. Now let's move.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Am I a werewolf now?
output: You have the blood of the wolf in you. You'll need to build up your strength before you can call on it again, though. Just be careful where you do it. Some cowards in this land can't stand the sight of glory before them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where do you stand on the war?
output: I stand where I have always stood. Here in Morthal. Now is not the time to fight amongst ourselves. I fear dark days approach and all of Skyrim's strength will be needed.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Morthal seems like a quiet little town.
output: That's what many here wanted. A quiet life in a quiet place, without the noise or the trouble of a city. Now some worry this wizard, Falion, will foul it all up.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like training in Alchemy.
output: You wish to do what I do? Very well.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I can't help with that right now.
output: Perhaps some other time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: May I enter the College?
output: Perhaps. But what is it you expect to find within?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you out here?
output: I am here to assist those seeking the wisdom of the College. And if, in the process, my presence helps to deter those who might seek to do harm, so be it. The more important question is: why are you here?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why would I want to complain about the College?
output: It is no great secret that we have been unjustly blamed for a great many things over the years. The good people of Skyrim on occasion would rather pass judgment than attempt to understand what we do here. Thus we must take certain precautions in order to secure our safety.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is this place?
output: Oh, forgive me. Most who arrive here do so because they have heard of the College beforehand. This is the College of Winterhold, a safe haven for mages in Skyrim. A place of wisdom and arcane knowledge.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I desire to bend the will of those around me.
output: Yes, the school of Illusion can be quite influential. Kings have risen to power because of it, and empires have been razed with it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I seek the knowledge of the Elder Scrolls.
output: Do you? It is true there are some here who have spent years studying the accumulated knowledge of the scrolls. But what you seek does not come easily, and can destroy those without a strong will.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I want to use the power of ice and fire to destroy any who oppose me.
output: I see. That power certainly exists, I assure you. Wield it faithfully, and few can withstand you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: CompanionsHit
output: Argh!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: Uf!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: Yergh!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: CompanionsHit
output: Egh!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes?
output: And just what do you think you're doing?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you trust General Tullius?
output: Hmmm... A question I am all to familiar with. One my very Thanes ask often. They worry that Tullius is so focused on the war, that he risks forgetting what's best for our people. The real irony is that, while General Tullius is certainly no Nord, the people of Skyrim would be lost without him. Trust is always difficult, especially for my people. Yet we must trust in Tullius' leadership. For what other choice do we have?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why did Ulfric kill your husband?
output: Because that's what traitorous cowards do when they desire power. Ulfric coveted the High King's throne. He thought he deserved it more than Torygg. And so he came before my husband and he... he shouted. With that terrible voice. Like something out of a legend... Or a nightmare. When Ulfric unleashed such fury, my husband he... he simply ceased to be. That is all I will say, for it grieves me to speak of it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do all the Thanes support Elisif?
output: Oh, most certainly. At least, when Elisif herself asks. If you're inquiring whether we have concerns about her age and inexperience, well, let me put it this way... The Thanes have every confidence in General Tullius's leadership.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does General Tullius respect Elisif?
output: Of course he does. What sort of a question is that? Maybe you've been listening to Erikur. There's been loose talk among some of the Thanes, and I suspect he's the cause of it. You'll pay those rumors no heed if you wish to retain your welcome in this city. She may be young, but Elisif is the Jarl by right. And here in Skyrim, if nothing else, we respect the traditions of our father's fathers. You'd do well to remember that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What will happen to Elisif if the Empire wins the war?
output: That remains to be seen. By rights, she has a legitimate claim as High Queen of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you the High Queen of Skyrim?
output: Not yet, no. Although it is true my husband Torygg was the High King, and I am his widow... now is not the time to lay claim to such a title. This land is riven by war, and her people suffer for it. The Stormcloaks are a blight on Skyrim, and like any blight... must be purged. Only then will I take my rightful place as High Queen.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Let's see what you can do with this. (<Global=InvestAmount> gold)
output: If you have spare weapons and armor to sell, bring them here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like to make an investment in your business.
output: Of course you want to invest in my business. I'm the finest blacksmith in all Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like to make an investment in your business.
output: How kind. At my age, I've certainly learned how to spend wisely.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Let's see what you can do with this. (<Global=InvestAmount> gold)
output: More coin means more supplies, and that means more useful balms, potions and remedies for everyone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you know about it?
output: Enough to know that it's not worth it. Ranmir's a good boy, and he doesn't deserve what fate pushed his way, but there's only so far I'll go to risk my neck.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm just trying to help.
output: You'll wind up getting yourself killed. Dagur shouldn't have said a word about it. I love the man, bless his heart, but he doesn't know the whole story.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you know where I could find Isabelle Rolaine?
output: Oh, no. Dagur's been talking at you, hasn't he? Gotten you roped into his little plan to fix Ranmir's life? I'll tell you what I told him -- stay out of it. It's none of your business. Those aren't folks you want to get tangled up with.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you know where I could find Isabelle Rolaine?
output: No there isn't. And I suggest you leave it at that. I don't want to see anyone get hurt over this.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here. Have a drink on me.
output: Got any ale or mead?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll get it.
output: You'd better. Because until you do, you don't get a single coin from us... and you won't be able to use our fences. Anything you steal, you bring it straight to me. Now get out of here and don't come back until your pockets are full.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have I done something wrong?
output: Well, well. If it isn't Brynjolf's little protege. I'm going to make this short and sweet, because frankly I don't think you deserve another shot. You've broken the rules and now you need to pay... and it's going to cost you quite a bit.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's the gold.
output: It's all here. Well, congratulations. You're one of us again. Next time you decide to pull a stunt like that again, just remember how much it hurt to give this away.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm prepared to make reparations.
output: Again? Didn't we teach you enough of a lesson the first time? I suppose it's tough for an old dog to learn new tricks. Anyway, you know the drill. You want to buy back in, and it'll cost you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where do I get all that gold?
output: I'd say it's time you put your nose to the grindstone and figure it out for yourself. You claim to be a thief... act like one. Pick pockets, knock over houses... heck, I don't care if you have to bust into a palace. You do what you have to do to come up with the coin.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Pay? How?
output: This is the Thieves Guild, genius. How do you think? With gold. A lot of gold. Did you think we'd accept a heartfelt apology and let bygones be bygones?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: Speak to Vex. We have nothing else to talk about.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: The Guild will not tolerate the kind of behavior you've been displaying. Too much is at stake. Speak to Vex to make the proper reparations if you want back in. Now get out of my sight. I'm taking you out of the game for now. No jobs will be offered and you won't be able to fence your goods.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: Until you're done with Vex, we don't have anything to discuss.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: You've done it now, whelp. You broke the rules and now you're knee deep in it. You want to get back into our graces, you need to talk to Vex. She'll set you straight. That means your out. No jobs, no payouts... no nothing.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: Sorry. We got nothin' to talk about. Vex will straighten you out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: Are you crazy? What were you thinkin'? You can't just go around doin' things the way you please! Go talk to Vex. She'll tell you the why's and how's if you want to get back in. Now we have to kick you out until things cool down. Can't give you any jobs or payouts for goods.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: Until you get back into the Guild's graces, we have nothing to speak about.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: Straighten yourself out with the Guild and then maybe we can talk.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: Don't want to know what you did and I don't care. Just keep away from me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What have I done wrong?
output: I may be new around here, but at least I know how to follow the rules.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready to pay.
output: And here I expected you to hop the next caravan to Morrowind. What have you got for me?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready to pay.
output: I hope you brought a little something for me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready to pay.
output: First, let's count the coin, then we can get back to business.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you down here?
output: I'm feeling better, but Bashnag's curse won't wear off for weeks.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you down here?
output: I won't be myself for some time. I just need to get out of here and recover.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do I do?
output: Now the crystal needs to be focused. It was created so far away, we knew that some adjustments would have to be made. Heating and cooling the crystal will cause it to expand or contract, which will change how the light passes through it. You'll need to use spells to do that. Being from the College, I assume you know them already. There should be a few basic tomes around here somewhere in case your training is even more sub-standard than I've heard.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do I do?
output: You'll have to get the crystal to focus properly. Heat and cold will affect it; simple concentration spells should be enough. Then you'll see some real magic. You'll also need to align the mirrors using the controls up above. Once everything is lined up, the light will reflect back through the crystal.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do I do?
output: Place the crystal in the center of the armillary. Then we can worry about attuning it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's the gold you wanted.
output: Very good. I'll see that this is put towards getting things back to normal. Consider the suspension lifted.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's the gold you wanted.
output: Oh, excellent. I'll see that it gets where it needs to go. And I'll make sure the suspension is lifted. I'm glad we were able to clear this matter up, and I do hope we don't need to have this talk again.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like to clear up the matter of my suspension.
output: I made it rather clear that a donation of 500 gold will clear it up rather neatly.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like to clear up the matter of my suspension.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why did you open this museum?
output: It's no secret that my family were once members of the Mythic Dawn. One of my forefathers was even chosen to assassinate Uriel Septim himself. We hid from our past for years, became tradesman, people of coin and influence. But I realized that the Mythic Dawn's importance -- our importance -- to history cannot be denied. I'll see everyone in Tamriel remember that for a moment, we held the fate of the world in our hands, for good or ill.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: A courier gave me this invitation.

input: What was that argument about?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds good.
output: Let's talk inside.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like training in Alchemy.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Then I'm in your debt.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why save me?
output: I made a split second decision to get you out of the way and it prevented your death. My original intention was to use that arrow on Mercer, but I never had a clear shot.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: There's that word again, "Nightingale."
output: There were three of us. Myself, Gallus and Mercer. We were a anonymous splinter of the Thieves Guild in Riften. Perhaps I'll tell you more about it later. Right now, you need to head for Winterhold with the journal and get the translation. Here, take these as well, they may prove useful for your journey.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Perhaps it could be translated.
output: Enthir... Gallus's friend at the College of Winterhold. Of course... It's the only outsider Gallus trusted with the knowledge of his Nightingale identity.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: And what of Karliah?
output: The infighting had taken months to subside which gave her time to go into hiding and carefully cover her tracks. I spent thousands of septims and used every contact at my disposal, but it was as if she had simply vanished... like I said before, she was the best.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Well, what's it say?
output: I wish I knew. The journal is written in some sort of language I've never seen before.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: And you were a part of this?
output: I saw what they did to Gallus. I wanted to use the Guild's resources to hunt down Karliah. The others didn't even care he was gone. Fortunately, I persevered and the other groups were either killed or they left Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How will you prove it now?
output: My purpose in using Snow Veil Sanctum to ambush Mercer wasn't simply for irony's sake. Before both of you arrived, I recovered a journal from Gallus's remains. I suspect the information we need is written inside.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What happened after Gallus died?
output: The Guild was thrown into disarray. Several stepped up and tried to claim Gallus's former position as Guild Master. Sides quickly formed behind these men and the Ratway became a bloodbath.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why capture Mercer alive?
output: Mercer must be brought before the Guild to answer for what he's done. He needs to pay for Gallus's murder.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You should have shot Mercer instead.
output: I promise you, the thought crossed my mind. The poison on that arrow took me a year to perfect; I only had enough for a single shot.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why should I believe you?
output: Without the antidote I administered, you'd be as still as a statue. I treated your wounds and didn't leave you defenseless. The poison on that arrow took me a year to perfect; I only had enough for a single shot and yet I used it on you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Vighar is Dead.
output: My family thanks you. Take this as a token of our gratitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: A vampire? I don't think so.
output: I expected too much. I'll seek someone else to salvage the family honor.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I will see that Vighar is destroyed.
output: Good. He will have fled to gather others of his kind.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: And you want me to find the wardstone?
output: No. It's too late for the wardstone. Vighar must be destroyed. If this gets out, my family will suffer great shame.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What exactly do you need from me?
output: You may have seen the open grave in our graveyard. Most of the townsfolk think it's the work of a corpse thief. The truth is less pleasant. It is...was, the grave of Vighar, my own ancestor, dead for centuries now. He is also a vampire. My family is entrusted with keeping him buried, but recently someone stole the wardstone, and Vighar escaped.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What exactly do you need from me?
output: Destroy Vighar, my long dead vampire ancestor. Have you changed your mind?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hello
output: I'm on a pilgrimage to the Shrine of Azura, the Goddess of Twilight. If you'll excuse me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Really? Silus Vesuius says otherwise.
output: I've heard of him. My father had suspicions about his connection to the Mythic Dawn. Guess they were true. I don't need this. My family wasted 8 generations keeping that Razor safe from a dead cult. As far as I care, it can stay locked in my house.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have all the pieces of the Razor.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Never mind, then.

Crossin' Maven is one of the first things you learn not to do when you're down here. As far as the Guild's concerned this is between Sibbi and Maven, so we're going to officially stay out of it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What should I tell the Arch-Mage?
output: Let him know that we've unearthed something... Well, I'm not sure. Something unique, let's say. It's clearly magical in nature, but like nothing I've ever seen before. He should be most interested.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What else can you tell me about the Staff of Magnus?
output: I'm not really sure. Made and used by Magnus himself, if you believe those sorts of things. I believe I've heard it said that it's the only thing that could adequately contain his power. The sort of embellishment wizards of ancient times loved to make.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You don't care that they're dead?
output: I warned them it might be dangerous. It's not my fault they didn't listen. As long as the Synod don't blame us for this mess, I have more pressing matters to deal with.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Doesn't anyone care that Orthorn stole things from the College?
output: Not enough to bother with it. Arch-Mage Aren's approach to these things is to just let them sort themselves out. Although now it looks like you'll be doing the sorting. Good luck with that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Will you be all right by yourself?
output: Oh, I think I'll be fine. We seem to have eliminated the most pressing threat. It certainly seems that whoever placed this here intended for it to be well guarded. I wonder why...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yet very fortunate for Maven.
output: Exactly! Now you're beginning to see how our little system works. Maven sent word that you discovered something else while you were out there. Something important to the Guild?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm sorry, Maven.
output: The only thing keeping me from having you killed is Brynjolf. He's stepped in and made amends. At least you remembered to bring me the information I requested. Give me that. This doesn't tell me much. The only thing that could identify Sabjorn's partner is this odd little symbol.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: We?
output: Yes, I'm going with you and together we're going to kill her. Here's your payment for Solitude. Prepare yourself and meet me at the ruins as soon as you can. We can't let her slip through our fingers.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Job's finished. Here's the information you requested.
output: This doesn't tell me much. The only thing that could identify Sabjorn's partner is this odd little symbol.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How can we make them pay?
output: The parchment you recovered mentions a "Gajul-Lei." According to my sources, that's an old alias used by one of our contacts. His real name is Gulum-Ei. Slimy bastard. Because, even after all their posturing and planning, they've made a mistake.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What happened here?
output: The Silver Hand. They finally had the nerve to attack Jorrvaskr. We got most of them, but I think a few stragglers made it out. The Silver Hand. They finally had the nerve to attack Jorrvaskr. We got most of them, but I think a few stragglers made it out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What happened here?
output: Don't leave any of them alive. Don't leave any of them alive.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why do you fight for the Empire?
output: I am a loyal citizen of the Empire. My parents were Legionnaires, and I've followed in their footsteps. But more importantly, I am a daughter of Skyrim and wish to see her made whole again.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you consider the Thalmor enemies?
output: I consider this conversation over.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Don't Stormcloaks call themselves "sons and daughters of Skyrim"?
output: I've been a daughter of Skyrim all my life. I love this land and her people. So do all the Nords that serve the Empire. Ulfric, too, once. He wasn't always a self-serving ego-maniac. He fought in the Imperial army in the War against the Dominion. But Ulfric and his "Stormcloaks" are deluding themselves. If there's any hope of a long term victory against the Dominion, it's in the Empire. The rebels are only inflaming the tension and weakening the Empire by distracting it from its ultimate aim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you have no problem with the treaty that bans the worship of Talos?
output: I'm a soldier, not a politician. And my personal beliefs are not yours to question.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you oppose anyone who's not a Nord?
output: I oppose tyranny. I oppose those who tell me how to live, what to think, and what to believe. I'm a man. Skyrim is man's homeland. That's a fact. A fact I'm proud of. There's no shame in that. Read your history.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Never mind.
output: If that's all, there's pressing concerns that need dealing with.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hasn't Skyrim always been part of the Empire?
output: Not this Empire. The world's better without it. Certainly Skyrim is. I fought in the Imperial army in the War against the Dominion. I bled and spilt blood for the Empire. And for what? The Empire to bend its knee before those evil elf bastards? Signing a treaty meant to kill the heart of the Empire itself. To deny Talos?  No. I will have no part of any such Empire. And I will gladly gut anyone who says otherwise.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Never mind.
output: Enough talk. There's much to do.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are your reasons for joining the war?
output: Reasons? Since when does a man need a reason to protect his family, to defend his homeland? It's the damn outlanders and Empire that need the reasons.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll be relieving you of those gifts...
output: What? No! Guard, help!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Enjoy the wedding.
output: Indeed. If we ever get there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can I make a request?
output: For a generous fellow traveler? But of course. What would you like to hear?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can I make a request?
output: Sorry friend, but it looks like you're a bit light in the purse, and the wayward minstrel can't afford to do free performances.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What was that all about?
output: They thought I was some other Redguard woman! They just wouldn't leave me alone. I hope they get lost in the wilderness.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you know Dragonrend or not?
output: Krosis. Sorrowfully, no. It cannot be known to me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How did you know I came for Dragonrend?
output: Alduin komeyt tiid. What else would you seek? Alduin and Dovahkiin return together. But, I do not know the Thu'um you seek. Krosis. It cannot be known to me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The Greybeards didn't want me to come at all.
output: Hmm. Yes. They are very protective of me. Bahlaan fahdonne. But I do not know the Thu'um you seek. Krosis. It cannot be known to me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why do you hate the Blades?
output: Not hate. Distrust and fear. The Blades have always sought to turn the Dragonborn away from the path of wisdom.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't wish to remove this blessing.
output: This is not about your desires, lass.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This sounds like a terrible idea...
output: You don't want to be part of history? Fine. I'll be at the shrine if you change your mind.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You think Dagon will repair the Razor?
output: Ever since I was a boy, I felt this strange sense of destiny surrounding the Mythic Dawn cult, and now I know what it is. Don't you see? Fate has led you to me and to the pieces. Dagon has to answer our call. We're so close. I'll meet you at the shrine.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Fine. Get out of here.
output: Thank you. Here's your gold. I'll make a run for it back to Dawnstar.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Dagon has spoken.
output: Fine. I'm not dying without a fight!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can you teach me about Speechcraft?
output: Ah. Well. After a little incident with a roguish lad and the daughter of a prominent Thane... Well, let's just say, best not.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can you teach me about Speechcraft?
output: Afraid not. But if you're serious about sharpening that tongue, you might try the Bard's College in Solitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What exactly is a Falmer?
output: In the time before man, they were known as the snow elves. They lived in the sunlight and had a very prosperous society.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Then I'll make it a point to hunt them down.
output: Good. I lost more than a few acquaintances to the Falmer and I wish to see them avenged.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You appear to despise them.
output: Why shouldn't I? The Falmer have killed more than a fair share of my acquaintances. They're animals... they show absolutely no pity or remorse.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Even after everything I did for you and Faleen?
output: I've already provided you a key to the museum. You should consider it an honor. Few are allowed to browse my collection. I'm sorry, but that's as far as my generosity extends.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: They sound more like victims to me.
output: Yes, I suppose you're right. Forgive me. I've lost several close friends to the Falmer and it tends to distort my view.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What drove them underground?
output: The Nords went to war with the Falmer in the First Era. Killed them by the thousands to drive them from their snowy homeland. The Falmer retreated underground and forged an uneasy alliance with the dwarves who ended up betraying them. This betrayal made them what they are now... horrible blind monstrosities with a burning hatred of any but their own kind.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So they were like your kind?
output: Like the Altmer? Yes, I would say their culture quite possibly rivaled our own.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where did you find this, boy?
output: I found them near the old Dwemer bridge in the far west. I'll mark it down for you on your map for a small fee.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Fine, you little swindler. Here's a septim. Now where's this bridge?
output: Thank you! You'll find the ruins right here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about Riverwood?
output: Gerdur's family first settled here as wood cutters a few generations ago. She and Hod run the mill. I make a decent living sharpening axes and fixing the sawmill.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you sell spells?
output: I think I have a few old spell books laying about. If you want more, you'll have to go to the College of Winterhold.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do around here?
output: At the Bards College in Solitude. They train bards and skalds like myself. If you go there, talk to Viarmo. He's the headmaster.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you know any old ballads about dragons?
output: There's the one about Tiber Septim and the dragon Nafaalilargus. I never bothered to learn it. The Blades killed them all centuries ago. Nobody asks to hear that lay anymore.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How can I convince you to let me in?
output: Hmm... we've heard whispers of an enchanted pair of gauntlets, hidden and protected by dangerous men, beasts, or worse. Hmm... we've heard whispers of an enchanted pair of gauntlets, hidden and protected by dangerous men, beasts, or worse. They are called the Forgemaster's Fingers. Bring them to our chief, and he will decide if you're worthy to be Blood-Kin to the Orcs. They are called the Forgemaster's Fingers. Bring them to our chief, and he will decide if you're worthy to be Blood-Kin to the Orcs.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who is Malacath?
output: You do not remember the Daedric Lord of the Orcs? The keeper of the Sworn Oath and the Bloody Curse? You do not remember the Daedric Lord of the Orcs? The keeper of the Sworn Oath and the Bloody Curse? We live by his code and follow his teachings. Spend some time with the wise woman and you'll remember. We live by his code and follow his teachings. Spend some time with the wise woman and you'll remember.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are there other strongholds out there?
output: There are a few great strongholds worthy to talk about. Dushnikh Yal, Mor Khazgur, Narzulbur, and Largashbur. There are a few great strongholds worthy to talk about. Dushnikh Yal, Mor Khazgur, Narzulbur, and Largashbur.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm just a traveler. What is this place?
output: This is our stronghold. Here, we are free to live as Malacath intended, away from the prying eyes of the Nords. This is our stronghold. Here, we are free to live as Malacath intended, away from the prying eyes of the Nords. You must have been away from your kind for a long time to forget. Come, speak to the chief and the wise woman and remember. You must have been away from your kind for a long time to forget. Come, speak to the chief and the wise woman and remember.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I go where I please, Orc.
output: Ha. We admire your fighting spirit, Orc-Kin. You'll fit right in here. Come inside. Ha. We admire your fighting spirit, Orc-Kin. You'll fit right in here. Come inside.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who is Malacath?
output: He is the Daedric Lord of the Orcs. The keeper of the Sworn Oath and the Bloody Curse. He is the Daedric Lord of the Orcs. The keeper of the Sworn Oath and the Bloody Curse. We live by his code and follow his teachings. An outlander like you wouldn't understand. We live by his code and follow his teachings. An outlander like you wouldn't understand.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I go where I please, Orc.
output: We won't kill you, outlander, but we don't want you here. Remember that. We won't kill you, outlander, but we don't want you here. Remember that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm just a traveler. What is this place?
output: This is our stronghold. Here, we are free to live as Malacath intended, away from the prying eyes of the Nords. This is our stronghold. Here, we are free to live as Malacath intended, away from the prying eyes of the Nords. You're not an Orc, or Blood-Kin, so stay out. We only help our own. You're not an Orc, or Blood-Kin, so stay out. We only help our own.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Forget it. Maybe I'll come back later.
output: Very well. Perhaps when my research is complete, I'll feel more comfortable discussing my findings with you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: But I'm a great admirer of your work. (Persuade)
output: What kind of a mentor would I be if I denied a potential student a glimpse at his master's ingenuity! Here, this key will provide access to my museum. Feel free to browse for as long as you wish. However, I must insist that my laboratory remains strictly off limits.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You ok?
output: Thanks for the help. The Reach has been crawling with Forsworn lately.  It's a wonder people can get anywhere around here. Maybe I'll avoid this entire hold for awhile. That said... I do have a few things to sell.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't remember any of that. Be reasonable. (Persuade)
output: Well... all right. Just because we are friends. Give me, say... 750 gold and we can call it even.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't remember any of that. Be reasonable. (Persuade)
output: Nice try, but those bandits almost killed me. Now pay up.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't have 10,000 gold.
output: So you're telling me you and Sam just sent me in there to die, then? I want my money, you bastard.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's your gold. (10,000 gold)
output: Thanks. You and Sam drink too hard for me. Think I'll take my gold and go buy a nice bit of swamp in Black Marsh.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's your gold. (10,000 gold)
output: Thanks. You and Sam drink too hard for me. Think I'll take my gold and go buy something for this headache.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you?
output: We caroused together with Sam Guevenne, remember? We broke into the Temple of Dibella? How much did you end up drinking?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is this the correct book?
output: Thank Her Benevolence it wasn't burned like the other tomes.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Actually, I've already found it.
output: Well done. I wasn't certain you'd even know what to look for.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Show me where it is, before I take you over my knee.
output: Fine, I'll show you, you big bully.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you saying the ancient Nords sent Alduin forward in time?
output: Not intentionally. Some hoped he would be gone forever, forever lost. Meyye. Which is why I have lived here. For thousands of mortal years I have waited. I knew where he would emerge but not when. I knew better. Tiid bo amativ. Time flows ever onward. One day he would surface.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: An Elder Scroll? What's that?
output: Hmm. How to explain in your tongue? The dov have words for such things that joorre do not. It is an... artifact from outside time. It does not exist, but it has always existed. Rah wahlaan. They are...hmm... fragments of creation.  The Kelle... Elder Scrolls, as you name them, they have often been used for prophecy. Yes, your prophecy comes from an Elder Scroll. But this is only a small part of their power. Zofaas suleyk.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who are you?
output: Just a pilgrim. I'd prefer to leave it at that, if you don't mind.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing?
output: Walking the Steps. Meditating on the emblems. I make this trip every few years.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing?
output: I'm walking the 7,000 Steps to honor the Greybeards and reflect on my own life. It's a tradition among the Nords of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing?
output: I like to spend time up here. Walk the Steps, meditate on the emblems. Doesn't hurt when I bag some game along the way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing?
output: Enjoying the hospitalities of the inn. Suggest you do the same.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you visit the Greybeards?
output: They're not the sort to take visitors, but I never go that high up the path anyway. Some folk who make the trip leave them food or other essentials, but not to make conversation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Did you hear the Greybeards call "Dovahkiin"?
output: I was just outside Ivarstead when it happened. It's an exciting moment. Nothing like this has happened in centuries.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Did you hear the Greybeards call "Dovahkiin"?
output: I did. Strange days when the monks will do that. I wonder what it means.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready for some adventure.
output: All right. I wrote down the last place I'd heard about. Don't get killed.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is there any College business I can assist with?
output: There are more books to be recovered and secured in the Arcanaeum.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm not really interested in dangerous.
output: Some other time, then.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You don't look happy to be here.
output: Is it that obvious? I should take pains to seem more happy. I wouldn't want to upset our host. But the truth of it is, I have a mountain of paperwork back in Windhelm and it's not getting any smaller. I just hope this party doesn't drag on all night.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How are you enjoying the party?
output: Well enough, I suppose. Elenwen puts a great deal of effort into these parties, and it shows. I just wonder what her real motivations are. That woman is inscrutable.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you here with one of the Jarls?
output: I beg your pardon? You must have me mistaken for someone else. I am Elisif, widow of High King Torygg and Jarl of Solitude. Lucky for you, I possess a forgiving nature and I'm not easily insulted.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What brings you to this party?
output: Ill luck. I'm a busy man and I don't have time for this sort of frivolity. But at the same time, I don't dare refuse an invitation from Elenwen.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's your relationship with the Thalmor?
output: We have a relationship of mutual respect. I care little about the politics and rivalries between the Thalmor and the Empire. But I do respect power, and the Thalmor have that. They leave me alone, and I leave them alone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Enjoying the party?
output: Very much so, yes. Elewen's parties are always so elegant. She really has impeccable taste. My only regret is that she doesn't host them more often.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you know of our host?
output: Elenwen is a formidable woman. She lacks for neither cunning nor ambition. Now that I think of it, she would have made a fine Imperial general.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does your company do business with the Thalmor?
output: A delicate question, to be sure. I'm the Emperor's cousin, and the Empire has little love for the Thalmor. On the other hand, the Thalmor have considerable funds and are looking to expand their shipping. I haven't signed any deals yet, but I'm sure my cousin will want a cut if I do. What better way to soothe his wounded pride?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: This must be awkward for you.
output: That's putting it mildly. The Thalmor invite me here to remind everyone that they can tell the Empire what to do. I would refuse, but I don't want to jeopardize the peace between us.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you enjoying the party?
output: I am not. I have no more taste for Thalmor wine than I do for Thalmor company. What is more, I'm away from the hold at a time when there are dragons and Stormcloaks on the loose. There's every chance I'll return to find a pile of smoking ash where Whiterun once stood.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you trust the Thalmor?
output: I trust them completely, because I understand them. When the Thalmor want something, they tell you straight. In my experience, they have no interest in subtleties and innuendo.  So if one of them says they're going to do something, I believe them. When you can just take what you want, there's no need to lie.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Some Jarls resent the Thalmor. How about you?
output: Yes, I know what you mean. Most Nords struggle to accept change. Those who fought the Thalmor in the Great War still see an enemy. But that war is over, and a new day has dawned. Besides, the Thalmor reward their friends richly. Anyone who doesn't take advantage of that is a stubborn fool.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How well do you know Elenwen?
output: Not well at all, and I'm happy to keep it that way. That woman and her Thalmor Justiciars have caused nothing but problems for the people of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can there truly be peace between the Thalmor and the Empire?
output: There is peace now, and that peace will continue for as long as it suits our needs. But make no mistake, this is not a peace forged out of necessity between rival nations of equal strength. It is more like the calm between storms. And the next storm, I think, will be far deadlier than the last.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How did you make your fortune?
output: I've spent most of my life as a trader. I've got a stake in several shipping ventures across Tamriel, mostly imports and exports. I made a lot of friends in a lot of ports, and the Thalmor approached me with a generous offer. I give them access to my business associates, and they keep my coffers full.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you visit the embassy often?
output: There are words spoken, and words unspoken. Beware these Thalmor, for they are adept in both languages. For this reason, I avoid them when I can.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you known Elenwen long?
output: I've known her long enough to appreciate her excellent taste in food and wine. And also long enough to respect her importance to Skyrim. She plays a vital role in rooting out the forbidden worship of Talos. As far as I'm concerned, those Talos-worshippers get what they deserve. All they do is cause problems for me and the other Jarls.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Your crops seem to be thriving
output: It's true. For as long as I can remember our crops have always done well. It's true. For as long as I can remember our crops have always done well. I'm not sure whether it's the soil, the climate or the favor of the Divines, but we've never had a poor harvest. I'm not sure whether it's the soil, the climate or the favor of the Divines, but we've never had a poor harvest.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you host these parties often?
output: Quite often, yes. The only thing I enjoy more than luxury is sharing that luxury with those who can appreciate it. But I also enjoy learning the latest gossip and hear the most intriguing rumors.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Enjoying the party, Proventus?
output: Oh, hello there. I didn't expect to see you here. Yes, I am indeed. Elenwen always serves the best wine at her parties. The food is excellent as well. Though I confess, being surrounded by so many wealthy and important people makes me feel more than a little nervous.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are your duties here in Skyrim?
output: I lead the Justiciars. We are charged with enforcing the ban on Talos worship. Nords can be quite stubborn. They're slow to change their ways, and we find more heretics every day. But mark me well -- I will purge the heresy from this land as surely as the flame burns the flesh from the bone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I can see you spared no expense.
output: Of course not. One does not gather the most important men and women of Skyrim and then serve them cheap ale and stale bread. This is only a taste of the benefits that accrue to those that align themselves with Thalmor interests.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Having a good time?
output: Fair faces and fine food are well and good, but honesty is rarely so pleasing.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do for a living?
output: I'm the Steward of Whiterun. I serve Jarl Balgruuf in Dragonsreach. Truth be told, I'd be more comfortable if I were back there. I get nervous in the company of so many worthies.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I didn't know you had dealings with the Thalmor.
output: Have you learned nothing about me? I have dealings with everyone. Now, leave me. I don't want to arouse suspicion by talking to someone that clearly doesn't belong here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you lived here all your life?
output: Born and raised right here in Rorikstead. Born and raised right here in Rorikstead. My father was a soldier. He fought in the great war and when it was over, he retired here to raise a family.  My father was a soldier. He fought in the great war and when it was over, he retired here to raise a family.  My mother passed away when I was just a babe, so he did his best to raise me on his own. My mother passed away when I was just a babe, so he did his best to raise me on his own. It's not the most exciting place in the world, but the people here work hard and don't cause trouble for anyone. It's not the most exciting place in the world, but the people here work hard and don't cause trouble for anyone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You sound like quite the businessman.
output: Not every Nord is obsessed with strength, honor and skill at arms. A rare few are born with a gift for making money. My investments are my strength and my wealth is my weapon. As for honor, well, there are some luxuries even I can't afford.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Quite a gathering, wouldn't you say?
output: Oh, yes! Quite! So many important people from all across Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you here on guild business?
output: Don't mention the Guild. In fact, it's better if you don't speak to me at all. This is not the place.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can the Thalmor be trusted?
output: For now, perhaps. But I've heard disturbing rumors that they're marshalling their strength. I suspect the treaty that ended the war was just a tactic to buy time so the Thalmor can rebuild their armies. I hope I'm wrong. I'm not sure the Empire can afford another war.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Jarl Elisif, it's a pleasure to see you again.
output: Why, thank you. You are most courteous. I admit, I'm surprised to see you here. Normally these parties are reserved for  the Jarls and business leaders of Skyrim. Elenwen must be very fond of you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: WERJ05PowerAttackBark
output: This is for Haldyn!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can I use your forge?
output: I see no harm in it, if you have the skill. The grindstone will improve your weapons. Use the table to improve your armor. If you've got the raw materials, you can use the forge to make something new.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Consider yourself hired. (<global=hirelinggold>)
output: That's a fair price. My blade is yours.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Consider yourself hired. (<global=hirelinggold>)
output: Looks like you've got some help already. I'll join you, but you'll have to let your comrade go. What do you say? Looks like you've got some help already. I'll join you, but you'll have to let your comrade go. What do you say? Looks like you've got some help already. I'll join you, but you'll have to let your comrade go. What do you say? I'll join you, but you'll have to let your comrade go. What do you say? Looks like you've got some help already. I'll join you, but you'll have to let your comrade go. What do you say?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I saw a dragon in Helgen.
output: Truly? So maybe my mother isn't crazy after all. You had best tell the Jarl in Whiterun. He needs to know about this.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is there somewhere I can buy fresh supplies?
output: Lucan's got a little bit of everything at the Riverwood Trader. If you need weapons or armor, see Alvor, the blacksmith.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I need a moment. I'll be back later.
output: I understand. Speaking to a goddess is overwhelming for many. Return when you're prepared.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you asking?
output: I'm with the Vigil of Stendarr. We believe this house might have been used for Daedra worship. Evil rites and so forth.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You'll stay that way for now.
output: Coward. You're nothing. Nothing!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why not?
output: I can't talk about it. Rest assured, the Jarl hears everyone's concerns. You will be able to visit the dead again soon.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Your cannibal has been taken care of.
output: I don't need to know the details. Blessings of Arkay to you for your help. Here. Take my amulet as a reward.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is this place? Who's Azura?
output: This shrine was built by the Dunmer. As our land was scorched by fire and brimstone, Azura's prophecies led us to safety. She is a Daedra, a powerful being who watches from beyond our mortal plane. She has chosen you to be her champion.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Stop right there. I'm not interested.
output: Fine. I can't force you to help me, but the offer is open.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Turns out the ancient Nords used it to send Alduin forward through time.
output: Fascinating! So the ancients were more daring... or foolhardy... similar to the Dragon Break itself, although less far-reaching... This Elder Scroll might be able to show you the past in some way, then... yes, yes, it could work.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hakon, Gormlaith, Felldir? Who are they?
output: The first mortals that I taught the Thu'um - the first Tongues. The leaders of the rebellion against Alduin. They were mighty, in their day. Even to attempt to defeat Alduin...  sahrot hunne. The Nords have had many heroes since, but none greater.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do I do with the Elder Scroll when I find it?
output: Return it here, to the Tiid-Ahraan. Then... Kelle vomindok. Nothing is certain with such things... But I believe the Scroll's bond with the Tiid-Ahraan will allow you a... a seeing, a vision of the moment of its creation. You will see them... wuth fadonne... my friends - Hakon, Gormlaith, Felldir. Then you will feel - know - Dragonrend, in the power of its first expression.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I can use it to learn Dragonrend from the ancient Nords who defeated Alduin.
output: Hmm. Well, if that's what the Greybeards told you, I confess I don't have a better plan. So little is known about the Elder Scrolls, almost anything is possible where they're concerned. Artifacts of truly inconceivable power.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't really know. Paarthurnax told me it would work.
output: Paarthurnax? That name is familiar... the legendary leader of the Greybeards?  I would not have expected a scholar of such an esoteric turn of mind among their ranks.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is it?
output: I've been working on a shield for Aela. My wife is in mourning and I need to get back to her soon. I'd be much obliged if you could take this to Aela for me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't want the Lexicon.
output: I won't be the one to go back there. I won't return to Avanchnzel. You can't make me do it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds like your brother was a traitor.
output: Then you didn't know Roggvir, and you have no idea what it means to be a Nord of Skyrim! He did the honorable thing, even when he knew it would cost him everything. My brother was the best man in Solitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do they keep you busy?
output: Depends on what you mean by "busy." I'm also the head jailor in the dungeon here. Quiet job, usually.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who was your brother?
output: Roggvir. He opened a gate and they executed him for it. He opened a gate and the wrong man rode out of it. If that man hadn't been Ulfric Stormcloak. If Ulfric hadn't killed High King Torygg... But it was Ulfric. And he did kill the High King, in honorable combat. My brother refused to allow the the Imperials to take revenge for the deed. So now he's dead.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is the man who was executed buried here?
output: You mean Roggvir. Yes. I made an appeal to Captain Aldis. He allowed Roggvir to have a proper Nord burial, as is the custom in Solitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you work in the Winking Skeever?
output: Work in it? I own it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you work in the Winking Skeever?
output: You could say that. I own the place.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It's okay. I'll take the Lexicon.
output: You must bring it to Avanchnzel, in the west. Return it to them. It must go back.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: No, I think he was an honorable man.
output: Then like Roggvir, you're a Nord at heart. It's hard for many of the people here to understand. I think Aldis understands. I don't think I could have stayed here if anyone else had... I... I think I need to stop talking now...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What darkness pervades Solitude?
output: This city has a long history of madness and murder. The Wolf Queen... Pelagius... The death of High King Torygg... And now, public executions. My books tell the stories. Have no doubt - as pretty as its streets are, as jovial as the bards may be... darkness is drawn to Solitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That seems rather harsh.
output: Listen, Roggvir and I grew up together. It was us, a few others and Vivienne. Vivienne Onis. I have no idea why, but one day, I told Roggvir I liked her. It was a stupid thing to do... He mocked me incessantly after that. From that point forward, every time Vivienne and I were anywhere close to each other, he made sure to humiliate me. He'd beat me up, dump mead on my head, anything he could get away with. Once he even slipped a beehive into my bed.  We were children, sure. But Roggvir never outgrew that immaturity, or his cruelty. So any talk about him being an "honorable" Nord? Pure folly.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How could you execute a fine and honorable man?
output: Sometimes you just do what needs to be done. You don't have to hate a man to kill him. Though, admittedly... it helps.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That doesn't seem like a good attitude.
output: If you're looking for a good attitude go see the Bards. They'll fake it for you if nothing else.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes, yes, and yes. Oh my goodness, yes.
output: Oh, wow. I knew it. I knew they were real! I have to remember to tell papa.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you think what he did was right?
output: No. I think he was entirely wrong. Roggvir's execution was justified and necessary. Being honorable might make you a good man, but it doesn't make you right. Be a better world if it did.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you mean?
output: Let's just say the headsman's axe may not be the worst way for a Solitude Jail prisoner to die.  Look at that. I've told you to watch your tongue and mine is waggling. I've said enough.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You were at the execution, right?
output: I showed up to watch, yeah. I don't know if they were right to execute him for what he did, but I'll tell you something... It couldn't have happened to a nicer guy.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was in Helgen when the dragon attacked.
output: Really? Was it big? Did it breath fire?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You were the one presiding over the execution.
output: Not my finest hour. Roggvir was a fine and honorable man.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you the court wizard?
output: No. That honor is Sybille Stentor's. A smart man steers clear of Stentor. And keeps himself out of the dungeon when she's having a bad day...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Okay, if you don't want to hear about the dragon...
output: Dragon?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why were they executing him?
output: You really don't know? He let Ulfric Stormcloak escape Solitude. Ulfric rides in, murders the High King and Roggvir lets him ride right back out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The rumors are all true.
output: Then we should soon be selling arrows by the bushel. A sword is no good against a dragon.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've been traveling all over. Even been to Helgen...
output: Where the Dragon attacked?  We've heard rumors of death and... and fire from the skies. But no real news.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Even if that battle is with a dragon?
output: Can any man hope to be ready for a dragon? I can but hone their skills and harden their hearts. The rest is up to the gods.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Even if that battle is with a dragon?
output: You're the Dragonborn aren't you? I'm sort of hoping you're going to fight the dragons for us. A normal man is no match for a dragon.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So he did what he thought was right.
output: Then like Roggvir, you have a Nord's heart. It's hard for many of the people here to understand. I think Aldis understands. I don't think I could have stayed here if anyone else had... I... I think I need to be done talking for the moment.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: When's your next execution?
output: Ain't got one. But I'd fancy a chance at that Jaree-Ra's scrawny neck. Filthy Argonian never would have set foot in this city, if High King Torygg was still alive. I can tell you that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you... all right?
output: Oh, I am well. I will be well. Well to be within the will inside the walls.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've got a Cure Disease potion.
output: Oh, thank the gods. Here, take this with my thanks. Oh, thank the gods. Here, take this with my thanks. Oh, thank the gods. Here, take this with my thanks. Oh, thank the gods. Here, take this with my thanks. Oh, thank the gods. Here, take this with my thanks.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Slow down... Where did this happen?
output: Here I'll show you on your map so you can stay away. Please, if you can help me let me know or get out of my way so I can try to find a priest. Here I'll show you on your map so you can stay away. Please, if you can help me let me know or get out of my way so I can try to find a priest. Here I'll show you on your map so you can stay away. instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm sorry, I can't help you.
output: Then get out of my way. I have to get to a town and find a priest. Then get out of my way. I have to get to a town and find a priest. Then get out of my way. I have to get to a town and find a priest. Then get out of my way. I have to get to a town and find a priest. Then get out of my way. I have to get to a town and find a priest.

output: The Jarl has put out a bounty on Forsworn. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on Forsworn. Here, take a look at this decree for details. instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The power to crush all before me!
output: Really? Power? Haven't you already killed enough of your foes using the more mundane means at your disposal? Swords, magic, etc.? How... uninspired.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So you handle the defense of Riften?
output: Defense? No one would dare attack Riften. I'm not sure you realize just how well connected Jarl Maven is with the Empire.  With a single snap of her fingers, we could have a legion here in a fortnight.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do around here?
output: As steward, I serve as an intermediary between the Jarl and her subjects. I also handle the less important and day-to-day policies that effect daily life in Riften. Lately I've had my hands full suppressing these ridiculous accusations of corruption in the keep.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do around here?
output: I'm not certain what business it is of yours, but I'm moth... I mean Jarl Maven's steward. I run the prisons in Riften, keep the riff-raff from robbing the good folk of this city and have drunks tossed into the lake.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I take it you protect the Jarl?
output: As long as she continues to keep me at her side, she can count on my blade to protect her. To be honest, I doubt someone would be stupid enough to make an attempt on Maven... sorry, Jarl Maven's life. But just in case, I'll be ready for them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me your thoughts on the war.
output: Ulfric's a bloody hero. I don't think there's a worthy Nord alive who'd dare argue the point. He's taking the Empire to task and making them answer for their crimes. I don't think I'll be content until Ulfric sits upon the throne of Skyrim with the ashes of the Concordat at his feet.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me your thoughts on the war.
output: Hey, if the Empire and the Stormcloaks want to kill each other over some foolish cause, I say let 'em. All I care about is two things: watchin' Maven's back and countin' the gold she pays me to do it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I think you're exaggerating.
output: I don't care what you think. The Empire put Maven on the throne for a reason. That's all you need to know.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Interesting.
output: If you say so.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That's impressive.
output: Indeed. You don't get to the position my mother's achieved by blind luck... her business sense and diplomatic skills are legendary.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like training in Alchemy.
output: It's as rewarding as it is dangerous. Let's see what I can show you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Consider yourself hired. (<global=hirelinggold>)
output: With a master of magic at your side, you'll have nothing to fear.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Consider yourself hired. (<global=hirelinggold>)
output: My blade is sharp and I thirst for battle. Onward, then!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd sooner forget all of this.
output: Time to finally see the sky, and make it rain red.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You and your thugs had me arrested in the first place.
output: And you've proven that was the best move I could have made. Don't give me that look. You're free to go. Here, how about a little token for your efforts? My family's ring and all the things the guards confiscated from you when you were jailed. Now if you'll excuse me, I have to figure out how we're going to fill our recently emptied mine.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hello
output: We are traveling to the Shrine of Kynareth in Whiterun. I hear the Gildergreen is more beautiful than ever since it's been restored.  They say that eating the fruit it bears will add years to your life.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have more questions.
output: And I have no more time for talking. Go speak with Kesh if you are so curious.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where are you going?
output: Returning to High Rock. Our shepherd lost his way, and I fear Peryite's wrath may consume those who remain with him. Kesh could tell you more. I just want out of Skyrim as quickly as possible.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Your skin... Are you ill?
output: I am one of the Afflicted. I'd have been dead from this plague a year ago if not for Peryite's protection.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have firewood to sell.
output: Honest gold for honest work. Honest gold for honest work. Honest gold for honest work. Honest gold for honest work. Honest gold for honest work. Honest gold for honest work. Honest gold for honest work. Honest gold for honest work. Honest gold for honest work. Honest gold for honest work.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where's Mirabelle?
output: She... She didn't make it. When it was clear we were going to have to fall back, she stayed behind and made sure the rest of us were all right.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll need an Elder Scroll to get any further.
output: Ah, indeed. Well there's a pretty puzzle. Not the kind of thing you'll find in your local bookshop. I'm sure you'll manage, though.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you all the way out here?
output: Look for yourself. Ancano's power is growing. We can't crack whatever magic he's using to shield himself. I hope your trip to Labyrinthian was worth it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry to hear that.
output: Not your concern, anyway.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does this job pay?
output: Food, experience and a roof over my head in the finest city in Skyrim. If money's all you hold dear, then you you end up like Jaree-Ra. A plague on the city.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How long have you been the court wizard?
output: I was a member of the court during the reign of Torygg's father. It was Torygg who appointed me to the position.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you make anything here that will kill dragons?
output: Ha! I like you. No man is a match for a dragon. Buying one of our blades wouldn't hurt your chances, though.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I need some arrows that can take down a dragon...
output: Why of course. And will you also be needing the bow that shoots rainbows? Or perhaps a quiver that dispenses beer? Look, if you want arrows we have them, but don't insult my intelligence.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's your problem with Jaree-Ra?
output: Captain Aldis can't prove it, but that Argonian is up to no good.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's your problem with Jaree-Ra?
output: Really? I knew he was mixed up in something dangerous, but I hadn't heard he was dead.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing out here?
output: I'm looking for a place called Bard's Leap. They say the echo of a song sung from there can be heard all the way in Solitude.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing out here?
output: Some may find their inspiration tucked away in tomes, or by carousing in the cities, but I find it here in the vast expanses of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing out here?
output: The best tales are those of adventure. Who could truly write such a tale without first experiencing such?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing out here?
output: Why to perform for my common man, of course! Why should only the courts and inns of wealthy towns be given the gift of music?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What are you doing out here?
output: Observing and capturing the epic struggle for Skyrim! When brothers clash with bitter blades, surely there is a song to be found.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is Haming your son?
output: Grandson. He's a strong lad. His parents were at Helgen when, well you know.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is Haming your son?
output: Can't say I was a great father the first time around. Now that he's here it's like a second chance. He's a good lad.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Oh, I see.
output: It's okay, I know what happened at home. With the dragon and all.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I found this bow. Is it yours?
output: I don't believe it. I made that bow myself. Been through some messes with it, let me tell you. You know what? I want you to keep it. My great hunts are behind me, but yours are yet to come.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Were your parents killed at Helgen?
output: Yeah, but don't say anything about it to Froki. I don't think he understands.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you like living here?
output: It ain't so bad. I miss living with my parents back in Helgen, though. Froki can't cook and there's nobody to talk to up here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about yourself.
output: Froki won't let me hunt on my own yet, but he never shuts up about killing his first stag when he was eleven.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why would they teach me to Shout if they don't want me to use it?
