output: While I feel Ulfric's cause is just, my concern is for the people of The Rift. How can they continue to lead their already meager lives with dark clouds looming overhead? My heart goes out to them. If only our coffers were deeper, I could protect them as they were my own family.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're not from Riften?
output: I've been adventuring across Tamriel since I was a fresh-faced young woman barely able to swing a blade. My travels have taken me from High Rock to Valenwood, Elsweyr to Morrowind and all points in between.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why is your shop down here in the canal?
output: Besides, I also prefer the quiet. I didn't open this business for browsing. Come in, buy what you need and get out. The moisture in the air is better for the ingredients. It isn't every day that you get your hands on fresh nirnroot or painted troll fat. It also makes it easier to gather water when the canal is right out the front door.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why all the hatred for the Empire?
output: Talos is part of our culture. He's part of our heritage and our tradition. He's Skyrim personified. To suddenly have all that wrenched away is like losing someone you hold dearly in your heart. The Empire already took my daughter from us, but by Talos they will not take our homeland!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I imagine current events are keeping you busy.
output: People say I'm making gold off of other people's misery, but what else would I do? Smithing is all I know. Next time one of my shields deflects a killing blow, they'll change their tune.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about Maven Black-Briar.
output: Lady Maven could buy or sell anyone in Skyrim. I wouldn't be surprised if she's the one pulling the strings around this city. I'd also warn you not to cross her. She employs quite a few... troubleshooters  to take care of messy problems. She's always welcome in Mistveil Keep and between you and me, I'm pretty sure she even has some pretty influential friends within the Empire.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How did you come to be known as Horse-Crusher?
output: Been stuck with the name for years. I've been ridin' horses since I was a lad... nothin' I liked more. But as I got bigger, so did my mounts. Then one day, I was drunker than I've ever been and mounted a poor colt. Broke his back in two. Haven't ridden since.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Thieves Guild.
output: I'd hardly call them a Guild. More like unorganized rabble. In fact, I wouldn't say they were a threat at all. No, our resources should be spent on preparations for invasion.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Thieves Guild.
output: We're all eager to see them brought to justice. Maven Black-Briar has assured me that they're being dealt with appropriately.  As one of our city's most influential citizens, she's has taken it upon herself to oversee their incarceration. Sadly, they're proving elusive but I have confidence that Maven won't give up until this city has been rid of them all.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Thieves Guild.
output: Liars and bastards. Every one of them. I'd have their heads on a pike if it wasn't for the war effort. All I need is a dozen men and we could march into the Ratway and burn them out like rodents. Stormcloaks won't have it though. Too busy keeping the Imperial forces at bay.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Thieves Guild.
output: They're vermin... garbage. They're exactly what makes this city such a horrible place to live. How appropriate they should live in the Ratway with the rest of the trash.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you accept charity?
output: Of course! I'd be more than happy to add a donation to our charity box. Right now, the best you could provide is coin. We need all the help we can get.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You sound quite charitable.
output: Yes, I suppose someone has to be around here. Have you seen the condition of this sorry excuse for a city? Beggars roam the streets, crime runs rampant and the threat of war is driving away business. The paltry amount of coin that I place in the charity box at the temple is the least I can do to help.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about Talos?
output: He's the protector of Man, the Dragon of the North, the patron of all Nords. And despite the Imperials and their treaty, he will always be one of the Nine Divines. A devout Nord would rather fall in battle and have his blood spill upon the earth than allow the Empire to strike his name from the divinity.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What is the White-Gold Concordat?
output: Surely you're aware of the Great War between the Imperials and the Elves who called themselves the Aldmeri Dominion? When the smoke cleared, the White-Gold Concordat was signed... it was supposedly a treaty aimed at establishing peace within the Empire. One of the terms of the treaty was the outlawing of worship to Talos. To the Stormcloaks, this was viewed as the moment when the Empire became unworthy of the allegiance of any true Nord.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll donate some other time.
output: As you wish. Whatever you can afford will certainly be put to good use.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Black-Briar family.
output: The Black-Briars have been instrumental in keeping Riften on the map. Before the meadery was opened almost fifty years ago, this town was nothing... a simple waypoint for those journeying on to Morrowind. Now, thanks to my mother's generosity, this city is making its mark.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Black-Briar family.
output: When speaking of the Black-Briars, only one thought should spring to mind. We are not to be trifled with. Help us, you end up rich. Cross us and you'll end up a memory. Is that enough information for you?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Black-Briar family.
output: Hmph. My family. All that wealth and they squander it on foolish ventures and political schemes. I was meant for so much more than all of this... I wish to pledge my life and ply my talents in darker circles. If only my mother would let me, I would make her proud.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: I haven't seen so much celebrating in years. Mercer's dead, we have a new Guild Master and things are finally looking up. Business is booming, coin is flowing and everyone seems content as things keep going our way. A new chapter in the Thieves Guild is being written this day and we all owe it to you. Many thanks.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: I haven't seen so much celebrating in years. Mercer's dead, we have a new Guild Master and things are finally looking up. I only hope we can restore the Guild to its former glory after all the damage that's been done.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: So, word has it you and Brynjolf know where Mercer's hiding. Good. Make sure you make him pay for what he did to Gallus... heck, for what he did to all of us. We're all behind you, friend. Do your best.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: The word is that Mercer Frey is a dead man. The Guild wants his blood. I can't say I blame them. Murder is not our way. Gallus was before my time, but I still can't believe it. You need to teach him a lesson... show him the penalty for betrayal around here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: Look, I like you, so I'll tell it to you straight. Brynjolf and the rest are in the Guild, and they're ready to cut you down. I know you have a damn good reason for siding with Karliah, so I hope you can give it to them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: Everyone's been worried since you and Mercer haven't shown up in a while. Brynjolf even went out to find you. Delvin and Vex have been running things for now. I hope this all gets straightened out soon or I'm headed on the first caravan out of Riften.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: Glad to hear Gulum-Ei got what he deserved. That lizard owes me big for a bad shipment of Shadowbanish Wine he tried to pass off on me. Mercer's been storming around waiting for you to come back. I think he's finally figured out who's been messing with the Guild. Never seen the guy so angry. Better help him out any way you can.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: Maven was down here right before you got back and she was all smiles. Haven't seen her like that in a long time. Whatever you did at Honningbrew, you're now on her good side. Best of all, if she's happy, Mercer's happy. Keep it up and you'll go places.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: Well, you did something Vex couldn't do at Goldenglow, so you're looking pretty damn good. Just watch your back and do what Mercer says... he'll sort it out. Word is that you found something while you were out there though... something that could be a problem for the Guild.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: I don't know about the others, but I sure am glad to see a fresh face down here. Last few years have been pretty bad. I've almost closed this place up. The Flagon used to be packed every night with the boys from the Guild but now look at it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: I don't know you so we've got nothing to talk about. How about you finish the job Brynjolf gave you, then we can talk.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, what's the word around the Guild?
output: Sure. How about you mind your own business about it, and I won't have to get Dirge to toss you into the cistern?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the Ratway?
output: Disgusting. Ruined sewers filled with goodness knows what. There's an entrance down by the canal, but I'd highly advise you stay out of there... its the Thieves Guild's territory.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the Ratway?
output: Everyone knows the Thieves Guild uses the old sewer system beneath Riften as their hideout. I'd go down there myself, but that would leave Jarl Laila unprotected.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like to donate. (5 gold)
output: Thank you! I can promise you that this will be put to good use.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What of Ulfric himself?
output: With the Stormcloaks at his back, Ulfric's poised to rid Skyrim of the Empire's forces and invalidate our involvement with the White-Gold Concordat. Between you and I, I think his motivations are a bit more self-serving. He uses this holy war as leverage in order to pursue the throne. If he were to be crowned High King, I'm not so certain it would be the golden age his followers expect.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What of Ulfric himself?
output: With the Stormcloaks at his back, Ulfric's poised to rid Skyrim of the Empire's forces and invalidate our involvement with the White-Gold Concordat. Many have died taking up arms for this cause. I fear that the land will be stained with blood for years to come.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You seem to be well acquainted with wealth.
output: Wealth is my business. Help me out and I can add to yours. Would you like a taste?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the Ratway?
output: There are ruined sewer tunnels beneath the city. The only way I know how to get in there is through a door off of the canal. If I were you, I'd keep my feet dry and stay up here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I think you need to shut your mouth. (Brawl)
output: I'm going to make you sorry for this!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Don't say I didn't warn you. (Brawl)
output: Come on, give it your best shot!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Maybe I should visit that farm in Morrowind.
output: How could you possibly know about... Please. My family means too much to me. Don't hurt them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you get many guests?
output: We have guests as often as we can but there aren't a lot of travellers these days. The war keeps people off the roads.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What locations does this mill supply?
output: We supply Falkreath to the south. Until recently we supplied Helgen. Falkreath trades with the surrounding holds and without our wood they would have trouble keeping their prices low.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have the coat
output: We would but there's a big wedding taking place at Castle Dour. We'll have to wait until after the wedding.  Come back in a few nights when the wedding reception is over and we'll start the ceremony when you do.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you like it out here, away from everything?
output: Other people just make things complex. Out here, Hern and I can get everything we need from the occasional traveler.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Surely there's more you can tell me.
output: There is indeed much that we know that you do not. That does not mean that you are ready to understand it. Do not let your easy mastery of the Voice tempt you into the arrogance of power that has been the downfall of many Dragonborn before you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Thank you, Master. I will continue my training.
output: Good. Then you will be ready for whatever lies ahead.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I will try to follow the Way of the Voice.
output: That is commendable. But remember, the Dragon Blood is itself a gift of Akatosh. Do not try to deny that gift. Your destiny requires you to use your Voice - why else would Akatosh have bestowed this power upon you? If you remember to use your Voice in service to the purpose of Akatosh, you will remain true to the Way.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: But I don't follow your philosophy. Why help me learn the Voice?
output: The Dragonborn is an exception to all the rules - the Dragon Blood itself is a gift of the gods. If we accept one gift, how can we deny the other? As Dragonborn, you have received the ability to Shout directly from Akatosh. We therefore seek to guide you on the proper use of your gift, which transcends the restrictions which bind other mortals.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who was Jurgen Windcaller?
output: He was a great war leader of the ancient Nords, a master of the Voice, or Tongue. After the disaster at Red Mountain, where the Nord army was annihilated, he spent many years pondering the meaning of that terrible defeat. He finally came to realize that the gods had punished the Nords for their arrogant and blasphemous misuse of the Voice. He was the first to understand that the Voice should be used solely for the glory and worship of the gods, not the glory of men. Jurgen Windcaller's mastery of the Voice eventually overcame all opposition, and the Way of the Voice was born.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What did you actually say?
output: Ah. I sometimes forget you are not versed in the dragon tongue as we are. This is a rough translation: "Long has the Stormcrown languished, with no worthy brow to sit upon." "By our breath we bestow it now to you in the name of Kyne, in the name of Shor, and in the name of Atmora of Old." "You are Ysmir now, the Dragon of the North, hearken to it."

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What was that ceremony all about? Were you Shouting at me?
output: We spoke the traditional words of greeting to a Dragonborn who has accepted our guidance. The same words were used to greet the young Talos, when he came to High Hrothgar, before he became the Emperor Tiber Septim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller.
output: Stand in the center of the room and prepare yourself to taste the Voice of the Greybeards.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller.
output: Come inside. The other masters will meet us there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller.
output: First, Master Wulfgar will teach you the final word of Unrelenting Force. You are ready.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like us to move somewhere else.
output: Oh? Where? Oh? Where? Oh? Where? Oh? Where? Oh? Where? Oh? Where? Oh? Where? Oh? Where?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who runs the show at Honningbrew Meadery?
output: Some layabout named Sabjorn. Been a thorn in my side for the last few years now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Yes. I've seen that symbol before.
output: Well, whoever this mysterious marking represents, they'll regret starting a war with me. You should bring this information to the Thieves Guild immediately.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: Yes, I have something special for you.  But it's not for everyone to hear. Meet me in the Underforge tonight. We will speak more.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work.
output: Still eager to please. This is good. Skjor may be right about you. He has something special planned for you. Better talk to him.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for the Staff of Magnus.
output: Are you? Well. I'm afraid I can't help you with that. I need the crystal to do anything useful, and I don't have it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Would you mind cooking something for me?
output: Here, this is fresh. I'll have another meal ready tomorrow. Here, this is fresh. I'll have another meal ready tomorrow. Here, this is fresh. I'll have another meal ready tomorrow. Here, this is fresh. I'll have another meal ready tomorrow. Here, this is fresh. I'll have another meal ready tomorrow. Here, this is fresh. I'll have another meal ready tomorrow. Here, this is fresh. I'll have another meal ready tomorrow. Here, this is fresh. I'll have another meal ready tomorrow.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have the Elder Scroll.
output: You have it. The Kel - the Elder Scroll. Tiid kreh... qalos. Time shudders at its touch. There is no question. You are doom-driven. Kogaan Akatosh. The very bones of the earth are at your disposal. Go then. Fulfill your destiny. Take the Scroll to the Time-Wound. Do not delay. Alduin will be coming. He cannot miss the signs.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you want?
output: The Greybeards seem to think you're the Dragonborn. I hope they're right.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What of it?
output: I think you're looking for this.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who's in charge of Whiterun?
output: Hrongar became the Jarl when his brother Balgruuf, who had the job before him, was murdered. Balgruuf was an even-tempered man, but his brother's a hot-blooded war-monger who wants to settle everything with a blade. If you've got some business with Hrongar, mind you stay on his good side. The palace dungeon's filled with folk who roused his temper.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who's in charge of Whiterun?
output: Vignar the Revered is the Jarl in Whiterun. I guess he was a great hero once, because the Companions all call him "Vignar the Revered." Is Vignar too old to be Jarl? It's a fair question. If he's grown infirm and is losing his wits, where does that leave the people of Whiterun?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Lexicon? Burden? What are you talking about?
output: The memories. I cannot stand them. You must take them away, return them to Avanchnzel. You must take the Lexicon from me. Please... take it now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Honningbrew Mead?
output: You've never had a taste of sweet Honningbrew? Why, it's only the finest mead outside of Sovngarde!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Perhaps you'd like to share this Black Briar Mead with me instead?
output: Black Briar? How dare you shove that swill in my face. I'd rather drink mammoth drool!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why only have one bottle when you can have two?
output: Ysmir's beard! You're one after my own heart. I would love another bottle.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I would love to share a drink with you, friend!
output: Ha, nothing like fine spirits to help raise your... well, your spirits!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Elisif loved the outfit. She'll be placing an order soon.
output: That's wonderful. You've done us a great service. As promised the outfit is yours and here's something for your trouble.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do around here?
output: It is. We train the bards you hear throughout the land. Viarmo is the head of the college and in charge of admissions.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do around here?
output: Only in that I'm a graduate. I work at here at the Winking Skeever. I would highly recommend it though. Talk to Viarmo if you're interested.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do around here?
output: Only in that I'm a graduate. I work over at the Winking Skeever. I would highly recommend it though. Talk to Viarmo if you're interested.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It was made by Radiant Raiment.
output: Oh really? Well you can tell them that I will be putting in a request for a few dresses quite soon.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's with the Orc?
output: Lurbuk? Fancies himself a bard. He pays, so I let him stay. If I had any customers, I'd be worried about him annoying them. But, well... Look around.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you have a hard time getting supplies way out here?
output: No, no. Well, sometimes, but that's not the problem. I just often don't have much to do, so I tend to... I try things out. They don't usually work, but I try. Next thing I know, I've used up most of my stock.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about the area?
output: The marsh is treacherous. You would do well to not wander at night.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why set up shop in Morthal?
output: As anyone will tell you, Morthal can be a dangerous place. My... talents... are useful here. I help maintain order, even if it goes unnoticed.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is business in Morthal slow?
output: Slow? No. It just ain't there at all. Few enough reasons to pass through Morthal before the war started. Now... Well, let's just say the front door doesn't get much use.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you like my outfit?
output: It's quite fetching actually. The craftsmanship is excellent.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry, I'm afraid you'll make me look silly.
output: Look silly! As if you could look any sillier than you do now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Well, I'm making it "need to know." (Intimidate)
output: I'm afraid that kind of thing doesn't work on Captains in the Imperial Army.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the word around town?
output: Generally, if you want rumors, you should talk to Corpulus. That said... I did see a visitor pass through on his way to the Blue Palace.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds easy enough. I'll do it.
output: Good. Here's the outfit. Try to get Elisif's opinion on it and if she likes it mention it's from Radiant Raiment.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does being a bard pay well?
output: Oh, no. But being surrounded by good music, good drink and good friends is all I've ever asked for.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So what should I wear to the Blue Palace?
output: You're really going to the Blue Palace? That presents an opportunity. If you were willing to wear one of Radiant Raiment's outfits and speak to the Jarl I would not only pay you but let you keep the outfit.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hi. Svari asked me to talk to you.
output: She did, did she? She's going to get a sit down later.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You may just have to give her time.
output: Yeah, that's what papa says too.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Maybe I could convince her.
output: You would do that? That's great. You should go do it right now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm sorry about your uncle.
output: Thanks. Papa talks about it some. Mum doesn't say much since Uncle Roggvir died. She doesn't even go to Temple anymore. I wish she would. At least that way she'd have people to talk to.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I've got the Amulet
output: Thanks so much. I'll return to temple. Here's something for your time and effort.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll do what I can.
output: Why did you... nevermind, it's a sign. I'll return to temple. Here's something for your help.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll do what I can.
output: Thanks.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: She wants you to return to Temple.
output: Well. I wish it were that simple. Maybe it is. Look, I want to go back but I won't feel right in there without a tie to Talos. My brother Roggvir wore a symbol of Talos. He kept it hidden on his person. If I had that... I can't go near his body. Would you get it back for me?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How long have you been a stablemaster?
output: Been about eight years now. I used to be a mercenary, but one trip to Ravenscar Hollow cured me of that. There's hagravens in that cave with talons like daggers. They'll open your bowels quick as a wink if you let 'em get close. Creature like that'll make a man think long and hard about what he wants out of life.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Aren't you worried about the dragons?
output: My pa used to say there ain't no use worryin' about the things you can't change.  If it's my fate to be ended by a dragon, so be it. Meantime, I'll live my life the way I want to.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's wrong?
output: I don't know what it's doing up there, but I'm not waiting around to find out!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where's this dragon?
output: It flew over the town and landed on the old dragon burial mound.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: A dragon is attacking Kynesgrove?
output: Well, I don't know. Not yet... it flew over the town and landed on the old dragon mound!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm listening...
output: Back in 42 I was stationed in Hammerfell, on leave in Sentinel, trying to track down some refugee relatives who had fled persecution in Alinor. Suddenly an explosion of magic in the refugee quarter. Thalmor mages were attacking the Altmer dissidents who were resisting with magic of their own. I ran to the scene with other Legionaries who where stationed there, but the entire quarter was a smoking ruin by the time we arrived. Everyone was dead. Wholesale slaughter. The Dominion, not content with killing dissidents at home, came to Hammerfell to finish the job. We're supposedly at peace now. But I put in to be stationed here to keep an eye on the Thalmor. I've a feeling they're behind this unrest in Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why did you join the Legion?
output: My parents were traveling merchants eventually settling in Cyrodiil. I must have inherited their wanderlust... I joined the Legion to see the world. I know, that's one of those things people say, but it's completely true in my case. Wasn't long before I saw more of the world than I bargained for.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That's all I wanted to know.
output: For the glory of the Empire.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You mentioned something back there...
output: The life of a soldier is full of hardship. That's nothing. But they send the Legion to places that've gotten too bad to be settled without violence. What's hard is seeing good people warped by evil. And I've seen the face of evil. It was in the air above Sentinel on the Night of Green Fire.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Please continue...
output: Home? Home to me is a hot cup of ale at the end of the day and five minutes without someone needing something from me... Cyrodiil is a beautiful place, full of diverse peoples and histories. But so too, Hammerfell and Skyrim, and every other place I've been. Don't get me wrong, every country has its dark corners. But that's why we're here. To bring order and civilization, and to protect the people.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Go on...
output: Ulfric and his thugs are stirring up trouble for their own agenda. The Empire is the only thing keeping the Dominion from walking all over Skyrim. It matters little if some of the people here are ignorant to that truth. They are still citizens of the Empire. It's our solemn duty to protect them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you do any work for the ships?
output: Aye. I've worked on a few moorings here and there for it. Most of the ship captains are superstitious about who works on their vessels, though. And Dawnstar is known for its bad luck. We're the last port of call before Windhelm, and the ore we trade makes rich targets for pirates.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Have you been in Dawnstar long?
output: Pfft. I'm the oldest woman in Dawnstar. Was here when the Skald the Elder was Skald the Younger. He's a fool, if you haven't met him already. Thinks Ulfric Stormcloak is invincible and spits dragon fire. The people here look to Brina Merilis when they need things settled. Real firebrand going up. Wasn't surprised when she joined the Legion.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tiber Septim's room?
output: That's right. In the Second Era, Tiber Septim himself led the army that conquered Old Hroldan from the barbarians of the Reach. Septim would later found the Empire that united Tamriel, but his first known battle and victory was right here. And this inn has the very bed the great general slept in on his first night as Old Hroldan's liberator. As good as it was hundreds of years ago.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds like you really admire Ulfric.
output: Every Nord should admire Ulfric. He fights for all of us. In fact, he's the reason I chose to learn the smithing trade. I want to make weapons and armor for the great Stormcloak army.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about Windhelm?
output: Grew up here. Colder as Atmora, but that just grows the beards thicker! Grew up here. Colder as Atmora, but that just grows the beards thicker! Lot of history in these walls. We're trying to make some more. It's a lucky time to be alive.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where do you get your goods?
output: Wherever I can find them. If you're the type who worries over where something came from, you may want to move on.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why do you work for Nurelion?
output: Are you kidding? I came all the way from Cyrodiil just to work with him. He's... he's not the best teacher. But just watching him, I've learned so much.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does the war mean good business for you?
output: I don't see these troubles as business. This is a labor of honor.  To bring Ulfric his rightful glory, I would hammer a thousand shields. Shor's bones, I might just have to!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does Ulfric have much need for magic?
output: No, but then I don't have much need for Ulfric. We both leave well enough alone.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you like being a blacksmith?
output: Smithing isn't the most exciting thing for me, but we all have to lend a hand as best we can. If a Stormcloak uses one of my swords to strike down an Imperial soldier, then I've done my part to free our land.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you think the White Phial exists?
output: It doesn't matter what I believe. Nurelion does, and it might be the only thing keeping him alive right now.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the next target?
output: The Silver Hand has been scouring the world for more pieces of Wuuthrad.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I got the fragment.
output: Another piece of glory. Good work, Shield-Brother.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I got the fragment.
output: Another piece of glory. Good work, Shield-Sister.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of magic do you study?
output: Whatever I don't already know.  Power is the crux of this world. There's always more of it to be had, if you look in the right places.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are all the dock workers Argonians?
output: We work where we can get work. The Nords don't like unloading their ships, so we do it instead. Sometimes cargo goes missing.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How's your steel?
output: Every bit as sharp as what you'll find in Whiterun.  I respect Eorlund, but he has the good fortune to work the Skyforge. Something about the fires... their steel just holds tighter.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Must be tough to grow anything out here.
output: There's an old saying that only a Nord can work the soil in Skyrim. I don't think anyone else would have the patience for it. It takes half a day just to dig a planting row in the cold, stony earth here. But what else can we do, eat rocks and ice?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What will you do now that Nurelion is gone?
output: I'll carry on his tradition as best I can. I could spend a lifetime just going over his notes.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How long have you lived in Windhelm?
output: I came here as a hatchling. The only thing colder than Skyrim is the Nords themselves, but we stick together.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How long have you been in Windhelm?
output: Just got here from the Summerset Isles. Lots of opportunity in Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you do for the Jarl?
output: For Ulfric? Oh, nothing official. Known him for years. He seems to value my thoughts, and I'm grateful for that.  I don't really have a mind for war, and I think he likes having an untrained opinion from time to time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why is this called Candlehearth Hall?
output: Did you see that candle above the fire upstairs? It was lit one hundred and sixty-three years ago, back when this building was the home of a grand warrior named Vundheim. When word came that he'd fallen, his son Deroct lit the candle in his honor. Nobody knows why it still burns.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have Alva's journal.
output: Then stop wasting my time. Then stop wasting my time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're from Hammerfell?
output: That's right. Home of the Redguards. The land of sand and seas. I hope one day I'll convince Rustleif to take us back there. Until then, I'm content running the forge together here in Dawnstar.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you do any work for the ships?
output: Not much. I came here a few years ago from Hammerfell when I married. The land is beautiful, but I can't stand this cold. I don't know how Rustleif manages it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What should we do?
output: Come on. We need to find out what's happening up there!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was happy to help.
output: Here, you should have this.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Nurelion only gave me five septims.
output: Oh, I'm sorry about that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's the Ratway?
output: It's our name for the old sewers that run under the city. It used to be a huge system hundreds of years ago but it fell into decay just like the rest of Riften. The Guild stocks the place full of thugs that aren't good enough to join, so watch yourself if you venture down there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Thieves Guild.
output: They'd stop at nothing to take your last bit of food if that's all you had. The Ratway's too good of a place for that scum.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the Thieves Guild.
output: They used to be pretty feared around here. I mean, you'd whisper the name and it'd send chills down your spine. Now, they're nothing more than ruffians and thugs trying to pry a few extra coin from honest people. All it would take is a small force of guard to go into the Ratway and flush them out.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like to clear up the matter of my suspension.
output: Then, as I've said, 1000 gold will be required to set things right.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd like to clear up the matter of my suspension.
output: Ah, yes. There was an incident, wasn't there? Well, as this is the first time this has happened, I'll make it very clear that the College does not condone that sort of behavior. As an act of good faith on your part, I'd advise that you consider donating an amount of gold to the College. Strictly to cover damages, you understand. I believe 250 gold should be sufficient.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't have the gold for that.
output: Then I'm afraid your suspension will stand for now. I'm sorry, but that's the way it has to be.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's the gold you wanted.
output: Yes. I hope this will be enough to maintain order. Once again, your suspension is lifted. Please try and control yourself.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Here's the gold you wanted.
output: You don't seem to have the gold on you. Perhaps there's a misunderstanding?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why are you looking for this person?
output: It's none of your concern. All you need to know is that we're paying for information. If that doesn't interest you, feel free to walk away.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was told someone at the College might be able to help me.
output: It's true, the scrolls are a subject of interest to us, and work has been done to learn of them. But outsiders are not allowed within the College.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I need to locate an Elder Scroll.
output: A lofty goal, to be sure. And what brings your search to our doorstep?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Someone giving you trouble?
output: That bard Mikael is begging for a dagger up against his throat, the way he goes on about me. I've heard him boasting at the Bannered Mare, saying he'll "conquer me as a true Nord conquers any harsh beast." Hmph.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're on. (Brawl - 100 gold)
output: This will be good training. Let's go!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What if I talk to <Alias.ShortName=Target>?
output: He's a stubborn oaf. I don't know what good it'll do.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Fine. Forget I asked.
output: Wasn't your business, anyway.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sorry to hear that.
output: I'm sure. I'm sure.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Maybe we can come to an understanding. (<BribeCost> gold)
output: Bribing me? Well, a bard does need to eat. On my ancestor's honor, I won't trouble sweet Carlotta again.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: That's too bad.
output: My loss, right?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me now or I'll kill you where you stand!
output: No, please! There's no need for that! I'll tell you everything. It's Karliah... her name is Karliah.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He's going to owe us for this betrayal.
output: Aye, he does indeed... and with his fingers in the East Empire Company's pie, we'll make good use of that debt. If I'm not being clear enough, that means we don't want him killed. For now, just keep on his tail and he's bound to step into something he can't scrape off his boot.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The Greybeards are right. I am Dragonborn.
output: I hope so. But you'll forgive me if I don't assume that something's true just because the Greybeards say so. I just handed you the Horn of Jurgen Windcaller. Does that make me Dragonborn, too?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I know that mound - high on the hill east of Kynesgrove.
output: Why didn't you say so earlier? At least now we don't have to waste time searching the area. We should get moving. There's no time to waste.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Hold on. I'm not ready to go yet.
output: I can't wait around for you to make up your mind. I'll meet you at Kynesgrove. Don't waste time getting there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Let's go kill a dragon.
output: I need to get into my traveling gear. Give me a minute and I'll be ready.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I know that mound - high on the hill east of Kynesgrove.
output: Good. Good. Now we won't have to spend time searching for it. We should get moving. There's no time to waste.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Reporting in.
output: We're taking the capital. Meet the soldiers gathering for the attack. Move it! We're taking the capital. Meet the soldiers gathering for the attack. Move it! We're taking the capital. Meet the soldiers gathering for the attack. Move it!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Reporting in.
output: We're taking the capital. Meet the brothers gathering for the attack. Fight well or die well. Talos be with you. We're taking the capital. Meet the brothers gathering for the attack. Fight well or die well. Talos be with you.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why'd the Companions reject you?
output: It wasn't my fault! I told them over and over that it was an accident! They wanted me to prove my worth, so they threw me up against a young whelp of a lad, hardly old enough to grow his first chin-hairs. I guess they thought a woman wasn't strong enough to hurt him. I didn't mean for him to die! Why would I want that? I just... lost control.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Sounds like you've got a grudge.
output: You been talking to those Companions? "Too hot-headed," they cried. Weak, pathetic cowards, the lot of them!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You must really love to fight.
output: That, and a true Nord never misses a chance to test her worth. The heat of battle is the fire that forges the strongest blades. It's an old Nord proverb.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you know of the Khajiit?
output: About the same as everyone else. They're the cat-folk of Elsweyr. Great warriors, good traders. Way I hear it, Elsweyr ain't nothing like Skyrim. It's got tropical forests and dusty badlands. It sounds awful!

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You mentioned trading caravans?
output: Yeah, these Khajiit make a living traveling the roads and selling their wares. It's got to be tough. Skyrim's a hard enough land when you've got a roof over your head. Worst thing is, nobody wants them in the cities. Nobody trusts them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about Whiterun?
output: Hmph. Plenty. The city's ruled by the Jarl up in Dragonsreach. That's the fortress, there, up on the tall hill. I'd say we're prosperous enough. Most folk don't go hungry, if they're willing to work hard. But you're probably more interested in Jorrvaskr, mead hall of the Companions. Their deeds of war and valor are... legendary.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're a mercenary?
output: I am an artisan, painting in strokes of blood red upon the canvas of life. But yes, I will take coin to fight at your side. After all, where is the value in creating art if there is nobody left alive to see it?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You mentioned the Great War.
output: About 30 years ago, the Aldmeri Dominion invaded the Empire. It was a surprise attack, caught everyone off guard. They ended up sacking the Imperial City. I was there, blasting apart young Elven men and women with Fireballs and Lightning Bolts. By Akatosh, all the blood. The smell of flesh burned and pulled apart by magic. I never want to do that to another soul ever again.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Another time, maybe.
output: Very well then.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'll do it.
output: Thanks.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have the Elder Scroll.
output: Do not delay. Alduin must feel the tremors in Time by the Scroll's presence here. He will know what it means.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm looking for work. Got any leads?
output: The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details. The Jarl has put out a bounty on the dragon that's been terrorizing the countryside. Here, take a look at this decree for details.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: The Battle-Borns?
output: Don't even get me started on that lot. They put on airs like they're somethin' special. Sure, they've got money, but they ain't got a shred of honor between 'em. Gray-Mane. Now that's a name fills you with pride. We've got roots in Whiterun. We've got history.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Where's Jorrvaskr?
output: Head up the steps from the market an' look to your right. Can't miss it.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you trust them?
output: Matter of fact, I do. They've been fair enough with me, far as I can tell. And a Nord knows a liar when she sees one.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why not?
output: Reputation, mostly. A lot of Khajiit turn to smuggling and thievery to get by. A few bad apples spoil the bunch. You know how it is.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You sound a little confused.
output: I don't want to choose! They're both so amazing.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is it still possible to aid the temple?
output: Always, child. Mara's mercy is ever-flowing.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I was just curious.
output: Well aren't you a strange one.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're right. I was probably mistaken.
output: Of course you were. Now stop wasting my time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't think I can help you.
output: Do not forsake your heart, child, for it may one day come to surprise you. Mara will always accept into her arms should you seek return to her fold.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: It's true. He told me.
output: Please, stop wasting my time. You're embarrassing yourself.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What do you think of him?
output: Think of him? He's an odd little man. Always poking around the ruins and wasting time in his museum. Seems friendly enough. Obviously intelligent. Why do you ask?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: He has feelings for you.
output: What? You're out of your mind. That old coot's more interested in dead dwarves than anybody around here. Don't talk such rot.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I want to talk to you about Calcelmo.
output: Calcelmo? What about him?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're probably overthinking this.
output: That may be the case. But she is as volatile as a sabre cat. One wrong word, and I've seen her turn on a man so quickly...

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's dangerous about daedra?
output: They are profane creatures with no hope of redemption. They lure innocents to their deaths and corrupt the souls of all they touch. They are profane creatures with no hope of redemption. They lure innocents to their deaths and corrupt the souls of all they touch. And their heretical artifacts grant powers to mortals that wreak havoc across Tamriel. They must be destroyed or guarded to prevent temptation. And their heretical artifacts grant powers to mortals that wreak havoc across Tamriel. They must be destroyed or guarded to prevent temptation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You hunt daedra?
output: And any other abominations that prey on mortals. Vampires. Werewolves. Witches. And any other abominations that prey on mortals. Vampires. Werewolves. Witches. But the Daedra are the worst. Their callous disregard for our lives is abhorrent in the eyes of the God of Mercy. But the Daedra are the worst. Their callous disregard for our lives is abhorrent in the eyes of the God of Mercy.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who's Stendarr?
output: He is the God of Mercy. The patron of order and justice for all of Tamriel. He is the God of Mercy. The patron of order and justice for all of Tamriel. We bring his compassion where none can be found, by cleansing all those who would offend his children. We bring his compassion where none can be found, by cleansing all those who would offend his children.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You're a Vigilant of Stendarr?
output: Yes. Our order was founded after the Oblivion Crisis. We dedicate our lives to facing the threat of Daedra wherever they appear. Yes. Our order was founded after the Oblivion Crisis. We dedicate our lives to facing the threat of Daedra wherever they appear.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Please cure me.
output: Stendarr's Light purify you of your ills. Stendarr's Light purify you of your ills.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Fine. Take all the artifacts I have.
output: Wise decision. The vaults in the Hall of the Vigilant will guard this against future temptation. Wise decision. The vaults in the Hall of the Vigilant will guard this against future temptation.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Got it, ma'am.
output: Good.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: When do I get out?
output: You won't. The Jarl has ordered a life sentence for you. Get comfortable in the dark, 'cause you'll never see the sun again.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You don't look like a guard.
output: We're not. The Silver-Bloods pay our wage. Every man here is a trained mercenary.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Keep out? Why?
output: This is a jail, owned by the Silver-Blood family. We use the prisoners to mine for ore. It's the most secure prison in Skyrim. Throw scum in, close the gates. No one gets out. So unless you're here to dig, you don't belong here.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I submit. Take me to jail.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You really think the dark elves are Imperial spies?
output: Wouldn't surprise me. They've done nothing to help in the fight for Skyrim's freedom. Those Thalmor are elves, too. I bet they're working together. Maybe I should round up some men and take us a few prisoners to interrogate.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why do you hate the dark elves?
output: They're parasites. They're living in our city, under our protection, but what do they do for us? Nothing! I know the High King invited them here, but he didn't ask me or anyone else first. Maybe he should have.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are you treated as badly as the dark elves?
output: It was difficult at first. The Nords of this city are, at best, suspicious of outsiders. But in time, I made the right friends and proved myself useful enough that they don't give me trouble anymore.  The dark elves are too proud and naive to understand the way things truly are, and so they continue to dwell in that slum.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You live in the Gray Quarter?
output: I'm a Dark Elf and I live in Windhelm, so yes, I live in the Gray Quarter. You must be new around here, or you'd know they don't let my kind live anywhere outside that slum.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Looked like those Nords were giving you trouble.
output: Nothing new there. Most of the Nords living in Windhelm don't care much for us, but Rolff is the worst by far. He likes to get drunk and walk around the Gray Quarter yelling insults at us in the small hours of the morning. A real charmer, that one.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's next?
output: You'd be wasted as a regular soldier. I have special plans for you. You'll be of greater use to me with greater flexibility. Make your way to our hidden military camp in the Pale. Rikke will have important tasks for you, and will need you when we reclaim the capital.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What's next?
output: But I also want you to find our hidden camp in Falkreath. Galmar will have special tasks for you, and will need you when we liberate the capital. I suspect you'll be of greater use to us with greater freedom, so you're free to engage the Imperials as you see fit.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

input: It's not for me. It's for Calcelmo.
output: Calcelmo? Is he interested in Faleen? That sly old codger. I should have guessed. Good for him. For the both of them. Between you and me, she could use a bit of warmth.

input: I used Dragonrend on Alduin, but he escaped.
output: Esbern should be able to help. He's spent his whole life poring over every old book he could find about dragons and that prophecy. He's been digging around the records the Blades left here, too. But we can talk about that later.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: Did you find the Elder Scroll? What happened when you took it back to the Throat of the World?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

input: I'm ready for anything.
output: Arrogance will serve you poorly. Your worth must be determined before knowledge can be bestowed upon you. And so you shall be tested.

input: Is there anything more I can learn about Alteration magic?
output: At this very moment? No. However... Well, I've been working on something. An improvement on the Ebonyflesh spell. I've made progress, but then hit a snag. I think perhaps you could help.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What kind of a test is this?
output: Knowledge is power. Knowing spells can be powerful, but applying that knowledge is key. You will be called upon to rely solely on your Restoration spells.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm ready for your test.
output: Step into the light, and your test begins.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So...
output: You will rely on your skill as a mage. Not on your belongings, not on your scrolls and potions. Only what lies within. Survive, and you are worthy. This is the test put before you. Will you accept?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I need to talk to you about Helgen.
output: So. You were at Helgen? You saw this dragon with your own eyes?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Can you sing "Ragnar the Red"?
output: Ahhh, a fine but bloody tale. I can do that one. Ahhh, a fine but bloody tale. I can do that one. Ahhh, a fine but bloody tale. I can do that one. Ahhh, a fine but bloody tale. I can do that one.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you know "The Age of Oppression"?
output: You must be a Stormcloak through and through to request that one. You must be a Stormcloak through and through to request that one. You must be a Stormcloak through and through to request that one. You must be a Stormcloak through and through to request that one.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Are we ready?
output: I think my voice is ready. I hope we've done this well.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'd understand better if less mystery was involved.
output: As a Nightingale, I've been sworn to secrecy regarding the Sepulcher. I know the Guild doesn't do much to foster faith, but I'm going to have to ask that you continue to trust me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Do you know anything about the attack?
output: No. I was just getting some fresh air. Had one too many pints of mead at the Silver-Blood Inn.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I must have missed it. Sorry.
output: You don't have to say sorry to me. I just hope the Eight bring us more peace in the future.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is there anything else you can tell me about the dagger?
output: Not much, I'm afraid. It was named Kahvozein's Fang after the dragon worshipped by this particular sect of the cult. They were said to be quite fond of ritual sacrifices. Perhaps not the brightest spot in Skyrim's history, eh?

output: I'm the fence down here. You come by anything you don't exactly own and I'll pay you some coin for it. Minus a little slice for the Guild, of course. I can also provide a few supplies useful to our trade now and again, for a small fee.

output: So, you're the new recruit, eh? Well, looks like you and I are going to have to get very well acquainted.

output: Well, you could always speak to Delvin or Vex if you're looking for extra work. Or if you're looking for training, we've got plenty of it down here. Delvin, Vex, Niruin and Vipir can give you a leg up on that.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does the Guild provide other services?
output: If you're lookin' to get some coin for the fruits of your labor, you should talk to Tonilia. She sounds tough, but she'll cut you a fair deal. I also suggest you spend some time in the trainin' room. Just talk to Vipir. He'll show you around.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does the Guild provide other services?
output: If you're ever in need of some quick coin for items you find on the job, Tonilia is the best fence around. And besides myself, Delvin, Niruin and Vipir can help you with any sort of training you might need to sharpen your skills.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does the Guild provide other services?
output: I'll point you to the first and last person you're ever going to need to talk to. Tonilia. She's the Guild's fence. Treat her right and she'll make you rich. Try and rip her off and you'll have the whole Guild to answer to.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Does the Guild provide other services?
output: If talking your way out of trouble isn't enough, you could always pick up some training from Delvin, Vex or Vipir. Also, I recommend hitting the training room if you need lockpick practice. Helped me out of a jam more than once.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Who's Elisif?
output: Ah, I forget you're new to Skyrim. Jarl Elisif, I should say, although only because she was married to Jarl Torryg when he was murdered. Ulfric murdered Torygg, you know. Walked right into his palace in Solitude and killed him. Shouted him to death, if you believe the stories. That's what started this whole war. The Empire couldn't ignore that. Once the jarls start killing each other, we're back to the bad old days.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I have news from Helgen. About the dragon attack.
output: Well, that explains why the guards let you in. Come on then, the Jarl will want to speak to you personally.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: You support the Empire, then?
output: Of course. Skyrim has always been part of the Empire. That doesn't mean I support everything the Empire's been doing lately, but Nords have never been fair-weather friends.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I need to speak to the Jarl...
output: What's the meaning of this interruption? Jarl Balgruuf is not receiving visitors.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Which side in the war does he favor?
output: I don't think he likes either Ulfric or Elisif much. Who can blame him? But I've no doubt he'll prove loyal to the Empire in the end. He's no traitor.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What can you tell me about the Jarl?
output: Jarl Balgruuf? He rules Whiterun Hold. A good man, perhaps a bit over-cautious, but these are dangerous times. So far he's managed to stay out of the war. I'm afraid it can't last, though.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How do I get to Whiterun from here?
output: Just follow the road north. When you get to Honningbrew Meadery, turn left and the road will take you to the city gates. It's not far. We used to go to the market there every month or so, until the roads got so dangerous with the war and all.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Anything different about it?
output: Of course... otherwise it wouldn't be much of a reward, now would it? Your new piece will enhance your skill beyond that of the original. Trust me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Don't worry. I'll return the Key.
output: Take this with you. I'm not certain if it will help within the walls of the Sepulcher, but I certainly don't need it as much as you. I've had this bow almost my entire life, and it's never let me down. I hope it brings you the same luck.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I don't have any of my old armor.
output: Tough luck for you then. Come back when you have at least one of the pieces.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Is the war really over?
output: I wish I could say that it was, but it's not that simple. Many Stormcloaks will fight until they die, because they still believe they're fighting for Skyrim's freedom. But without Ulfric, the movement will wither and die. It's only a matter of time.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Why did Brunwulf choose you to be Steward?
output: Well, a few reasons come to mind. In my days as a riverboat captain, I was known to run a tight ship. That, and I made my fortune by knowing when to spend my septims, and when not to. I can't stand waste.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about the city's history.
output: Windhelm is one of the oldest human cities in all of Tamriel. In fact, it was the capital of the First Empire, which was founded by Ysgramor The Palace of the Kings in which you now stand is one of the last buildings that remain from that era. Long ago, the Empire used the city to garrison troops who guarded the passes to Morrowind. And now, thanks to you, the city is back under the Empire's banner.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about your group.
output: Not sure I understand the question. The Legion's always been in Skyrim.  Not sure I understand the question. The Legion's always been in Skyrim. We have garrisons throughout all the provinces of the Empire. Our mission is to serve the Emperor, uphold the law, and protect the citizenry. Skyrim's days are darkening, and the Legion will soon be called into service like never before. But we stand ready, as always, to meet that call. Skyrim's days are darkening, and the Legion will soon be called into service like never before. But we stand ready, as always, to meet that call.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me about your group.
output: At first they called us that to belittle our cause. But we gladly accept being named for Ulfric Stormcloak, the only true High King of Skyrim. We are the true sons and daughters of Skyrim, and Ulfric... he's the truest of us all. We fight to make our land great once more, to raise up strong, noble thanes, and lay low false Jarls and the cowards who hide behind them. The sound of our fury is a storm about to break on the heads of our enemies. Our friendship, a cloak of true brotherhood for all who would wear it.

input: How do I join?
output: Ulfric's not running a social club. You don't join anything. Either you're a true son of Skyrim, or you're not.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How do you feel about this war?
output: Worse still, to pay for the privilege to keep his throne, the Emperor sells Skyrim and our very gods - Talos, no less! - to the damn elves. Skyrim is the birthplace of humanity. The birthplace of honor. And those snowbacked Imperials renounced both when they laid down before the Thalmor. And what did Torygg do? He and the Jarls that supported him? They took the Emperor's gold. Sold out their people for a slave master's "peace treaty." Ulfric did right killing him. Soon we'll rid Skyrim of elves, their bloody Justiciars, and the Jarls in their pockets. The whole damn lot of them. And we'll cleave through the Legion to get to them.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: I'm not sure. Tell me about him.
output: Well, as I said, Arkay is the god of life and death. You'll find his temples and Halls of the Dead all across Tamriel. Priests of Arkay such as myself perform rites for the dead and sometimes console the bereaved. We also keep a constant vigil against those who practice the vile arts of necromancy. I asked the question because I was hoping you might be able to help me recover something I've lost.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

input: Who are the Forsworn?
output: They're remnants of the old rulers of Markarth. Natives of the Reach. Followers of the old ways. The Nords drove them out of the city. Ulfric Stormcloak and his men. That was about 20 years ago. But somehow they're still here, and they're killing people.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: Yes. It all started when I was a boy. My father owned one of the mines. Rare for anyone who isn't a Nord. He was killed. Guards said it was just a madman, but everyone knew the murderer was a member of the Forsworn. I've been trying to find out why ever since. Gotten nowhere so far, and then I got married. Have a child of my own on the way. I swore I was going to just give up, for my child's sake, but it's like my father's ghost is haunting me. Asking me "Why?"

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: This has been going on for years. And all I've been able to find is murder and blood. I need help. Please. You find out why that woman was attacked, who's behind Weylin and the Forsworn, and I'll pay you for any information you bring me.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: Ah, yes. Rented the nicest room we had for a whole month. Ah, yes. Rented the nicest room we had for a whole month. I think she's sitting by the fire. Poor girl. I think she's sitting by the fire. Poor girl.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does a kid do for fun around here?
output: Well, I used to sneak out at night and try to tip over the big ox in the Gray-Manes' yard. And me and Mila used to climb up on the roof of Dragonsreach and look for birds' eggs. But I don't do that stuff anymore. Father keeps catching me and then I get in trouble.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: What does this have to do with dragons?
output: Ah, no mere brute mercenary, but a thinker - perhaps even a scholar? You see, when the stories of dragons began to circulate, many dismissed them as mere fantasies, rumors. Impossiblilities. One sure mark of a fool is to dismiss anything that falls outside his experience as being impossible. But I began to search for information about dragons - where had they gone all those years ago? And where were they coming from?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: So, were all the dragons killed in the Dragon War?
output: Oh, no. Many were killed, of course. But many survived into historical times. Why, this very palace was built by one of Balgruuf's ancestors to hold a captive dragon. Hence its name - Dragonsreach.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: All right. Where am I going and what am I fetching?
output: Straight to the point, eh? No need for tedious hows and whys. I like that. Leave those details to your betters, am I right?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Tell me more about the Dragon War.
output: I'm not surprised you've never heard of it. Even I used to think it was just a myth. But not anymore. The Dragon War was a real event, although only the barest glimmer of the actual events has come down to us. Far back in the Mythic Era, the dragons were worshipped as gods in Skyrim. Many of the monumental ruins that still dot the landscape were, in fact, built as temples to the dragons. The details are lost, but at some point the Nords rebelled. After a long and terrible war, the Nords overthrew their dragon overlords.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Never mind. I'll wait for Jarl Balgruuf.
output: The Jarl can be found in the Great Hall, probably sitting on his Jarl's throne. Not over here in a wizard's laboratory.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: How do you know this stone tablet is in Bleak Falls Barrow?
output: Well. Must preserve some professional secrets, mustn't we? I have my sources... reliable sources.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: A dragon destroyed Helgen. <Alias=RiverwoodFriend> is afraid Riverwood is next.
output: Alvor? The smith, isn't he? Reliable, solid fellow. Not prone to flights of fancy... And you're sure Helgen was destroyed by a dragon? This wasn't some Stormcloak raid gone wrong?

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Isn't it dangerous to leave filled soul gems near an unwarded pentacle?
output: Where? I would never... ah, I see. You are a fellow enchanter.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
input: Anything you can tell me about Bleak Falls Barrow?
output: An old tomb, built by the ancient Nords, perhaps dating back to the Dragon War itself. Ah. Maybe you just want to know how to get there. It's near Riverwood, a miserable little village a few miles south of here. I'm sure some of the locals can point you in the right direction once you get there.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.

output: The ancients built many of the fortresses that dot the landscape of Skyrim. Sadly, most have fallen into disrepair. And nearly all have been overrun with bandits or other vagabonds.  Fort Hraagstad is one of the few that remains mostly intact.  We're going to install a garrison there, but first, your going to clean out the bandits that have moved in.

instruction: Generate dialogue in the style of Skyrim.
